Reviews.Title: “What a pity it is near the MRT but the hotel is pitifully bad in every other way.”
Reviews.Author: Travelinghuntsman
Reviews.Content: Room is maybe 16 square meters and every time you shower you turn the water off in the shower just by turning. There is no laundry service, you service them by taking it to reception and then paying up front then 2 or 3 days later you chase after it and they find it then you go to pick it up and it is not even folded just as requested. There are more but I am not going to waste my time telling you them the same as I didn't waste my time at the breakfast after the first day!

Reviews.Title: “Served a purpose and was good value but nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: Alee M
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the V Lavender for 2 nights in April. As most reviews have indicated the rooms are small, ours certainly was. Despite their size, the rooms are functional and well equipped. We were impressed that the staff allowed us to check in early with no extra fee. The service was average, nothing extraordinary. The internet was disappointingly slow and the breakfast buffet was highly priced and low quality. The saving grace for this hotel is location, located above the Lavender MRT, we were able to easily commute to and from the airport and we utilised the MRT for trips to Bugis and Harbour Front. The hotel suited our purpose, a stop over. It certainly wouldn't have been suitable to us for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Thankfully only for one night”
Reviews.Author: fluffybundles
Reviews.Content: We were three adults travelling together and it is particularly difficult to find a room that takes three people. However, we were excited when we found V Hotel Lavender had a three person room for a good cost. Thankfully, it was only for one night. Singapore rooms (having been there previously) are notorious for being small. I don't know whether their room sizes differ at this hotel but it felt like a double bed and single bed had been placed in a room where normally a one double would be. Add three people with three bits of luggage and you have one very squeezey room. The bathroom is badly designed in that the shower door opens out into the main bathroom but doesn't have a clearly level high enough to get over the bath mat. Therefore the mat is far away and the floor is slippery when you step out and even after the first person warned the other two, both found the floor very dangerous. The internet was S$10 for 24 hours but as we were only staying less than 16 hours, they gave it to us for free, which was really nice of them.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and facilities, not so great room”
Reviews.Author: Olie92
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights at V-hotel Lavender. The plus, is of course, its location above Lavender MRT station with tonnes of taxs floating around. There are a lot of food places to choose as weill, while fruit shops are just in next building. Swimming pool is surprisingly nice also. The room was small, which was ok, but felt damp, especially the floor, for some reason. Perhaps need better exhaust system to keep fresh air flowing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in good position”
Reviews.Author: Valerie B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel late March, we found the staff very friendly and efficient, our room was small but good, the only complaint I have is that there was no soap (luckily had some with us) and only towels no other bathroom linen, breakfast was adequate, position was great right on top of MRT, and buses out front, convience store & a 7eleven very close, arcade of shops in hotel building,great pastry shop and plenty of food shops, all good. Caught a shuttle from the airport for $9.00 SGD good shuttle and price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: LarryWong
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at V hotel Lavender during April. The location of this hotel is really convenient, not more than 5-minutes walk from Lavender MRT station. There are 24hrs. Kopitiam, Wendy's & other local restaurants. TLavender Food Centre is also nearby. The sizes of room and bathroom are just good for Asian, but small for Western travellers especially the bathroom. I have stayed in both superior and triple room. Both rooms are clean with big window but there is no view for superior room. No free wifi or internet. Cable TV with good selection of channels.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, close to amenities and food!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ross B
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for people wanting location, location, location.... the lobby is welcoming, staff very friendly and the swimming pool very relaxing!!!! The hotel itself is right beside the MRT and Bugis (shopping Mall) is just one stop away. The rooms are comfy and stylish, checking in and out is a breeze. The restaurant is great but if you are looking for something else, around the corner is a 24hour food stall that serves pretty much everything. We will surely use this hotel on my next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TracyandNeil
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location in Singapore. The MRT is right beside the hotel. The hotel itself? The lobby is very swish, but the rooms and bathrooms are very small. The hotel is clean and the beds comfortable. However, we were quite disappointed by the reception, concierge service. We required a shuttle bus to be organised for us for our transfer back to Changi early in the morning. When we called for front desk to ask them to organise this for us, we were told that, as they did not have their own shuttle bus, we just had to call Changi on our own and were given the number. While this did not inconvenience us, we did think that it was a poor show that a front desk didn't in fact have a service to organise things on behalf of their guests. Nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Charl3s
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Singapore for business and chose this hotel. The hotel is comfortably located next to the MRT-subway station and also hosts several food stalls nearby. These food stalls serve every food you can imagine, and they are a perfect alternative to the provided breakfast at the hotel. The lobby is most of the time quite crowded, but the check in and the check out worked relatively quick. It seems as if several employees are still in training since their handling of the computers looks clumsy. The cleanlyness of the bathroom was not that great. I got the impression that this hotel is most of the time booked to its maximum. Also, there might be some noise on the floors due to passing by families. The pool is surprisingly big, and the hotel also hosts a small gym. The internet works fast via WiFi. I would stay here again on my next sojourn in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value, perfect for unfussy travellers”
Reviews.Author: MrsItchyfeet
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended for unfussy travellers! It's quite near tourist spots, and we enjoyed the convenience of having the MRT right beside it. You may also get taxis in front of the hotel. Mega-Taxis (for big groups) may also be arranged with the concierge. The 24-hour kopitiam and other foodstalls were also a big plus, so no need to avail of the hotel's breakfast. There's a convenience store on the left side, money changer on the right, and a 7-11 and pharmacy down the metro station. We specifically requested rooms "with windows" upon booking and check-in. The Premier Double Room had a very nice view, the superior rooms had none, but it was fine. I read reviews in advance so I brought toilet paper and soap, which were useful. (They provided shampoo, bath gel, lotion, slippers, tissue). After having read bad reviews about the room size, I actually was pleased to find the rooms weren't as tiny as I expected. There were a lot of other tourists but we didn't have to wait long for elevators. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. For the price and location, I highly recommend it, especially for short trips.

Reviews.Title: “It's Alright”
Reviews.Author: EdgeMY
Reviews.Content: It's a popular hotel because it's reasonably priced so the hotel occupancy rate seems to be very high most of the time (stayed here 3 times in 1.5 years). Location is right above the Lavendar MRT station (same line as the Changi Airport line - so you don't have to switch trains). Food court next door, Wendy's around the corner, 7-11 across the road. And that's about its pro's to me. There is nothing spectacular nearby the hotel or is it very near any tourist attractions. Rooms are clean, not the biggest, toilet is fairly small sized. Wifi is NOT free. Stay here IF 1) you are on a budget 2) want to be on the same line as the airport MRT line (so you don't have to switch trains) 3) don't mind small toilets

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value”
Reviews.Author: porge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights. We booked a Superior room and were allocated a room on the 14th floor with expansive city views. The airconditioner worked well, the bed was comfortable, the linen good quality and the room was well serviced daily, including linen change. There was an in-room safety box, two complimentary bottles of water daily along with the usual tea and coffee supplies. The fridge was handy for fruit supplies etc. We stored our suitcases on the ledge beneath the bay window; I think that's what the ledge is for. The bathroom was fine although the size of the shower could be a problem for very large people but there was plenty of hot water and adequate shelf space for toiletries. As others have said, the room is small but for just the two of us we found it big enough as we were out all day sightseeing and really only used the hotel for sleeping and we certainly slept well each night. There were no delays when we checked in/out and whenever we dealt with reception, we were served promptly and efficiently. The lobby was busy at times, but that didn't worry us as we had no need to linger there. Occasionally the lifts were very busy but mostly didn't bother us. As I said, we were out all day so didn't need to ride the lifts very often. Wi-fi was not included in our room rate so instead of paying $10SGD per day to use our own computer, we chose to pay $4 for 30minutes on one of the 3 computers near reception, just to check our emails etc. We did not use the pool but it looked very attractive and quite large for a hotel pool. We found the location of the hotel to be ideal, directly above Lavender MRT station. We caught the MRT from Changi airport on arrival and also back to Changi on departure. Every day we travelled on the MRT at some stage, either for sightseeing, shopping or for evening meals. There are always taxis available outside the hotel lobby which we utilised to get to the zoo and bird park. We did not try the hotel breakfast but instead bought some breakfast supplies from a supermarket at Bugis Junction, just one MRT stop away. There is a fruit store across the road from the hotel and a couple bakeries and other food outlets beside the hotel. We really had no complaints with the Hotel V and at the rate of $155 SGD, we thought it good value and ticked all the boxes for our 9 days in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: OneXaverio
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 times. So I would write a resume so the next guests will know what to expect from this Hotel. a. If you are traveling using MRT, this hotel is the best choice. Located exactly on the top of Lavender MRT, there is no other hotel can beat the easiness of strolling your luggages from Airport to a hotel. b. Lavender MRT itself only a few stops away from the city center. So it will take you only 10 minutes to the Orchard Road or even shorter (3 minutes) to City Hall. c. Large number of other guests in the lobby is to be expected. Since the hotel has 888 rooms, it is considerably normal. Luckily there are at least 5 check-in staffs who are ready to help you, and they usually work fast! And they are very flexible. If you are checking in early, as long as there are free rooms, they won't let you wait until 2pm to enter the room. d. During busy hours (8am-2pm), prepare to wait minimal 10 minutes to use the elevators. (remember: 888 rooms and only 6 elevators, one of them is a fireman's elevator) e. Rooms are tinier than most 3 stars hotel rooms in Singapore. The shower is also tiny, the warm water wasn't stable, sometimes it gets hotter for a few seconds then goes back to normal. f. Most of twin and double rooms have a view to the other side of hotel's building. Which literally you are looking for the other guests' rooms! But it also not comfortable to close the curtain all the time. So: try to get a room at either south or north side of the building. Not in the middle. g. Cold swimming pool with a lot of winds. Tiny fitness room, no wellness area. h. Never tried the breakfast during my stays.. so I can't give any review. i. Kopitiam just around the corner. Open 24hours. Easy but not very tasty. j. Best value goes to a Nasi Lemak stall in just beside the lobby, Only 1,5 $ a portion. What a bargain! but if you go for western food, better go to City Hall or Vivo City. k. Never tried the room service. j. Not to forget: thin room doors.. means you will hear your neighbors slamming the door, Luckily that was usually happened around 8-9pm.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Unexpected Luxury”
Reviews.Author: twisted_bratinella
Reviews.Content: You guessed it right. Main thing we loved about V Hotel Lavender was its Location! Right on top of the Lavender Station which is on the same line as the Airport Station. Made moving around the city so much easier, plus the 24-hour dine-in on the ground floor Kopitiam was a HUGE help as well; we never got hungry! (*wink!*) Other than the Location, V Hotel is actually a relatively new hotel and admittedly the rates are a bit pricier than the average. The thing is it was our first time together in Singapore (me and my husband I mean) and we really did not want to take our chance in any of the Geylang hotels coz all the reviews I've read were Hit and Miss! So we both decided that it would be worth it to pay a bit extra for guaranteed cleanliness and comfort (which we got, 100%). The lobby was a bit busy when we checked in but we're not really the fussy primadonna types of travellers plus we were actually coming from another SG hotel (Asphodel Inn, which I've also done a Review on) so we were not tired at all and could afford to be a bit more patient. Anyway despite the tons of guests checking in and out, there were at least 5 Concierge and the one who checked us in was quite fast, Express if you call it, which was a plus. I'm gonna give you a really USEFUL ROOM TIP. We were initially checked into the 13th Floord (13-75) which was ok for the size and all, but it was right in the middle facing the other Hotel building and you could see right through the other guests' hote room! This was a BIG NO-NO for me, how uncomfortable was that??! I did not want to have to close the curtains the whole time! I don't know if that was the case for most rooms as well, but I corteously asked the same staff at the lobby to pls transfer us to a room where it would be more conspicous at least. And he put us on the Topmost floor (15th) at the farthest end room (15-50), which offered spectacular views of the city. :) So there you go. GET A ROOM AT THE FARTHEST END OF THE HALLWAY IF YOU DO NOT WANT TO BE SOME SORT OF FREAK SHOW OR AT LEAST FEEL LIKE A PEEPING TOM TO THE OTHER GUESTS. ;) So I knew we were paying for comfort and cleanliness, which we happily got, but what we did not expect was LUXURY! V Hotel Lavender rooms are yes a bit small compared to the general hotel room sizes all over the world (but I would assume that the room size is standard to Singapore hotels), but trust me when I say it was a beautiful and well-kept room. Everything was up to standards: the flat TV, the dark wood furnishings, the huge comfortable bed, the bathroom, the toiletries... It was definitely worth our money. Though the shower stall might be a bit too revealing if you are not staying with your partner (glass doors ;)) but you can always just close the main bathroom door right? We also got to use the hotel pool, the gym was not exactly a gym; just a couple of equipments but good enough... All in all, V Hotel Lavender is a great place to stay at if you are willing to pay a bit more. Definitely WORTH IT. I won't hesitate coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is conveniently located, modern, clean, with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: TheIgorotTourist
Reviews.Content: For a first time visitor who's read a lot of reviews, it's difficult to look for a room to suit a family with kids. I did my booking through their website and their customer service officer was very accomodating. They are transparent with the costs so no surprises when you pay upon check-in. It is an easy 3-4 minutes walk from the MRT lavender station (with children and senior citizen in tow). They say it is a budget hotel, but the services are 4star for my standards. The superior room is just right for a family of two adults and one child (at no extra cost). Complimentary bottled water, coffee and tea are supplied everyday.Wifi is also free, just ask for the username and password from the front desk staff. Room is made everyday so the linens, pillows and CR are always clean with fresh towels and toiletries. The safety deposit box fits a laptop so no worries with your valuables. A delightful pool is on the 4th floor and there are six lifts to accomodate guests. Free luggage storage is also available. Best part of this hotel are the staff, especially the Filipinos in the frontdesk who are very welcoming and helpful. Highly recommended. Your best choice for an affordable and comfortable stay in Singapore. Tips: Food stalls are two minutes away, with Kopitiam giving you an array of affordable choices (if you are not choosy, the food stall nearest to the hotel offers meals at S$2.80) . Bottled water is S$1.20 a liter in the fruit store across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Well recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_IrelandShazza
Reviews.Content: My friend & i spent three days in Singapore in March and decided to stay in V Hotel Lavender. From the welcome we received when we arrived to the farewell when we left, we agreed we were extremely happy with outr stay. We could not find any complaints. The staff were very friendly and the hotel was very clean. The rooms were a tad small, but hey, who goes to Singapore to stay in a room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Room with Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer054
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little outside downtown but is directly on top of the metro line so it's reasonably convienent. The room was simple and small (as one might expect in Singapore) but overall a good place. The service was quite poor though. The baggage storage was grumpy and slow, calls to the front desk were ignored on numerous occassions and curt on others, and on the last day we wanted breakfast to go but the front desk told us it wasn't available. All of the breakfast staff however told us it was but had to be ordered through the front desk. The breakfast (included in the more expensive room pakcage) wasn't very good. Overall if you just want a simple room and get a great price than it's a decent place to stay. If not somewhere else may be better.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned accomodation,well priced”
Reviews.Author: Smiley061
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year,beginning of October 2011. I havent had a chance to write this review.It is well located,the mrt station is just behind the hotel It is a new hotel about 1 year old. I stayed in a twin room, size was adequate. Room gets cleaned every day. Clean bathroom.. Front desk was quite good at printing out maps and assisting with places to visit. Arab street is about 15 minutes walk (or you can take the tram) as well as getting to Mustapha centre is about a 15 minutes walk. There is a money exchange counter right outside the hotel.If you need to take a taxi anywhere they stop right in front of hotel. Also 2 grocery stores across the road and a grocery store around the side of hotel which is open til late at night. I did not eat breakfast in hotel but here are quite a few places just outside the hotel which serves different types of cuisines,including a bakery. All in all it was a great stay and i would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “V for Vacuous”
Reviews.Author: n l e
Reviews.Content: Very few positives about this hotel. The most I can say is that it is clean, has a great pool and is cheap. This a stopover hotel; not a hotel for a holiday. The rooms are tiny; not small. Reminds me of a Formula 1 hotel in Australia. Nowhere to put luggage in the room; careful you dont trip over on the way to the toilet in the night! No amenities like a hairdryer for example. Does have a small fridge which is good. Breakfast wasnt too bad but pricey at 14AUD. Other than Wendys in the foodcourt nearby, nowhere else to have non Asian food. Yes there is the MRT station close by, which is good because the hotel isnt close to anything. Our booking was for a queen bed; initially given 2 singles; my husband eventually negotiated an upgrade to a Superior room. What a joke; wouldnt have liked to see a lesser room. A family also checking in at same time also had problems. Staying 2 nights; booked 2 rooms, were given 1 room with 2 single beds! Only worth the 1AUD ( yes one dollar!) we paid. If there ever was a next time, they would need to pay me to stay.

Reviews.Title: “biz hotel close to town”
Reviews.Author: russiabear
Reviews.Content: located right on the lavender mrt station, this is the way hotels of the future should go. (similar to w taipei hotel) on the ground floor is the hotel reception, and in the same building and level is a food court and wendy's! biz hotel so dont expect fancy stuff. is just sleep and watch some tv. they have a few cable channels, nothing like the fancy hotels. price is right for the location. but there isnt much to do around the hotel area since it is slightly off the main biz and shopping districts. but with the subway station just below, it is convenient to travel to other parts of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent locations, clean but small.”
Reviews.Author: Momofagal
Reviews.Content: The hotel just sit "ON" the underground station. So it's perfect for going anywhere. The room is quite small, but enough for staying. It's a bit smelly (of some unfresh air). I'll choose it for a budget hotel, but don't book for breakfast. Breakfast was just terrible (especially for that price). The food court and food shops besides hotel is quite convenience too.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: Unexpectedly, this hotel is next to the MRT station at Lavender. While not in the centre of Singapore, if you're prepared to use the MRT (cheap and easy), then its great. Small rooms. Clean. Good service. Helpful staff. Local food downstairs - chicken curry and rice for S$2.50. Worth staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Low cost hotel with poor service”
Reviews.Author: JamesKantor
Reviews.Content: We started off badly - I wasn't informed that I had to pay all my nights in advance (something that UK budget hotels tend to do, by the way) and the little cheesy sign telling me there were no refunds right at the counter had me concerned. As others have said - the rooms are just too small, poorly decorated, there are too many of them and the lobby and elevator areas feel like a low cost airport. I don't care how many pretty pictures they have on the website, there are just too many people in the hotel and you are constantly surrounded by crowds. This place is a budget tourist hotel on a massive scale. The staff are trained to make sure the business runs smoothly - but they have no training in how to make a visitor feel valued. "You realize you have to pay for that..." That sort of non-sense and nothing like what any kind of "luxury" hotel would do. And, although it's not their fault, everyone running the front desk are rather young and are not too smooth with English. No one was ever rude to me, but I got the feeling I was working with a budget car rental office when talking to them. This is sad considering Southeast Asia and Singapore in particular have such a great standard of fine customer service. So, why did I and do people stay here? It's less than a year old and the price is low. I was there for 10 nights and after 5 nights upgraded to a Premier room. My colleague complained upon check in and was not charged all nights in advance and he left after 5 days to another hotel. Although nothing terribly unacceptable happened, I cannot recommend this hotel and won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of basic essentials.”
Reviews.Author: Robert Y
Reviews.Content: The room was clean but we felt that there should have been more basic essentials. We were only provided with two bath towels. No face or hand towels and no soap. We had to purchase our own soap at a convenience store. Ice is not provided and had to be purchased outside as well. Although the room was clean, I would not recommend this facility to others. The elevators are extremely slow and very stuffy due to the humidity of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a good place to crash”
Reviews.Author: Arnab D
Reviews.Content: The things that stands out about the V hotel is that a) it is superbly located above Lavender MRT and b) is comparatively new and hence feels nice. we had a superior room and it had just enough space for the bed.... that's about it. so the only thing that you could do in the room was to go and sleep. with a 2 year old hyperactive baby with us, sleeping was the best choice. The bathroom is very small and lacks ventilation - so be sure to have a foggy room post a shower. The MRT station is right below the hotel and that makes travel across singapore a breeze. Moreover, there was a convenience store, a 24 hr Kopitian [food court] and a number of bakeries near the hotel that provide multiple food options - good choices to catch a satisfying breakfast. In a world of free Wifi - the hotel charges 10SGD for a 24 hr connection; avoid. The reception is always crowded with people checking in or checking out. the checkin can be quick or painful depending on the crowd there when you arrive. But overall a decent choice for a quick stay in singapore. the pool is awesome and the gym overlooks the pool with

Reviews.Title: “Extremely small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Shipping
Reviews.Content: Rooms are Tiny and overprized. Location is not very Central so you Need to take subway to all sights. Avoid hotels Wifi. It is not working well, people sat with laptops in the hallways to get wifi reception. Wifi is 10 SGD for 24 hours at the hotel. If you just need connection for iphone/ipad Go to the Kiosk just around the corner of the hotel and get a Local Singtel Simcard instead. Costs 15 SGD and you can get a 7 Day package with 3GB data at 8 SGD. This can be deducted from the 15 SGD balance you get with the SIM card.

Reviews.Title: “MRT station in your very door step”
Reviews.Author: suku_feet
Reviews.Content: PROS: near MRT station food (and hawker or food stall) are easily to find with a sensible-price CONS: small room very impressive with the location which conveniently located right at the exit of Lavender MRT station. From Changi, we only need to change the MRT at Tanah Merah (as almost everybody does) and take only one MRT line thereafter. Altough it's a bit far from Orchard by MRT but it's quite near with Marina area and the famous retail-store Mustafa Center. funny thing that before staying here, I previously recommended this place to my sis in law who's travelling with her 2 daughters, since I considered their safety, and indeed they love it and plan to get back there. when my hubby and me stayed there, we cant help ourselves to plan to go back there with all of our children. The room is small (just like any other 3stars hotel in Singapore do) so it may cause troube for European or American with high and big figure for accessing the bathroom, but for ASIAN with small figure like us ? that's not trouble at all. The breakfast rate provided by the hotel is pricey, (as my sister quoted that the food are so-so either), but you can find any kind of food (mainly ASIAN food wih one American Fast food) with good taste and surprisingly cheap. And when the time came to sight-seeing, just go down and use MRT, what else you asked for?

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the cocktails”
Reviews.Author: sarescrow
Reviews.Content: We (three female friends) stayed here for two nights. Location is great as it is right by Lavender station so we took the train from Changi direct to the hotel. Room was compact but totally fine for what we needed. Great big windows where you can watch the workd go by! Bathroom was very small and had no ventilation so it got incredibly steamy even after a quick shower. Wifi not free SGD10. If your rate doesn't include breaky don't buy it here SGD14 for the lousiest selection (I've had better options at USD15 per night guest houses!) Pool was lovely - so we decided to grab a poolside cocktail to celebrate the start of our trip... SGD14 for a daiquiri that came in what can only be described as a urine sample cup with a lid on it! It was barely even two mouthfuls! What a joke! Invest in some plastic glasses!!! Gym was good with a nice view of the pool. All in all a good hotel for sleeping - not eating and drinking ;)

Reviews.Title: “Small but convenient”
Reviews.Author: SydneySamantha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March. The location of the hotel is the main reason why we chose this hotel. The hotel is right on the top of Lavender MRT. From Changi Airport to Lavender MRT only cost S$3.00 per person. We struggled for few days on whether to book this hotel or not, as some comments emphised that the hotel room is terrible small. So, by the day we arrived, we were sort of anticipated that hotel room would not be big. For the price we paid, we were quite happy for the size of the room. Room size - small, hardly find space to place our luggages. The bath room is tiny but enough for me. Like most of the travelers, we didn't stay in the hotel room for long time. All we need is a clean place to stay and sleep. In terms of this, the room size is OK. What do you expect for this price?! Location - I wil give 5 stars. We relied on MRT a lot when we stayed in Singapore. There are a 24/7 food centre right at the ground floor of the Lavender MRT. The foods are good and the price is resonable. Service - Good. The hotel staff does the housekeepting every day. It is good enough for me. Enviroment - We lived at the 9th floor, couldn't hear any nosie at all. However, if your room is close to the lift, you might hear the nosie of the guests. Facility - We didn't try the hotel restaurant, so no comments on this. The swimming pool is better than we expenced. It is a 1.5m dept out door pool. It is even better than the swimming pool of Royal Plaze on Scotts which is a five stars hotel. The only downside is the Wifi is not free! It costs S$10.00 a day to use the Wifi, even in the lobby area, Wifi is not free. Overall, it worths the price. Keep in mind, for this price, we certainly cannot expect the hotel room can be as big as those five stars hotels. I would like to spend my money on the food and other activities.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and crowded hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManojLunkad
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in Hotel V, its a budget hotel. The rooms are very small, shower is even smaller, you can hardly turn in the shower. Breakfast buffet was very basic. there are so many guests in the hotel that the lift is always crowded. Shifted to Carlton hotel the next day, paid the same price as at the V. would not recommend for a traveller who wants some breathing space in his room

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Ducky123
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in Singapore! It has the best staff, best location, and very high standards for cleanliness and service. The Reception, concierge, and breakfast staff is excellent, especially the manager William and reception agent Jayson. Their spirit of service made my stay very special. The room was also excellent, not too small as stated by some of the other reviews. I had a great view and the cleaning staff always did an excellent job. The Singapore spirit of friendliness is alive and well at the V Hotel Lavender.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BrendaBrynn
Reviews.Content: I gave 4 stars for the location cause it's very good since it's right above the Lavender MRT Station and there are bus stops in front and across the hotel. Makes travelling to and from the airport easy, and anywhere else. Price is a little steep during high season but that's OK since we can save on cab fare cost and took MRT n buses instead. Don't worry about getting a room with no breakfast cause there's a 24-hour foodcourt (KopiTiam) and they serve Singapore breakfast, so eat like a local (kaya toast, sof-boiled egg, Kopi-O, etc). Front office service is average, they don't smile at all, don't even look at you in the face sometimes, but again, that's OK for us too as long as we have our key card. Concierge and bell boy are very nice, though, they assisted us when we need to leave our luggage since we had a late flight. Rooms are average, shower cubicle is a bit too small and there are no trash bins inside the bathroom. But all in all, I definitely will come back to this hotel, mainly because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay if you are a budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: gregntrees
Reviews.Content: Its one of Singapore's new budget hotel with quality higher than 3 stars hotel. Room a bit small but after all you will need the room for you to sleep. Very good and helpful Reception and Concierge team, Average breakfast, Excellent location because just beside Lavender MRT station, so its very easy to reach any places in Singapore. Thank you to security and bell boy to their assistances to our large group !

Reviews.Title: “In Singapore you can find much better,”
Reviews.Author: FranLondoner
Reviews.Content: the hotel is ok but the services that offers are really poor,10 dollar to get wifi connection with just one device, when we asked for hands towels we ve been told that this hotel doesn't provide them, even with a premiere room,after completing a tour of south east Asia we found the hotels in Vietnam more accommodating than this hotel!the staff ok but not great!

Reviews.Title: “Good for city trip”
Reviews.Author: Erlanger2
Reviews.Content: Right above the Lavender MRT stop with many food places, this place is ideal for touring singapore. Even on the budget side (in singapore terms!) though, the hotel is slightly pricey. The pool is in the shade therefore cold. No service around the pool to speak of and you probably don't want to buy ridiculously priced beer from the hotel when the 7-11 right outside can supply it for a fraction of the price. The place is hugely popular with tour groups so the lobby seems like a grand central.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: nskfun
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the hotel in Sept 2011. its a nice and clean hotel although the rooms a bit small but understandble. the connectivity is very good. Lavender station is jst next to the enterance. The food court Kopitiam is in the ground floor as well so u can have nice food 24 hrs. its near to little india as well. enjoyed the stay here and would like to definately visit again

Reviews.Title: “Great to reach by public transport”
Reviews.Author: arno_austria
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel that you can easily reach by subway. Get on the train at the airport ( towards joon koo) and get off at Lavender. Make sure you get a room with view. Otherwise you might look at the other tower of the hotel and have to close curtains all time to have privacy.

Reviews.Title: “lovely ambience”
Reviews.Author: luthi_dwi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at premier room for 2 nights with my father . it has a very large window that makes the room looks a litle bigger than its actual size, I love the view from the window . the room has all we need . also the mrt station just under the building . the room has a dark purple touch that makes your eyes comfory and relax . so going to stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!! (Its Singapore - rooms are always going to be small so get over it!)”
Reviews.Author: jhoppy01
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying - we have travelled to many countries so the rooms are not going to be as big as places in Canada, USA, UK, Australia, Bali, Malaysia etc so realise this & you will be happy in Singapore! I stayed here for 7 nights in February/March 2012 and found it to be excellent! I arrived at 4.15am, was greeted by happy smiling young faces and was promptly given a room on the 10th floor. However, it smelled of smoke (and the bathroom reeked of curry - I like curry BUT not smelling it continually) so asked for another room which was non problematic. Front Desk member, a lovely girl named Isa came with me to make sure I was okay with the next room on the 8th floor (after she had a sniff of the room on the 10th floor and apologised repeatedly for the bad smells) and sent someone up to clean the bathroom (as it also smelled like curry - weird!) which thankfully did not smell of smoke and eventually the bathroom smelled lovely. The staff have no problems with you complaining, they are there to make you happy which they did. BUT I always ask politely which is why we have no troubles on our travels (well, except for 2 hotels in the USA but they were rude to many). I read many reviews on this hotel with people complaining that the staff werent friendly or polite - well, they were to me! Mind you, Im friendly & polite to the staff so thats probably why I had no problems with the customer service. Remember, its a 2-way street and as a traveller, we should show good manners which I must admit, I saw rarely from guests. However, I saw staff respond to rudeness very politely & efficiently. You have to realise that this is a HUGE hotel (888 rooms!!!) so with the 1000s of people that go through the doors daily, the staff arent going to remember every person that comes in to the hotel! BUT the staff are polite, efficient & helpful. BE POLITE, I am sick of seeing rude tourists who feel they have every right to treat staff like rubbish and feel that they are privileged so can be rude (NO!!) - we are embarassed by the behaviour of many. Room - clean, new, great view of the Kallang River, quiet (apart from the person above me scraping his chair on the floor every night at 11.30pm for an hour!), far away from the lift. Bed was hard but I have a firm bed at home so I was fine. Bathroom was clean & showers had excellent pressure. Aircon was just right. Location - excellent! Right on top of the awesomely clean & efficient MRT - only 2 stops from City Hall and it only took me 27mins to get to the airport (took me 20+mins in a taxi at 4am which cost $25). Close enough to the city BUT far enough away from busy areas to be quiet. Right over a food hall (the Kopitiam where I didnt eat as I couldnt quite understand what the food was - Im a vegetarian - but it smelled great & was open 24hours and was always busy) but a Wendy's and bakeries, fruit n vegie store etc were here/nearby too. Pool area - spotless & gorgeous!!! A pool where you can actually do laps for fitness - it was at least 25m long. Gym - small BUT efficient for keeping the fitness up. Mind you with all the walking you will do in Singapore, you dont need the gym. I would happily stay here again! AND I will as we are looking to go back in November this year

Reviews.Title: “NIce and cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenyTsubasa10
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel on december (chrismast). we stayed for 3 nights only,but i and my family was very enjoy to stay in this hotel.the room was not too large but comfort enough. all the staffs were very helpful and gave me a lot of information's about everything's that we asked for.i was really enjoy also to got the breakfast, the french fries and the potato was very crispy enough....eehhhmmmmmm

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Tiny rooms....”
Reviews.Author: KawaiDolce
Reviews.Content: Location location location! MRT station is right beside the hotel, once there you can practically get to anywhere in Singapore. Restaurants, food court and shops lined up in a neat pavilion connected to the hotel building. Food court boasts a variety of average local food 24 hours! We booked a triple room. Tiny it was. Hard have enough space for two person to stand side by side in front of the bed! And its a triple room at that, can't imagine how the usual twin room would look like. It was expected but still overwhelming. Clean and cozy nevertheless. Squeeky clean toilet though the shower compartment is so small you have to be careful turning around without banging yourself to the walls, I am petite at that. Strong detergent smell from the floor that irritates my nose upon arrival to the room. All in all, clean, cozy tiny rooms. Don't expect more than an ordinary decent place to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here in November”
Reviews.Author: 40again
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of Nov 2011 for 3 nights, in a triple room. It was absolutely fine..very small yes, but there was enough room for our luggage without us tripping over it. Room was comfortable and very clean. Beds were a bit on the hard side (altho they were actually soft when compared to thailand!) Room hadnt been cleaned until late afternoon, but this wasnt a problem anyway as we were out most of the time. Some people would probably pick on this, but some people whinge about anything! lol,..I mean, theres alot of rooms, so obviously they cant all be cleaned first! Kettle in room and small fridge, which was very handy. Also a safe in the wardrobe. Great location, just walk down to catch the mrt, or to get food. We were able to leave our luggage there before check-in, and even use the pool area, as we had arrived early. Also on day of check out, once again were able to leave our luggage there For what it cost, I feel it was good value. Only bad thing Id have to say was up in the pool area, very tiny change room and the toilets up near the restaurant were actually very dirty. I Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Room like a cell”
Reviews.Author: LeavemeinBali
Reviews.Content: Our last night on our South East Asia travels and what an anti climax! From the moment we walked up to the reception desk to be met with indifference and a bored staff member who gave us the key and left us to find the room and take the luggage up to a room that was one step up from a prison cell. We could barely fit in the door with our suitcases. The room was as basic as you can get. Bed, shower, toilet, TV, small cupboard and a view of a wall one metre from the window. The fittings are dark, with dark brown tiled floor, dark laminate cupboards. The wallpaper was peeling off the wall. It was depressing and we could not wait to get out.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location but small and dusty floor”
Reviews.Author: Henryanj
Reviews.Content: I checked in at 29 feb till 2 march, the location is perfect, above the mrt station, minimarket and 24 hours food stall, i give 5 stars for the location. The room itself is small and doesnt have a carpet, so if you dont wear a slipper , your leg will feel cold. One thing i hate most is they dont clean the floor, there's a dust on the floor, the bathroom is clean but theres no trash can, the service is average. Final words : if you have a tight budget, its okay to stay here, if you have more budget, theres many better option.

Reviews.Title: “great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: allthatisbeautiful
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Dec 2011 for 3 nites and absolutely loved it. Our flight arrived very early in the morning and we were pleasantly allowed to check-in early which provided us a well needed rest , sleep and a quick shower before we head out for sightseeing. Tle location was just what we wanted, very accessible to/from the airport, and mrt lavender station is just a few steps away from the hotel., it is so easy to get around .. The Kopitiam which serves delicious and affordable food is available 24/7 . The room was clean, modern, comfortable and quiet, There is a coffee/tea making facilities,and 2 bottled water for free which they replenished daily. The fridge in our room was not working ,soon after I reported it, a maintenance person came up and checked on it , an hour later brought a new fridge...such a nice service. Our onward flight was not due till 7pm , though we had checked-out we were able to leave our luggages at concierge and was able to do more shopping with our free time. The staff that I encountered were all polite, attentive and efficient , the e-mails that I sent prior to our arrival were replied to accordingly. We had an amazing time in Singapore and this hotel added to our fun-filled holiday. we are coming back on Dec. Thank you very much...

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Vladimir N
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and me stayed there for 3 nights in the triple room with breakfast. It is very good location for travellers who want to spent the whole day out of hotel and just need bed and bathroom. Who are expecting luxery and large room they should look for other hotel but for above mentioned travellers it is very good choice. Room was small but cleaned and furnished with all necessary. Location of the hotel is perfect because subway is just one minute from the hotel. Internet is availble but against payment. 24 hours cost 70 SGD. Provided services meet the price and we can just recommed to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great view.”
Reviews.Author: Frietbenen
Reviews.Content: Very nice and helpful staff. Great location. The rooms look very nice and are very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fulfills very basic needs”
Reviews.Author: Wei Ling T
Reviews.Content: Had a staycation over the weekend. This hotel fulfills all your basic needs. Staff are not exactly friendly; they don't smile but they are polite and get work done. Room is small but typical of most cheap hotel rooms in Singapore. The room is clean, bedsheets/towels are clean. But the remote control for the tv and the mini-fridge wasn't working well. The hotel does not provide tissues and handsoap. But overall it was still a comfortable stay as we are not that fussy over these things. If you are on a budget, don't bother buying the hotel's breakfast. There are many 24/7 eateries outside the subway station which provide cheaper options and greater variety to try out local food.

Reviews.Title: “It's about location...”
Reviews.Author: TAGT2010
Reviews.Content: Hands down, the location of V Hotel is very convenient for tourists. The station is just one minute away, it's literally right beside it. There is Kopitiam beside the mrt that is open 24/7 so don't have to order food from the hotel. HOWEVER, if you're into shopping, this is not the place to be. There are no shops beside the hotel. The hotel is surrounded by HDBs (local housing). So if you like to shop, say, in Orchard, it would take you around 20 minutes to go back to your hotel to leave your stuff... Or if you shop in Marina Bay Sands, allot 20 minutes also to go back to the hotel. If that's ok for you, then V Hotel is ok. To and fro airport is very easy also. The MRT beside the hotel will bring you to the airport, just transfer at Tana Merah. And if your flight back home is still in the afternoon (and check out is at 11), you can leave your bags with the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Use for 1 night stopover only”
Reviews.Author: Greg P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at V Lavender on transit to Ho Chi Minh. The rooms are very small. I wouldn't stay there for more than 1 night. We had 2 rooms and the fridge in our room didn't work. Smallest bathroom I have ever seen with very mouldy ceiling. Close to MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Okay!”
Reviews.Author: snowflakecarling
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 2 nights after being in India and KL..Everything you read about the reviews is what you should expect. I was not at all surprised. -Small rooms -Slow lifts -Crowded No face cloths or hand towels in the bathroom, hard small-ish bed, no glasses to drink out of only coffee mugs. More of a private hostel room than a hotel room. Everything for us was modern and clean, but dont expect any luxuries. We would probably try somewhere else next time but it was fine for us! They gave us free wi-fi (4 codes to use for 2 nights) but not sure if its cause we mentioned it was our honeymoon. They looked after our bags for us while we spent the last day touring Singapore before our 8:30pm flight home. The food court outside the hotel at the station was good and cheap but almost NO vegetarian food (hard to find anywhere in Singapore) Did not go to the restaurant because by looking at the menu it was a total ripoff!!! All in all, okay! Would suggest to anyone staying in Singapore 1 or 2 nights. Lavender was a good location and easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, great location near MRT”
Reviews.Author: YiliKR
Reviews.Content: We booked a Superior Room, which was small but probably normal for Singapore standards. You don't have much walking space in a room and couldn't fit more than 2 people in their standard room. Bed was pretty comfortable, and they let us check in really early without a fee (7.30am!) which was convenient. We didn't have breakfast included, but would recommend not getting it anyway and try the local food in the food court next to the hotel which was great. Pool was nice though could have done with more lounge chairs. Pros: Great location with Lavender MRT literally next to the hotel which was great, and good bakery and food-court next to the hotel and MRT (Kopitiam) which was great for breakfast and snacks. They kept luggage for us after we checked out too. Cons: We had a water leak from our air-conditioning vent onto the floor near the door, but the maintenance staff did fix it. Service at the hotel was pretty good even though it was very busy. Overall, very reasonable price for a nice stay in Singapore. We stayed in 2 other hotels in Singapore and they weren't as good. Would recommend, especially if you can get a good price. Cons:

Reviews.Title: “2 nights stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: HeikkiA
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in Singapore, right after long flight from Europe. This hotel has an excellent location on top of the metro station, and so very easy and fast to reach from airport. Also access to other location in Singapore is very convenient. Hotels lobby is nice and clean, but slightly over crowded easily. Public areas and rooms are clean, but rooms are very small and atleast our room was also bit dark. Hotels pool area is actually quite nice, with reasonable view. Water was surprisingly cold.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dt_2lesta
Reviews.Content: We had booked a twin room for three nights. On first impression, the lobby is very nice and the hotel has been done up nicely. However the door staff were a immature and unprofessional, and only rarely opened the doors, and weren't very helpful with bags. The room was very small (kind of expected that in Singapore) and the furnishings were average; the bathroom was tiny. We had a leak in the bathroom sink, and instead of fixing it when we told them about it, they did a quick temporary job which would suffice until the next people came! We bought the breakfast, which I thought was very good and had a wide selection. The room service was also good and well priced, with quick service. A few complaints however; firstly that the housekeeping cleans rooms far too late, often they would not come until 5pm by which time we had returned to get ready for the evening. Also, I was disappointed that they refused to sent a porter up to my room to help me with my luggage even though I had an injury, they said I had to pay which I thought was a bit weird for a hotel which claims it is 4*. Thirdly, I think a lot of tourist groups use this hotel, which meant that at check out times, everything was totally hectic, with luggage everywhere, and the staff being unable to cope. And lastly, although there was internet near the lobby, I thought it was very overpriced. Overall, the hotel is in a good location (Lavender MRT), and it was a comfortable stay. However I felt they were aiming too out of their league, and this is nothing more than an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, not great service”
Reviews.Author: Samyukth
Reviews.Content: Had booked a Triple room, which is hard to find in Singapore. Room was small which was to be expected. The pros were location near MRT and free locl calls. My issues were that the front desk staff weren't super helpful, the lobby was always crowded with people and it was hard to get attention. Housekeeping didn't show up to the room all day and when we came back to the room at night, We found that it hadn't been cleaned. Upon complaining, someone showed up in 30 minutes. They forgot to give us 1 of the towels for which we had to call again. For the price we paid, I expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor service and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Almopos
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is its convenient location above the Lavender MRT station. The hotel is massive and lacks any character. The receptionist are not friendly. During my stay I talked to about 5 different receptionists and I did not get the impression that they were concerned with the wellbeing of their guests and making their guests' stay as pleasant as possible. Check in was chaotic. Although we arrived at the hotel around 4:00 p.m. we were told that our room was not ready as it had to be cleaned. We were asked to wait in an overcrowded lobby for half an hour. When we were finally brought up to our room and started unpacking we noticed to our surprise that the room had not been cleaned properly as we found soap residue in the sink and the shower as well as a dirty sock and used cotton swabs in the room, plastic bags under the bed etc. I complained to an indifferent receptionist and nothing happened. On day two in the afternoon we returned to a room which was cleaned a bit better but found that the cleaning staff forgot the pillow cases in the room. On day three of our stay we we left the hotel in the morning to return around 7:00 pm. To our surprise our room had not been cleaned. The room was cleaned only after complaining several times. We were offered free breakfast for the next morning which we accepted. Unfortunately, the breakfast selection was poor and the food was not good and mostly cold. In addition the staff was rude. In conclusion, I would suggest potential guest to stay away from this dirty hotel with indifferent and rude personal.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant!!”
Reviews.Author: Clair_Archie
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at this hotel and it was not a very pleasant experience!!! The hotel was over crowded.. it is a large hotel that seems to have more guests than its staff can manage!! The lobby was always overflowing with people and luggage and the lifts full! Our room was very small and the bathroom too... its a good thing my partner and I are small people.. I dread to think how uncomfortable if would have been for a larger couple! When we arrived in our room on our first night we were greeted by a cockroach on the wall next to the bed!! We killed it but then during the early hours of the morning I went to the bathroom and found another one!! We found it difficult to get to sleep because of the noise from a bar across the street that was having some kind of karaoke music night playing very loud music! We were then woken up at 3am by the room phone ringing, reception made a mistake dialing the room number for an early morning wake up call!! Great, thanks!.. It wouldn't have been so bad if the phone was by the bed, but its not.. it was the other side of the room which meant I had to get out of bed to answer it!! Our room was right next to the elevators so we heard everyone on our floor come and go at all hours.. in addition to this the corridors had tiled floors so any noise anyone made in the corridor just echoed loudly!! Its a good thing I had brought ear plugs with us!! The bathroom in our room was not only tiny but smelly and not very well cleaned when we arrived... the extractor in the bathroom didn't seem to work so that after showering the steam just lingered in the room for hours making it smell damp and musty! nothing dried in there.. the tiles, mirror and towels were still wet 5 hours after we had showered!! There is clearly a problem with the ventilation! Although the staff did come and make our moderately comfortable bed they unfortunately did not clean our tiny bathroom during our 3 night stay.. but we did get clean towels once! On the second morning I went to the bathroom and a 3rd cockroach fell on me!! It then ran about the bathroom, in the shower and vanished through a crack in the tiles!! Not the best way to start the day!! The air conditioning in the room was great when we wanted the room to be 23 degree's... but when I went to change the temperature I found that I couldn't ... it was set at 23 degree's so I could either switch it on or turn the fan up!! Annoying! Just outside our room there had obviously been a leak or a problem with the corridor ceiling, the hotel had covered up the large hole in the ceiling with a black plastic bag... from this hole came some nasty smells and from the air conditioning unit next to the elevators on floor 5... not nice!! The breakfast was an odd buffet mix.. of which only the baked beans were worth eating, everything else was vile!! The fruit juice was watered down and the milk had ice in it which diluted it! It was also very busy at breakfast...we went at different times on the 3 separate mornings and it still felt over crowded... the staff were not great at quickly refilling the empty buffet serving trays either! Don't drink the coffee.. it tastes like watered down mud and to buy a coffee a the bar during breakfast cost $10!! We were upset that we had to pay $10 for 24 hours of wifi internet.. when we have stayed in much cheaper hotels and wifi has been free... we also found that we could only use the wifi password they gave us after paying on just one devise... so if you sign on to the wifi with your i phone... you can not later sign on with you laptop!! Stupid!! Our check out was confusing....we had stayed for 3 nights but had originally booked for 4 ... the hotel wanted to still charge us for the one night we weren't there.. that just didn't seem right!! Im still waiting for them to e mail with a copy of the invoice after discussing it with them... its been 3 days and still nothing!! Surprise surprise!! The toilets near the hotels lobby are discussing too... they hadn't been cleaned all day and had urine all over the floor... you had to pay $0.10 for a piece of toilet paper even if you were a guest at the hotel!! Thats just wrong!! We will NOT be staying there again!!! We had the impression that this hotel only cared about making money and did not care about their guests!! Its a shame because the hotel is in a great location!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodation for value but poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Matshardal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Accomodation for four nights, close proximity to transport. On face vale it appears professional however once checked in there was no customer service even when you requested housekeeping nobody would come. Tour desk was a big help and night safari and universal studios are a must. MRT next door for trains but found taxi cheap enough to use most of the time. No soap so bring your own, rooms are small but comfortable. Cocktails in bar were pricey and inconsistent in size.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Y_Kit
Reviews.Content: The main reason i stayed at this hotel is because of the location to MRT. From Changi Airport, you will reach the Lavender station once you boarded the Tanah Merah MRT interchange. Less than a minutes walk and you will reach the hotel and it is a covered walking path. No worries at all if it is raining. Upon reaching, check in was fast and headed to the room on the 12th floor. My room is a family room and is facing the Kallang river which is good if you would like to see some sceneries. Room and bath room is small but enough for us as we are not big size. Overall room layout is ok except for there is no mirror in the room. And imagine for the ladies they have to go to bathroom to do their makeup, hairdo and etc which is not convenient at all. They do provide a safe box, hair dryer, water boiler for you to make some tea. About the hotel lobby, I noticed there is always a huge crowd and sometimes I might get some unsafe feelings as I am not really sure whether they are a valid hotel guest. The elevators are near to the main entarnce which makes it easy for them to sneak around the hotel and just follow you up. Another plus point for the hotel is the convenience to eating shops, money changer, ATM machines. One 24hours kopitiam available round the clock just in case if you are hungry, you can just drop by and have some snacks. I will definitely stay at this hotel in my next trip to SIngapore.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Room is too small”
Reviews.Author: Zuraidah
Reviews.Content: Although we booked the family room which is a triple room , it was too small for us. Only 1 person can move about in the room while the other 2 have to sit on the bed. The bathroom is also too small. Not suitable for family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure to come back”
Reviews.Author: Discursus
Reviews.Content: This marks our third visit to V Hotel Lavender, again using Agoda. It's a shame that the cancellation/rebooking penalty applies to at least three days before as work had unexpectedly come up, but considering it wasn't too expensive to begin with, I guess it's fine. The hotel is still always full, but service is quick. There are always a lot of people hanging out in the lobby (for free internet perhaps?) and the racks are always full of bags that people have left while they've checked out but explored the city before their flights. It definitely helps that the hotel is right above an MRT stop, so it's easy to come and go. The things I most appreciate about V Hotel Lavender are: Location!, room cleanliness, strong hot and cold shower, ease of use of hotel key in room. Will always come back to V Hotel Lavender -- for what we pay, it's great and fuss free.

Reviews.Title: “Position, position, position”
Reviews.Author: Paul4444_10
Reviews.Content: Like all real estate, position is nearly everything. This hotel is very conveniently located above Lavender MRT, a few minutes from Changi airport. It's also a 15mins walk from Arab St and Little India although there is nothing around the hotel itself. Staff were reasonably helpful and the rooms were clean and basic if a little small. Forget the hotel resturant and eat at the food court down below. It is cheap and has good variety. We stayed for 8 nights and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and compact”
Reviews.Author: Clarkiejan71
Reviews.Content: We had an overnighter here. It is clean, small and compact so not designed for long periods of stay. The staff were very friendly. As there are lots of the rooms the lifts can get full, and pushy people get in First etc. The breakfast was dreadful BUT the lovely staff told us to buy our tickets at the front desk and we saved $6 each. An excellent spot for catching the trains. The SMRT trains rock and their ticketing system works! Look this up miki.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and accessible”
Reviews.Author: AngelCarms
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is near the MRTstation, food court, and convenient stores, you can also buy pasalubongs in the nearby store if you have limited time. If you're built is big and if you're planning to bring your small kids on your trip you will find it difficult to move in the room especially inside the shower room. You migth need to bring an extension cord if you're planning to bring a number of gadgets that needs to be charge or better yet to bring an extra battery for your convenience. If you want to access to an internet there are computers that are available in the lobby with a charge of $4 for every 30 min. There are also available travel packages in the hotel but if you are already a senior citizen and planning to go to Universal studios you can buy a ticket directly there so you can get a big discount.

Reviews.Title: “easy access and good location...”
Reviews.Author: mariop79
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located outside the shooping belt are of Orchard Road,but got a very good plus point because its located behind Lavender MRT train station .Facilities in the room tend to be standard and room size also a bit small but still better than most three stars hotel in Singapore. Service in this hotel also quite good,only its some of their room boy cant speak english at all.

Reviews.Title: “only location but no character”
Reviews.Author: dobra59
Reviews.Content: it is really a hotel to come and sleep in late ; otherwise rooms are so small and dark ; elevators are exteremly busy ; breakfast is not too bad but poor quality

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with superb location”
Reviews.Author: Sabina S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in V hotel recently for two nights. We booked a superior room with breakfast, the price was very ok for what we got. It is a huge hotel with lots of groups, but check in was very smooth and quick. In the morning it is a bit crowded in the breakfast area (breakfast is ok) and there is a lot of traffic in the elevators. Our room was very small, but it had everything what we needed. There was TV, AC, enough space for luggage, tea and cofee maker,bathroom was clean, the shower big enough. The loaction is really perfect, about ten minutes walking to little India or Bugis.Hotel is located above MRT station Lavender, which is great and it's very easy to move around. There is also 24 hourse opened Kopitiam. There is a really big pool and a small gym, but because of one broken window the gymwas closed the whole time during our stay. The pool was working on the first day, then suddenly on the next day they closed it because of this same broken window. They kept sayin there is some maintainance going on, but they didn't do anything in this time. We complained and tey immediately offered a bigger room with free breakfast. Since we didn't want to move and had breakfast already included, they offered free internet (wifi is chargable), which was also ok. We recommend the place and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Costly .... Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Morgangarethpaul
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times but this will have been the last time , serive is terrible , as a business traveler you don't want to have to be put in a small room that smells and has no Internet access in the room and you have to call 6 times and still not get sorted . For the price you should do better .

Reviews.Title: “The best you can get with the price!”
Reviews.Author: DanielSKL
Reviews.Content: A new hotel according to cab driver. Travel with my wife & son. Booked thru hotel website. Superior room. Same size as budget hotel. Queen sized bed. A little bit small for us, so I move the bed to the wall (so I can use the extra space and my son wont fall down). Found the floor under the bed was actually quite dirty (never been cleaned up I suppose). Bathroom is small but good enough and clean. 32 inch LCD TV. Very convenient location. Kopitiam (food court), several food shop & Lavendar Station just behind the building. I fully recommend this hotel for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but not great”
Reviews.Author: HambledonTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in January 2012. I had a superior room and my 2 daughters had a standard room. But our rooms were the same except they had a view and I didnt, and my room had a very bad smell. When I asked reception what made my room a superior room when it was the same as theirs (but with no view) I was told it was because mine had a double bed and they had two singles. I said I would rather have 2 singles with a view. They then checked and gave me a free upgrade to a slightly larger room with a view (and no smell). I was also told that you had to pay for the internet both in my room or at their computer area (which I didn't check out). The Hotel is well located above the MRT. There are lots of eating places under the Hotel, including a yummy bakery. The rooms are small, but clean and tidy. The Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to MRT”
Reviews.Author: InaMann
Reviews.Content: I'm sure all the other reviews will tell you how awesome is the location of this hotel :) It's right above the Lavender station. And there's a lot of shops that sell affordable foods nearby. Coming from Malaysia, hotels prices in Singapore is not that user friendly to our wallet. But if you have slightly more budget than a budget hotel, then this 3 star hotel is your perfect choice. The staffs are friendly. And the best part is they let us have an early check in with no extra charge (this will depend on availability) The room is admittedly quite small, but it's clean and comfortable for 2 person. We stayed here for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff,secure and safe place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bevvy_babe
Reviews.Content: This is a good place to stay if you are on a stop over. Excellent and very helpful staff. Small rooms but perfect enough for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location at affordable price”
Reviews.Author: b79pl
Reviews.Content: Great location just above MRT station on the east-west line that connects airport with the city centre - so it's good for sightseeing, business trip and airport transfer. It's 30 seconds to get from the lobby to the MRT elevator. Nice and clean room with a good view (we've got a premium room, I suppose there's no view in standard rooms). The only downside is that it was really small so I wouldn't recommend it for longer stays. Because of the room size the bed is only queen size. Very nice breakfast and nice outside pool at the 4th floor. Friendly and helpful staff at the reception. Overall: good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoFoodMan
Reviews.Content: Not a 5 star hotel by any means but still was very comfortable and affordable. I would stay their again in a heart beat. Goods: Free water bottles Good location Nice staff Very affordable Bads: No wash clothes Breakfast in the hotel is expensive (but there are plenty of restaurants down stairs that are a lot cheaper) Shower leaked into the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Conveniency.”
Reviews.Author: TerenceLeeWX
Reviews.Content: - Clean rooms & Value for money - Lavender MRT just below. - 24 hrs Kopitiam + Convenient store. - Other shops like souvenirs, fast food and etc. - Small bathroom

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Bidok
Reviews.Content: Location is very convenient as it is right on top of the MRT station with many food shops and convenience stores around, so getting food is not a problem. Rooms are a little small compared to other hotels but we don't mind as long as they're clean. Toiletries are provided except soap. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but average service, and give the breakfast a miss!”
Reviews.Author: AndiD23_2
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent, it is directly above the Lavender MRT station which makes it super convenient to travel anywhere once you get the hang of the MRT. The lobby and rooms are very clean and nicely decorated. We had a triple room with views of the city. There is a massive window which takes up and entire wall and gives great views. The curtains were great because they could make the room pitch black if you wanted an afternoon nap. Wifi was expensive ($10Singapore for a voucher which lasts 24 hours once activated but you can only be logged on with one device at a time which was annoying!) but we stayed at another hotel in Singapore and it was the same price so I think that is the average price to pay. The shower was great, good water pressure and very warm. We had a small fridge (no mini bar), a kettle and a good TV. The air-con also worked well. The beds were very comfortable. It is a massive hotel and despite there being 5 lifts, you always had to wait up to 10 minutes to get one which got very annoying and they were always completely full. The service wasn't anything to write home about, and staff at the desk didn't seem overly friendly or helpful. The restaurant is very expensive ($5Singapore for a can of drink) but we didn't have a meal there so can't comment on the quality of the meals. Buffet breakfast ($14Singapore) was definitely not worth that much because a lot of the food was cold and wasn't that great. There were so many people eating at the buffet that we only just got a table and had to wait for it to get cleared. Overall, we had a positive experience here and I would recommend it, just find somewhere else for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Potential, Bad Management”
Reviews.Author: Telco1
Reviews.Content: Situated over the Lavender MRT and being a relatively new hotel, this should have ticked all of the boxes, but....................... If you want a normal sized hotel room, book the Premier room for the few extra dollars. The other rooms are so small, it is hard to move around in them. Forget breakfast at the hotel and instead, go to the Kopitiam food court next door. The hotel charges $14 for a mediocre at best breaksfast buffet where the food is cold and if you want real bacon, you almost have to beg for it as nowadays, serving pork products in Singapore is being frowned upon due to complaints by Muslims. Do not use the pool...the gym is right next to it and no one bothers to shower after working out, they just jump straight in polluting the pool. Keep on top of room service as they will miss you and not clean your room given half a chance. Location however is perfect. 20 minutes by MRT to the airport and central for everywhere else. Why management let a potentialy great hotel's standards slip so much is beyond me, but it is probably due to the high number of FT (foriegn talent) staff they have working there. Their idea of good service is not the same level that should be accepted in an international hotel. Price however is good compared to other hotels but still too exspensive for what you get. Short stay good...long stay bad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Shams74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the V Hotel Lavender from January 5th to 8th., 2012. Although the rooms were small compared to other hotels we have stayed in, it was comfortable and the location of the hotel is excellent-just above the MRT Lavender underground train station. The hotel has free internet use for guests and staff is very helpful in giving you directions to places you need to go plus just outside the hotel there is a food court with different type of food. Across from the hotel were fruit stands and little stores. It is walking distance to Little India also.

Reviews.Title: “superb location, many food places”
Reviews.Author: tuwanku
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Superb location. But small room, well typical singapore hotel... Many food choices. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “F1 Fun”
Reviews.Author: Ilovepenang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night only as we flew in from Malaysia to attend the Singapore Grand Prix. Large hotel, very efficient staff who were perhaps a little brusque but it was exceptionally busy when we arrived and left given the GP, so perhaps to be expected. Ideally situated above the Lavender MRT station which was only one stop from the F1 circuit on the day. This MRT station was also on the direct line to the airport so a winner all round location wise. Room was on the small side but we only wanted somewhere to put our heads down. It was very clean. No breakfast provided in our rate so I can't comment on this aspect but there are plenty of cheap coffee shops and stalls under the hotel so getting food is not an issue at all.

Reviews.Title: “small room but big on service”
Reviews.Author: piush11
Reviews.Content: stayed in hotel in Nov 2011. The room where one of the smallest but the service quality were really great. The location of the hotel in one of the best you will get , right above the singapore MRT. Worth staying with your family....

Reviews.Title: “Good Price & Location”
Reviews.Author: Gaskell K
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights at this hotel despite some negative reviews. We were happy that we did a great choice though the premier rooms are still small for us. I guess that's a better fine in Singapore for room below S$200. Rooms are clean and situated right above the subway is fantastic. There also some nice local foods and Wendy fastfood around. 1 station away is Bugis which offers quite good shopping experience.

Reviews.Title: “It's nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ANME002
Reviews.Content: We spend our first nights in Singapore at the V-Hotel. It is easy to find and 50m walking distance from the lavender MRT station. You can walk from there to little India. For the rest you will have to take the MRT first before enjoying nice walks in the evening. There is not much to do there. The Hotel was okay. Small Room with view on a glass facade (next building was maybe 20m away). Staff was always busy and the hotels need more elevator. We had always to wait a long time before we could take place in a crowded elevator. We spend the next nights in a other Hotel in Marina Bay, and could walk much more there. You get a completely different feeling about the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ian C
Reviews.Content: Many positive points, a few negative, but for the price it's hard to complain. The location of this hotel is great - on top of an MRT (tube) station, close to the Arab Quarter and Little India and the centre of town generally, and you can easily use the MRT to come in and go to the airport. Rooms are small but clean, though with some design flaws (e.g. room light switches are next to the desk rather than by the bed). Basic points were not explained at check-in (e.g. you have to collect your own laundry and pay as you go); and housekeeping was slow to clean the room. The 4th floor pool area, where breakfast is served, is pleasant, airy and spacious, though the pool was surprisingly cold. If you're from the UK, think Premier Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, just don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller201000
Reviews.Content: This is a basic 4-star property. I stayed here for the second time, this time got a better room (view outside, not inside towards the other tower) so I did had quite a nice view.
