And I paid really little for the room, Singapore is very expensive and a hotel at such a good location for only around 120S$ is quite a deal. The hotel can be reached from the MRT station through a small food stall area, 2 minutes, with the MRT itself being the one from the airport, so it's really convenient. It's 5 minutes towards the city centre with the MRT, and the location itself is just next to Little India (but not in Little India itself, so not so loud and noisy) Both checkin and checkout were efficent. Elevators weren't that much of an issue this time - either they improved them, or we were just lucky. Swimming pool simply is great, nice design between the two towers, not for sun bathing, but perfect for swimming, it's quite long, so if you want to do some laps, it's really a good way. The fitness center is smallish and at the end of the pool, but ok if you want to do some running. Don't expect anything fancy. The room is offering a fair size for the costs, however the shower/bathroom could have been done a bit better. It's just slightly too small. But still ok, and modern. For 1 person definitely no problem, and for a couple it's ok too I guess, just if you're two people not in a relationship travelling together it might be a little bit too small. Bed is comfortable, good pillow and blankets. Really nothing to complain about. Worst thing in this hotel is clearly that they went a bit too cheap on isolation. You can hear other guests, especially on the hallway (not the rooms.. weirdly it seems the isolation is only cheap towards the hallway, not between the levels or rooms or windows.. so there is hope it can be fixed) Wanted to sleep out a bit longer in the morning, and even though it was Chinese New Year just about to start and they were really full, they granted me 2 hours more (1pm instead of 11am) which I really appreciated. So their service level certainly improved since my first stay, probably they just get better with all kind of arrangements and simply after half a year of running things get easier once you get the experience. I suggest - unless you somehow get it for free - not to use their breakfast buffet. I didn't tried it out myself but heard it was average and not really worth the extra money, and there is plenty of food places right next to the hotel, which do offer enough food to stuff yourself for less than 5S$.. So, I'm happy with the hotel, get a room towards the end of the hallways and towards the "outside" with the window, and you should be absolutely fine and get decent value for money. Will definitely stay here again if I need something affordable yet nice. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Ilikethai
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my partner. The staff were always friendly and we had no problems during our stay. There is a desk to book tours in the lobby which was handy. It is right on top of a little food and shops arcade, which includes a 24 hr foodcourt, so we knew cheap and decent food was always available. It is also on top of the MRT which was extremely handy in getting around to see the sights of Singapore. The room itself was cosy, but I think typical size for singapore, it was clean and modern and a nice view out the large window. We were right down the end of one of the floors, so we actually had quite a walk to and from the elevator, but that wasnt a problem, just was bigger than I imagined. The pool is nice and clean. Did not eat at the restaurant or order room service. There was a taxi queue formed on the last morning when we checked out and were going to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Best to get around the city”
Reviews.Author: magitiida
Reviews.Content: Best reason to select the hotel is location, directly above MRT, hence going any part of the city is like getting around like a local resident. I had booked a Triple room, room was big enough to accommodate three of us( me, mom, n dad), as we needed the room to come and take rest after a tiresome tour. Room was cleaned, Towels were changed, bathroom lotions and Gels were changed regularly. A good riverside view from my room. Bathroom was OK size, as you are not going to do any Gymnastic stunt inside for which the size is enough to take bath. Bathroom was clean. As the Hotel is a newly opened one, all the furniture, wardrobe, safety vault, LCD, bed, Mattresses, Work space, Hairdryer, coffee maker, bin..etc is all new and clean and still u can smell the freshness. The hotel is a smoker free hotel. I didnt tried the food here. Minus point is paid internet and for which I had to go to the lobby for net access, coz the wifi was not connecting in my room. But I needed the internet for only couple of hours in a day maximum, as rest of the day I was roaming in the city, so it didnt bothered me much. Getting a taxi was as easy as a mouse click. If you are interested in local food, then the hotel is surrounded by food court working for 24hrs. Front desk was a welcoming group of people with a smile. Lobby was always noisy, but again You are not staying in the lobby, and you room will be pin drop silent from the outer world. For sure I 'll suggest all my friends for this hotel, and i will stay here everytime I go Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Rooms, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe M
Reviews.Content: The (deluxe) room we stayed in was really nice and modern. Not huge, but big enough. The room had a large window and window sill to sit on which was nice. It was really hard to have a shower without water going all over the bathroom floor, which annoyed me but isn't a big deal. We ate at the hotel restaurant once, which was reasonably priced but service was pretty bad. We caught the MRT everywhere so the location was great for us. I thought the price of the internet wifi was too expensive ($10 for 24 hours), being used to having free internet in all the hotels we'd stayed at throughout south-east Asia. Nonetheless I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bubblynad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only 2 mins walk to lavender MRT sation, very convinient to go to the city area! It is also convinient to walk to arab street for great food and to bugis area for shopping! Great houskeeping! I called a few times to ask for tea and sugar and also ask for the iron board, then at 4 am i called again for extra towels and pillow! The staff were efficient and always serve with a smile! Comfortable bed but the toilet is too small. Overall great hotel, great location!

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favour stayelswhere”
Reviews.Author: Greg E
Reviews.Content: Ok.. I am a budget conscious business traveller.. I rather local than international. and have been travelling very regularly to Singpore for 6 years., but alwasy willign to give different budget hotels a try., But the V Hotel Lavender is a cattle truck of a building. It takes airline cattle class to a new low. The photos of the room are very deceptive in size – they are tiny even by Asian room size standard. The hotel is brand new and has a pool and good outlook etc… but really !!!. The best part (and yes there is a good part) is the hotel is located above the Lavender MRT. Food court below is good value for local eating. We all know Singapore is an over-priced hotel location but there are better hotels at similar discounted prices.. o – yes I paid S $160 a night – discount for overpriced Singapore. If you still do decide to stay here – add 10 min to your travel time to allow for the long wait and cues at the elevators. And the lobby is loike a school yard at all hours. Internet wsa also not working for the 4 days i had booked. I will revert to staying at the Aqueen hotel just down the road. also on lavender

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, cozy, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NanioKisai
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located near the Lavender MRT station. It has a nice 24-hour singaporean fast food place that has some nice food. It's host to alot of group travellers so the reception is constantly crowded and full of luggage being stored. The twin rooms aren't very spacious, but the high-ceiling windows help. I thought the breakfast could had had a better variety of food for different tastes, the juices were very bland. One major thing that annoyed me alot was the waits for the elevators, for some reason whenever I would have to go down for breakfast I would have to wait for some good 5-10mins that after a while I would just go down by stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, close to MRT”
Reviews.Author: Kwanvin
Reviews.Content: Hotel staffs are friendly. The room were tiny but very clean. Lobby always crowded. There are many elevetors, but you always have to wait for a while. Hotel location is the best. Close to MRT, near foodcourt which open 24 hours. There is a convenient store around MRT station. There are some souvenior shops around hotel which you can get good price stuffs.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but not cozy”
Reviews.Author: HKexpat08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. Overall, we found it a convenient, well-run hotel and reasonable value for money in expensive Singapore, but the rooms and corridors are a bit dark and dreary. On the positive side, the hotel is located around the corner from the Lavender MRT, which makes it an easy 15 minute-trip to Orchard Road, 5 minutes to City Hall and about 30 minutes to and from the airport. This is a great way to beat the heat and humidity and get around the city inexpensively and in comfort as even a short walk on the street in Singapore leaves you dripping with sweat. Everything was quite efficient with our check-in, and the staff at the hotel were polite and helpful when we wanted to change our room because of the slightly weird smell in the first room we were given. The breakfast is adequate but some dishes are a bit odd (e.g. cornbeef mash on top of mashed potatoes, chicken ham). I suppose it's meant to cater to the tastes of people from different countries. However, the only bread is in loaves and you have to toast it yourself. Since the breakfast area gets quite busy, It would be nicer and more efficient to have some bread rolls that people could eat without toasting. The breakfast tables are in a pleasant, breezy, open area, but watch out for the bird poo on the chairs! Toiletries given in the room are very small, barely enough for one person per night. We ended up buying a bottle of shower cream to get us through the trip. The shower is also designed to be almost parallel to the floor with a loosely fitted glass door so that the bathroom floor always gets quite wet (I suppose this design is meant to make it easier for people with limited mobility but surely there must be a better way). You can also compare this hotel to the Ibis on Bencoolen, which is the same standard of hotel and slightly more expensive. The Ibis is a brisk 10-minute walk to the MTR but has much cheerier, fresher, better-designed rooms, a nice restaurant, and an overall nicer feeling to the hotel. It all depends on what your priorities are.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: deka2
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and a bit tired. Our first impression wasn’t good, as the front desk staff could not find our booking. Took 10 min to fix and was allocated a top floor room. From that point we had no trouble and I would definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in Singapore. Travelling around on the MRT is easy and convenient, especially with a station directly under the Hotel. The room was a bit small, but everything worked and the bed was comfortable. There is a pool area on level 4 and we spent several hours there out of the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: jade879
Reviews.Content: V hotel is a new hotel, with perfect location( 5 min walk to lavender mrt), near 24 hours food court n seven eleven. I stayed there last December, the room is clean, with nice view but the bathroom is small. Overall it's a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “On top of MRT”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-traveler-04
Reviews.Content: Thats the positives out of the way, slow lifts, too crowded, smells, guests think its funny yelling at 2am when they come back, too many people for the lift even at 11pm! You can hear the guy next door farting the rooms are that small, think Ibis hotel room, then shrink it by 30% They advertise 888 rooms, which for sanity and sleep is 800 too many!

Reviews.Title: “A good option in expensive Singapore”
Reviews.Author: patatamia
Reviews.Content: It's not a major hotel but, given the prices of similar operations in Singapore, it scores well. The location is great: righ next to a subway stop on the line going to the airport and close to a number of cheap eateries, within walking distance from Little India. Plenty of public transportation. The room was not too small though they should have at least a soap bar in the bathroom, along with a glass where you an put your toothbrush to dry , and mayb ven a box of paper tissues. Breakfast is not that great but it gets you going in the morning. The elevators are always busy, even though there are 6 big ones. The hallways are noisy given the presence of a lot of guests at all times. It is a very popular hotel because of the reasonable rates. Good wi-fi connection in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quick & Small”
Reviews.Author: pinkdaisypink
Reviews.Content: Me & hubby stayed 2 nights, 1st night they give us WALL view.. (V Hotel should give 80% discount for this room). Very comfortless. It feels like using turtle neck sweater in the middle of summer. Because we're in hurry to meet friends and sleep late, we decide change the room tomorrow. Thx God, in the morning they give us nicer room with earth view.. hahahaha.. so happy i can see trees, grass, buildings & sky. Swimming pool & gym are good & cozy. No need breakfast from the hotel, they must be served boring food. Better explore outside the hotel. 1 minutes walk, go down and find 24 hours food court. 10 minutes walk, there is Lavender Food Square. Very very very good dimsum, mostly local people, cheap. I like this hotel because the MRT station is beneath it. By bus not more than 15 stops to Bugis Junction, Haji Lane, Chijmes, Clarke Quay, Singapore Art Museum, Bras Basah Complex (cheaper design, art & architecture magazine or books - Basheer Book Store). By taxi to Marina Bay only 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLira
Reviews.Content: good location but small rooms. the rooms are nice though. the bathrooms are tiny and thats fine also. its just that water comes out of the shower and that makes the place messy. they could have made bigger doors for the shower. overall, it is a nice hotel to just sleep and rest. our room had a cigarette smell. we informed reception and they sent someone with a machine to suck in that smell. it worked for a while but when we came back in the evening, we still had the same cigarette smell. lots of eateries nearby. no need to have breakfast at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just above the MRT”
Reviews.Author: Manoj_cv
Reviews.Content: Heard that this hotel is just than an year old and Very well maintained. Its located just above the Lavender MRT. Though the rooms are bit small they are very neat and comfortable for the price they are offered. The location is also just 10min drive to Orchard or little India. Being just above the MRT is a big advantage for visitors who coming for holiday as you have access to travel to any part of the city. The food is also very good. Try it out if you are planning for a good budget/economical holiday

Reviews.Title: “overpriced but good location”
Reviews.Author: JWBL
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small(-ish), and amenities are basic. Place is clean, and at a very convenient location. An acceptable stay, but should be cheaper for what it's offering ($160/night for standard room). Prices might be more expensive because of xmas.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, smelly rooms, insensitive staff with inability to empathize with guests needs”
Reviews.Author: davidko
Reviews.Content: Being a Singaporean, I would have the utmost highest expectations of the hotels I stayed in. I can say we were attracted to its convenient location, but that's about it. I'm extremely unhappy with my stay. It started from the front desk. The front office assistant, Ray, didn't bother to greet us, when attending us, he was scratching his hair and talking to his other colleague, which he deemed a priority. The room had a sewerage smell to it, so we requested a change of room, but we were told to go down to the lobby, when we went to the lobby, they told us that no rooms were available. This does not make sense-how can they tel us to go down to the lobby when no rooms are available in the first place? No empathy to guests. And right now, we are waiting for them to arrange someone to come and do the ionizing of my room. I waited for the past 20 mins. This is outrageous. Btw, V hotel markets themselves as luxury hotel. Obviously it's the opposite

Reviews.Title: “great location , nice place to stay and not too pricey for a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: skellis51
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location as the underground mrt system is at the ground floor of the hotel so even if it rains there is no hassle of getting wet , also we had luggage so from the station very easy to get to. the rooms are clean and modern and have complimentary coffee and tea maker . When i book the hotel i was told the wireless internet was free but getting to the hotel the reception told me i would have to pay after speaking to the manger all was sorted at very quickly , so i can tell you the service at reception is very good indeed. link below is the view of the pool and surround area http://youtu.be/oBj_Xqh3zB0

Reviews.Title: “Busiest hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: mpd111
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, very small but this is Singapore! Everything you need is there. I was apprehensive based on so much negativity in other reviews. I did not at any time wait more than a few minutes for one of the six lifts. Reception staff were fine, not the friendliest I've met but still fine AND efficient. There must have been a change in policy as wifi is now FREE which is a big plus. All in all I think this is a great hotel. My opinion....and I consider myself critical!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with great facilities though tends to be chaotic with too many people”
Reviews.Author: thePaulhongkong
Reviews.Content: I travel to Singapore regularly on business and this hotel is very close to my office. Compared to most of Singapore it is very good value and has a great pool with a nice gym overlooking it. The hotel does tend to be chaotic though with too many people and the lobby area and elevators are a mess. Rooms are boutique hotel style though generally not that well maintained. Fantastic location right above the MRT station which in Singapore where taxis can be difficult to find this is great and very easy to/from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good facilites, great option!”
Reviews.Author: edanherg
Reviews.Content: It was very difficult to find a good hotel in Singapore for a reasonable price. There are plenty of luxurious hotels, but if you don't want to spend lots of money but still be comfortable, V Lavender is for you. The hotel is right outside the Lavender metro station. A small shopping area between subway and hotel lobby, which is convenient for late dining or souvenirs. The rooms are small, but NOT UNCOMFORTABLE. There is enough space (enough, not plenty) for you and your luggage. We were three people in a triple room and it was OK. Rooms come with a big window with a place where you can put the suitcases easily. Bathroom is small, shower is tiny, but since I take 10-minute showers.. I don't mind. The place is spotless, very clean and the breakfast buffet is very generous. Asian and West options everyday. Wi-fi is not free, that's the only thing I didn't like. but I definitely would stay in V Hotel again. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “At the price you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: wizardinoz
Reviews.Content: Clearly a tourist hotel so always full but difficult to find anything comparable close to downtown and right on top of a MRT. Great for a stop over and the pool is a welcome retreat. Don't bother with the in house breakfast. Wireless was not operating for 3 days of our stay and staff really had no idea how to remedy.

Reviews.Title: “V Hotel Lavender Good location and great Price in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Lucyyu8888
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel from web site with good price and great location in between Airport and the Cruise center. The MRT station is just under ground from the hotelis so convenient for us to get around town.Many food court near by.The hotel is new and room is bigger than the hotel we stay in Singapore last time. I gave the hotel information to friend for her next visit in Singapore.I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location ...”
Reviews.Author: Harish_VI
Reviews.Content: ... can't be beat. Easy access from the airport, and makes getting to almost anywhere in Singapore a breeze. As others have mentioned, the rooms are on the smaller size (and the bathrooms are tiny!), but we felt it was adequate for a small family. Housekeeping timing is funny - they came in to clean our room at about 7:30 p.m. every day! Anyway, since we were there on a holiday, and basically wanted a clean, comfortable place to sleep at the end of a day of sightseeing, we were more than happy with the room and facilities provided. TV, mini-fridge, clean towels and sheets, adequate storage if one does not travel with a ton of luggage ... good enough. The food court at the ground level offers a lot of choice, but choices are sadly lacking if you're a vegetarian. That said, Little India is no more than a brisk 20 minute walk away, and offers enough choices for those looking for a vegetarian option. Internet is not free, and we did not try the hotel breakfast or the pool. Overall, pleased with the hotel and the price we paid for it, and would not mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel In Singapore next to Lavender MRT Station”
Reviews.Author: pumpapple2002
Reviews.Content: Located next to Lavender MRT Station and from here ,you can use MRT to anywhere in Singapore conveniently. If you visit Singapore and want to explore the city instead of enjoying hotel facilities.This is the right hotel for you.Booed through Agoda and get a reasonable offer.Room was clean but small.Breakfast not provided but not too worry because plenty of foods for you to choose from,nest to the hotel and quality is quite good and very hygienic.Taxi is a bit hard to get (not just in this hotel but throuhout Singapore). Check In and check out was fast. Toilet was clean and small(for caucasian standard).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Compact Room”
Reviews.Author: Sudeep G
Reviews.Content: Good location, good rooms. Courteous staff. Just the breakfast menu isnt great. I liked my stay here. They changed my room on my request for a better view and not the inside pool viewing room. Also had a mobile theft scare, which wasnt the case, and the manager was right there for help me out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great pool, good quality overall”
Reviews.Author: Acalpixca
Reviews.Content: A Singaporean friend recommended this hotel to us. She was absolutely right. The hotel is right above a little shopping mall and a very centric MRT (underground) station. The MRT is the best way to move around town and there's food at all times in the shopping mall, so it's incredibly convenient. The hotel itself is a busy business hotel. The rooms are squeaky clean, beds very comfortable. It has a very nice pool too. The hotel is not too pricey. Acommodation tends to be expensive in Singapore. I found the V Lavender offers lots of value for money. I'll definitely stay there when I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Hotel : MRT Direct to Airport”
Reviews.Author: reshma_desh
Reviews.Content: The hotel reception is great location, on the MRT Station Lavander - direct from the airport. I got a free upgrade to a queen sized bedroom with free wifi.. Minibar was not stocked though.. Hotel has easy access to fast/cheap food round the corner and a hair and nail salon that i visited too.

Reviews.Title: “very busy place”
Reviews.Author: Eat_Wind
Reviews.Content: maybe i come during the holiday season, which explains the impersonal service. seems like a popular hotel. anyway location is excellent. you can go to many places in the mrt without getting wet. we booked the family room for 250 sing dollar a night, room is modern and nicely decorated but a bit small. liked the 24 hours eating place next door which serve good local food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Great View !”
Reviews.Author: shwetaD11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our trip in Singapore ! And it was quite enjoyable as the hotel is located right at Lavendar MRT or 15 mins walk from Little India. We had a family room on the top floor ie. 15th and the view from there was fabulous ! We could see the singapore flyer, arab street, the ships anchored at the bay and much more with a wonderful night view ! So try and get the top floors. We had no bell boy to carry our luggage though which it seems is available only for people who did coach bookings with the hotel ! ?? Room service was okay. Mainly the rooms were new and so quite bright with nice decor and clean. The space is a bit less if you have more baggage and the shower room is tiny. But I guess it is quite manageable when you are staying outside the hotel most of the time. During our stay the wifi was free due to some reasons however, it is charged at 10$ per day. It also has a pool on the 4th floor and a restaurant. Front desk was helpful and its a huge hotel with guests pouring in all day ! Overall it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Transit Stop”
Reviews.Author: Aussieflyers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. While it was a good little hotel, I probably wouldn't stay and more than what we did. It's a good place to stay inbetween flights. Rooms though were incredible small! Great having the MRT so close and 24 hour convenience store.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading information”
Reviews.Author: Julia C
Reviews.Content: I booked a deluxe double room for my husband & 2 young children which showed to sleep 2 adults & 1 child (max age 8) so thought acceptable for 1 adult & children aged 5 & 7, I'd read the reviews & knew that the shower/bathroom was tiny so that was no surprise. But what was a surprise was the small double bed which couldnt accommodate 1 adult & 2 (small) children let alone 2 adults & 1 child. My husband complained & was told there was nothing that could be done. He even asked to pay for an upgrade but nothing was available. On returning to the UK I emailed the manager to which I got a very quick response to say he would investigate. 5 weeks on & 2 emails later still no response. What does that tell you?

Reviews.Title: “Location Great!”
Reviews.Author: lqdflo
Reviews.Content: Pro: location above the subway (mrt?) which was excellent for getting around to see the sights, swimming pool was lovely, beds clean and comfortable. Cons: Included breakfast was not good, long waits for the elevators at peak times, rooms don't seem to vent very well and get musty smelling. Overall - I would stay here again because the location for price is fantastic. If the price goes up then I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Located above MRT station”
Reviews.Author: JamesLesmana
Reviews.Content: I love to stay at this hotel, the room quite small but clean and equiped with modern style futniture. It has a great location above Lavender MRT station, and also close to a food court.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Remlig
Reviews.Content: Great location - Lavender MRT station is underground and forms part of the complex including Hotel, 24 hour local food outlets, convenience store, money changer and MRT. The MRT gives you fast economical and safe transport in all directions across the island. Shop local (ie where the locals shop) is worth it in Singapore rather than being captive to the tourist belt. It's also a great way to come in from the airport Hotel lobby, front desk and concierge staff are very helpful, pleasant and enjoyed a bit of banter. English is understood by all. Some domestic staff servicing rooms are not so proficient with english but try. Rooms are compact but NOT 'squeesy'. Rooms still have that new feel and are very comfortable. Bathrooms are clean, well maintained and again still have that new feel. Rooms on the external walls of the wings have reasonable views whilst it is understood that the inside facing walls look across the gap to the rooms opposite My only downside experience was with the resteraunt within the Hotel (It is not part of the hotels business) leaves a bit to be desired in terms of breakfasts . You are lucky if you find food that is warm let alone hot. Better to hop the train and head 1 station away to Bougis street or 'eat local'.

Reviews.Title: “3* with good location”
Reviews.Author: mtaiwai
Reviews.Content: Agoda published it as a 4*, but i would only rate it at 3*. The location is quite strategic (on top of MRT station), 1 stop from Bugis, lots of eateries around hotel. I would rate this as a standard tourist hotel, with small but cozy room, small bathroom, no bathtub, okay breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, just very small.”
Reviews.Author: AdamJesse
Reviews.Content: Now I know accomidation is expensive in Singapore, similar to London, and that you don't get much in the way of room for your money, so I was prepared for the size of the room. Although the room was compact it was clean and had everything we needed for our short stay in Singapore. It is also located very conveniently right above an MRT which makes it very easy to get around the rest of Singapore from here. The hotel also has a nice swimming pool and a very basic gym. There is a food court just next door to the hotel if you want a cheap snack or meal, very convenient. I booked this hotel through a budget website, so got a heavily discounted rate, I don't think I would have chosen this hotel at its full price. Saying that however, it is perfectly suitable if you just have a couple of days in Singapore, and you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest bathroom, but great hotel”
Reviews.Author: marinautama
Reviews.Content: Accommodation in singapore could cause a huge dent in your budget, so when we go to SG, we make it a point to be extra cost conscious in our choice of hotel. V hotel didnt disappoint . Yes, the room was a squeeze, and yes we have never seen a tinier bathroom (clever concept). To give an illustration, have you ever set your water mixer too hot and instinctively jump back to avoid the shower? you cant do than in this hotel shower stall... BUT, this hotel has it all. The location is convenient, taxi is easy to get, MRT station a few steps away, Kopitiam right next door, convenience store also in the building, money changer is right in front of the lobby. Check in 3 minutes, check out even faster. Room was always cleanly spotless. So for the price in singapore standard, it's heaven sent. Dont worry abt the elevator and the noise, it wasnt that bad

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, poor "Value"”
Reviews.Author: Elgin99
Reviews.Content: There are better value hotels even in this price range (Ibis for instance). The breakfast is unsuited for Western guests, and beware tables near the line of toilet stalls (!!!) on the balcony. We asked for a kettle several times, it never arrived. The rooms are cramped and very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Never expected.”
Reviews.Author: Alva1985
Reviews.Content: Well I book Vhotel for a trial stay and never expected e room is similiar like Frangrance it's too small! In the picture it look nice and I was excited but guess it was a bit disappointed. Then reception was so bad. That my bf complain and complain about it. He said he rather go geylang. Maybe they need to check on the network coverage for the ho networks!! And my experience at e V hotel (Changi) the room was fabulous w bathtub. Maybe I should request for that. And the reception never asked if I want a smoking room or not. They should asked. It's never wrong asking though ...

Reviews.Title: “Rather 3* than 4* standard hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: oriii
Reviews.Content: For stayed two nights in this hotel. it was booked only a few days in advance at a still cheap rate. The positive things are the location, price and most of the times the nice staff. It is right at the metro station Lavender and a trip to downtown takes not mor than 10minutes. It is also well located if you want to discover the historial districts of Singapur (Little India and the Arabdistrict). Just around the corner are many restaurants in to-go style. The staff was also very polite and good English skills (except for housekeeping). We found the roomsize also for Singapore/Asian standards to be rather small. Especially, if we consider this hotel to be 4*. Nevertheless, when you here just for sleeping its great value. However, not cleaned bathroom with hairs still in the sink is a definate no-go! We also had to ask twice for handtowels which aren't available right away. Overall, the hotel should be considered as 3* rather than 4*. Nevertheless, it was a great value because of the location and price. We didn't try the in-house restaurant, gym and pooll.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location! Average hotel stay experience.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBan
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the positive side: Location is fantastic. Very very close to the MRT and therefore provide convenient access. The 24 hours Kopi Tiam on the ground floor offers very nice food option at decent prices. Room was comfortable. Ac was working properly and we got a room with a view. Even though I was on 15 floor, for some reason, I had no problem with elevator waiting time. Price was alright as I booked with an airfare combined package. The negative side: When we checked in at 2 pm, the room was not ready and they asked us to wait. It is not a problem for us as we want to go our anyway. The issue was our luggage was kept along with a huge amount of other luggages by the elevator. When we came back to collect it in the afternoon, nobody was there and we can just take the bags without even presenting the card. This is a major security issue! Upon coming in to the room, there was a heavy residue smell of smoke, which I think was left by the prvious guest and was not aired out properly. As we did not smoke,it was quite disgusting. The water temperature was not stable. One minute it's warm the other it's close to scalding. Not a nice experience. Asked for a morning call but nothing came up on the morning. This is quite disappointing. On the second day, we went out in the morning and came back at 3 pm. Unfortunately, the room was not made up yet. We had to call to ask them to clean it up. Tried to pool on the morning of our last day. Due to being located between the two building towers, it got no sunlight and the water was freezing. Considering all, I feel that this is a decent hotel and I will probably come to stay here again, even if it is only for the location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “NEW, clean, convenient and practical hotel”
Reviews.Author: zoealessi
Reviews.Content: We checked in last Nov 27-30, 2011, and got the family room. From the moment we went down from our taxi, a staff came to load our bags in the trolley and assist us to the front desk, no problem with check in, it was fast and easy! Eventhough there were lots of people on the lobby, there were also a lot of staff to serve your needs and most of them spoke English pretty well. They were also polite and courteous to the guests. Room and bathroom was pretty small but we didn't expect much because the price was pretty cheap by Singapore standards. The view from our 7th floor room was breathtaking! Our room also have a small safe, a small ref, hairdryer, an electric kettle, with complimentary tea & coffee. Complimentary bottled water were also replenished daily. Basic amenities were provided including shower gel, lotion, shampoo, toothbrush, showercap and bedroom slippers! Sheets were crisp and new, pillows were soft as well as the fluffy white bath towels. One comment though is that there were no hand towels provided and no soap too! I think the hotel should provide soap because not all guests like to use shower gels! At the fourth floor, there was a swimming pool, a gym and a resto. Location of the hotel was perfect because you just need to step outside to ride the train (lavender mrt station) or ride the bus. They also have a 24-hr convenience store, 24-hr food court, bakery,food stalls and Wendy's! Check out was a breeze, again, fast and easy :)

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: Having watched this hotel being built with my frequent visits to Singers and usually staying on East Coast at Mercure Roxy I decided to give it a go because my friend lives in high rise just across the road. I am an avid MRT and Bus tripper, hawker stall eater. Love Singers!!!! Yes the V Hotel in small but my God what a location. Checkin and checkout super fast. Yes the lift were a little slow. Food downstairs super. I was on the 15th Floor with a view into the middle. Who cares. No noise on my floor. I had just flown down from Penang after 4 nts at Evergreen Laurel on Gurney Drive

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel for a family”
Reviews.Author: fourtimesayear
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights and had a wonderful time. I like the location. Right near the MRT & has a food court nearby. I can easily find ANYTHING nearby. The hotel is always full. A lot of people from tour groups, I guess it is a favorite for tourist to stay. Not just Orchard rd. all the time. The room is very nice for the price we got. We were traveling with 2 toddlers and 1 baby, the huge window with seating gave them good view of the city. I like the overall stay there. Will definitely go back there if we were in SG.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Stay”
Reviews.Author: joeycheng
Reviews.Content: Stay for 3D2N. Is very convenient place to stay just beside the MRT station and there is 24hours food court beside the hotel. 1 thing need highlight is too cold 20 celcius so we off the aircond while sleeping. Not much channel program it have

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!! Will never come back again!”
Reviews.Author: Atozholidays
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hotel from hell. First impression at front foyer was over crowding with hundreds of tour groups and long queues to get to front desk staff. The lifts were always full so u have to wait 10 min to get up to your room or down to foyer. On arrival to our room, noticed the door in room across from our room was fully opened with no one inside...the cleaners were in the process of doing housekeeping but was working on another room while leaving this one open for all to see. So much os security. Linen was stained when we checked in and staff reluctantly changed the sheets without an apology. Room was sooo tiny and bathroom flooded after each shower. There were hair in the shower and room was not clean. Air con temp does not work so room was freezing cold. Don't think ventilation existed either as cigarette smoke from other rooms were flooding into our room so couldn't sleep the whole nite. Complained to staff the next morning but there was nothing they could do. Their response was that smoke was I our room because we smoked in the bathroom. I mean come on! We have young children with us. Why would I be complaining if I'm a smoker! Terrible terrible customer service. This hotel totally ruined my holiday experience. I'm sure there r much better hotels in Singapore than this one. I'd rather pay more than be tortured in this hotel ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can!”
Reviews.Author: j_ldn6012
Reviews.Content: Yes, Singapore can be a very expensive place when it comes to accommodation and this place offers a good price for a night's stay. I paid around S$140 a night when I first booked it so I'd say it's a good deal compared to the hotels I usually stay in when in Singapore. However, upon arrival, problems immediately started. My brother who a day earlier complained about not being able to sleep as the room is too warm. Not thinking much about it, I went up to the room and indeed, it felt like sahara desert. After a 13 hours flight, I am not going to put up with it. We rang reception and they assured us it'll be sorted out after we return from breakfast but it wasn't. Staff wasn't able to do much to help. We had to bear with the room's heat for a night before we upgraded into a prepaid "premier room". The premier room, was better but we soon discovered another problem. Cleanliness. The sheets were stained with some silver grey substance, goodness knows what and the pillow sheets to our horror, were stained with dirt. We discovered it at 3 am and kept on ringing reception but they hung up on us. Another general problem with the rooms would be that the floor is incredibly slippery, I almost fell head down coming out from the shower. Not recommended for kids or elderly people. Service was minimal and ineffective, rooms were slippery be it in or outside the bathroom, minimal ventilation, cleanliness frowned upon, and in general, the hotel was packed with group tours and is constantly very noisy. If you can afford it, stay elsewhere, this place wasn't worth my time and money even though it was cheap. The only good thing about this place is the close proximity to the MRT and a 24 hour kopitiam is available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: _iJane_
Reviews.Content: I stayed a V Hotel Lavendar for 3 nights and the location made it possible for me to easily access all my tourist goals quickly and at low cost. I caught the MRT to and from the airport as well making it possible to avoid traffic and be on time. The hotel staff are a bit docile and not that well trained. My room was freshened daily at about 5pm or 6pm which is a bit inconvenient for some. On one visit I told them that my TV remote control didn't work, so the guy swapped it with one from the room across the corridor - and the room was obviously still occupied! If your remote disappeared I give you my apologies! In a nutshell - don't expect too much from the staff but do stay here if you want convenience and nice clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient small hotel with and affordable price”
Reviews.Author: DGusmiranto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean although the rooms are pretty small but it more than make up with the "up to the roof" price. you can walk to the lavender MRT station and there is also more than enough place to get something to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Nicola K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at V Hotel for 4 nights in November. We wanted a clean hotel in a good location at an affordable price and that's what we got! The rooms are small but manageable, great showers and friendly cleaning staff if you want more towels etc. The hotel has a small gym and a great pool. Reception is busy but we didn't wait longer than a couple of minutes to be seen too. The hotel is right on top of the MTR which is a great way of getting around town but as there were four of us it wasn't much more to get a cab to all the normal tourist attractions. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family as good value for money and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Crowded, Convenient and Cramped!”
Reviews.Author: deepakraina7
Reviews.Content: First thing everyone needs to understand is that Singapore is EXPENSIVE for hotel stay .. After a lot of research we froze on the V Hotel primarily because of its location. Travelling by a metro (called MRT in Singapore) is one of the wisest choice as its economical and connects every corner of the city. And V Hotel stands right on top of the Lavender MRT station making commuting very convenient. Also, it has a food joint just under the hotel so grabbing a meal isnt too tough. My first impression of the room as soon as i opened the door was that of ' God, this room ended even before it started!' .. the place may seem reasonable for a couple that is travelling light and dont care much about the luxury of the hotel. The bathroom is small again but nothing that is unacceptable. the room has basics like a LCD, water kettle, safe locker, cupboard, mini fridge. All this makes the deal quite good as u dont really find anything really missing in the room except from the size. But thats what you get for this price in Singapore! the front desk attendants dont quite believe in customer centricity and are quite straight faced at all times and seem quite worked up at all times. Was hard to find a smiling front office rep! the bell boys opening the door seemed much better and would offer help when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay in this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shirley T
Reviews.Content: I have been never stayed in such horrible hotel before!!! The only good thing is it's located on the MRT, and many restaurants nearby. 1. We arrived on 18-Nov with totally 4 people, we check-in and got the room card, the bell-boy (acturally bell-uncle) with the name 'LEONG', sent our luggages to the room, after we got the luggages, we said thank you, but the "LEONG" just stood here, and seems he didn't want to leave. We were a little bit odd, because if this is Thailand, I knew I have to pay tips, but this is Singapore!!! He stood there for 3 mins, and suddently said: ' any currency Okay!' We were so shocked after hearing that, and it seems he is blackmail us!!! And my friend gave him SG$2 to kick him out of our room!!! 2. I don't think this hotel worth this price, with this price, I think I can stay in a much more better hotel than this one!!! We stayed in premier room, no hand towels, no hand soap, no comb, and the shower is too SMALL, you can barely turn around, You will get the floor wet when you take shower!!! The air-con does not work, it's so hot in the mid-night (because everyone switch on the air-con), but once people check-out, it was freezing!!! 3. It is so insecure if you leave the luggage in the hotel after you check out, because they will only put the luggage in the lobby instead of a room, luggages are easily be taken by stranger. And they don't have a system to manage the luggages, one of our friend couldn't find the luggage when we back to hotel for airport, and the LEONG was there to manage the luggages, so we asked him to find the luggage, he is not helpful that told my friend to find it himself!!! What kindly of service is it? Would he act the same this if we took out SG$5??? I will never stay in this hotel anymore, this is a horrible hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't say I'm impressed”
Reviews.Author: applecart3355
Reviews.Content: I originally chose this hotel because I want to stay in a 'no frills' hotel in my short Singapore visit. I only stayed here for a night, and less than 15 hours, but during my short visit I found many flaws. First I was given room without any window (there is a window--with the view: facing wall), yes, I did check-in late (5pm), but for the price they charged (S$160/night) I kind of expected more, because the price doesn't even include breakfast. The thing is, the queen-sized-bed room was very small, probably 9 sqm--that already included the very mini bathroom. I thought the wireless internet was going to make it up, but alas, the wifi turned out to be S$10/day. So what I got is S$170 very small room with wifi, no window, and no breakfast. What a deal. But hey, at least they gave basic amenities (towel, shampoo, bath gel, body lotion, slippers) and mineral water. What bothered me more was that the hotel didn't even bother to provide some general information sheet/folder in the room. If you check out their website, actually they didn't even reveal much. It was very misleading, as several online booking sites mentioned this hotel as having free wifi. Did I sleep well? Imagine this, the room is weirdly lit (they only have neon lamps to lit the room), with noises coming from the corridor--the wall is very thin. It was fortunate for me that I was super exhausted so that I could sleep eventually. I don't know about other guests, but if I were to find a 'good location' hotel that will charge more than S$150 per night for windowless tiny room, without any breakfast or free wi-fi, I'd rather stay at Lucky Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Meowmeow777
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night for a layover and since it's above lavender MRT station we were able to get the train straight there from the airport. Other than that there's not much to it. The rooms and nice but small and there is no internet. The location isnt great either not really being close to anything exciting. I wouldn't recommend it for more than a layover hotel that's cheaper than the ones closer to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “You'd rather stay in the hotel than go out and about exploring the city.”
Reviews.Author: UGOY
Reviews.Content: Comfortable with great ambience. longer have the lifestyle for. The best part is the view from the rooms (massive ceiling-to-floor glass windows)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: GurpreetAmrit
Reviews.Content: This is a great location to stay. Right above the Lavender MRT station (2 stations away from Little India). We had booked online & got a good price 3 months in advance. It is a great no-frills place. Rooms are slightly small for a family accommodation. We were 2 adults and 2 kids (2yr & 10yr) and a triple room felt cramped. Breakfast is good but limited and standard stuff. Staff is very courteous and extremely helpful. The hotel has 880 rooms so the lobby can seem a little crowded at some times. There are some very nice shops in the hotel compound including Wendy's (fast food outlet). We would definitely return to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Value for your Money”
Reviews.Author: mitsonthemove
Reviews.Content: The Location of the hotel is excellent, Food plaza, MRT station, Availability of cabs, proximity to all the markets, shopping places and Sentosa makes this one of the better choices. The Quality of rooms, Breakfast, was very good. Hotel Cleanliness was upto the mark and the services at the reception were satisfactory. The staff was freindly. View from the room was very good. Rooms were slightly smaller as compared to where we come from but I thought that was a standard across all of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again..”
Reviews.Author: LanieEyeMD
Reviews.Content: Perfect location.. Around 20 mins from the Changi airport.. Taxi will cost you S$10-15.. 30 sec walk to the Lavander station of the MRT. On your way to the station, there's a 24 hour food court with tons of choices, and best of all, cheap! Taxis are also readily available at the hotel lobby.. Rooms are small, but very comfy.. 42" flat screen tv, hair dryer (check the drawer!), complimentary coffee and water.. Small fridge and safe.. Wasn't able to check out the restaurant since we didn't get breakfast with our room. Booking thru Asiatravel for more than 2 nights will get you free wifi access (w/c ordinarily costs S$10). The staff were extremely courteous and accommodating.. They allowed us to check in at 1030am even if they were fully booked.. Request for a street view if possible... ;)

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel - Dont expect too much from breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Unusualme
Reviews.Content: The best part of V Hotel Lavender is that it is right above the MRT. You can just come out of the hotel and hop on the train. I was a little taken aback with the crowd in the lobby when I entered the hotel. Turns out that there were a lot of checkouts on a weekend and there were tourist parties waiting for coaches or taxis. You will be greeted with a big rack full of luggage right at the elevators. Surprise that they don't maintain a different room for stacking luggage. The hotel staff were courteous and provided an early check-in without any extra charge. It was a pleasant surprise as I walked in at least 4 hours ahead of the check-in time. Rooms are quite neat. You will be lucky if you get a city view room as compared to the one where you would be staring out of the window of one tower directly at the windows on the other tower. The breakfast is quite routine. I, being a vegan, had only about 3-4 varieties to choose from. The checkout was fast - very fast. For the rates they offer rooms at, I will consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel above Lavender MRT station”
Reviews.Author: awesome_world2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice in October 2011 at this hotel for stopovers. The first stay was for only 1 night. Room was was clean and comfy. I don't think the room is as small as what most people have described, and it's Singapore after all (where land is scarce and expensive)! The only problem was the bathroom because there was a small gap on the shower doors, causing the water to splash out of the shower door. There is also a small gap between the shower door and the floor so the water was also coming out from that gap as well, leaving the bathroom mat very wet. Also, there was no minibar on the room. On my second stay in October 2011, about 1 1/2 week later, I stayed for 2 nights and we were given a slightly better room. This room has a minibar, but the minibar is not working because it's not cold! The bathroom is better because the gap between the shower doors was sealed, but there was still a gap between the shower door and the floor! Overall though, this hotel is located at a very convenient location because it's almost above Lavender MRT station (and only about 20 min train ride from Changi airport) and there is also 24hr food court, Wendy's and convenience store right outside the hotel. The hotel is also clean because it doesn't have carpet and I really enjoyed the lavender scented shampoo, gel and lotion provided. The only thing that they should improve about their rooms is definitely the bathroom if they can just seal the gaps to prevent the water from splashing out. I will stay at this hotel again for their location and their reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a Stopover”
Reviews.Author: MikeDav
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located by Lavender SMTR station and the staff were very efficient. The room was clean but a little on the small side. This didn't matter too much as we were only there for thi night. Plenty of food options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: tworns
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location with a 24 hour food court in the premises and a subway station just a few steps away from the front door of the hotel. There is also a currency exchange business outside of the hotel so over-all, the location could not be any better. Taxi is also easy to take if you need one. The rooms and bathroom are small. They are clean and comfortable. We are practically out most of the day sightseeing so we are okay with the size of the room. There is no wi-fi and you have to pay for internet access. Staff is always ready to assist with anything you need. The only negative about this hotel is when the tour groups arrive between 5-9PM. The hotel lobby is filled to capacity with human beings and suitcases. And good luck using the elevator...it will take you forever...And the noise when the hotel lobby is filled to capacity is something that only one must never endure!!!The hotel management should develop a system checking-in tour groups such us only one person to check-in these groups and get the keys while the rest wait in their tour bus. This will minimize the crowding within the hotel lobby. Anyway, just a thought and a suggestion.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room, nice view, no free wi-fi! BOO!”
Reviews.Author: Sam E
Reviews.Content: Location is GREAT! It's just above the SMRT Lavender station which makes it very convenient. The staff are very friendly, they greet you with a smile and helpful also. We checked in at the 15th floor so the view was very beautiful. The room was quite small for 3 people but it's still ok. Sheets were clean, but you have to advise the housekeeping to change the sheets. Also, make a mark like maybe draw an X mark on the tag of the sheet so you know if they really changed them. What I didn't like about the hotel was that there was no free wi-fi :-( You have to pay $10/24 hrs and that sucked. Because some other cheap inns and hotels offered free wi-fi, but a more expensive hotel like V Hotel doesn't. Buffet breakfast was okay during the first 2 days. But because we stayed for 5 days, it became boring and dull because they don't change the menu. So imagine, for 5 days we ate the same things: fruits, hashbrown, noodles, soup, milk & cereals, ham, hotdog, etc. There were only a few choices so we were really hoping for a change. But overall, our stay was okay and I still recommend this place. We booked through booking.com and it came out a little cheaper :-)

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic room!!”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooners f
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the V Hotel Lavender last week for 4 nights. The position is quite good, the metro station is really 1 minute walk. Down the hotel is full of restaurants also opened 2hrs a day. The hotel is constantly packed with people. The room is SO small we really felt trapped in it!! The bathroom is really nothing special, with NO plugs in it!! We had to dry our hair in the room and I do not know how the staff expects men shaving with no plugs... We only had TWO towels for two people. Not to be suggested. Maybe better spending a little more but finding a better solution.

Reviews.Title: “Best For North Indian- Graet Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: prashantchauhan
Reviews.Content: Its Brand Huge New property in Little India..Good Hotel And Service....Premier Highest Category has not much difference from Base room but its best in space....over all good experience we will sure come back....

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: DeepBan
Reviews.Content: Spanking new hotel - wonderful location - somewhat impersonal Positives - 1. Clean rooms and halls 2. Professional staff 3. Great location right on top of the Lavender station 4. 24X7 food court just below 5. Decent gym 6. Wonderful view of Kallang River from room 1527 Negatives - 1. Commoditized services - somewhat impersonal though not impolite 2. No privacy or make-my-room tags available 3. Housekeeping can happen anytime in the daytime 4. Very small rooms - claustrophobic 5. Lobby always cluttered with tourists on package tours 6. Porters charge 1SGD per bag Will probably stay again there but not without looking for alternatives. Definite value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good room”
Reviews.Author: Arun87
Reviews.Content: The best thing about V Hotel is location, location and location. It is right on lavender MRT station and this accessibility to public transport is probably the reason for it's high demand. The lobby staff were courteous and helpful. However they couldn't manage much individual attention as the place was mobbed with tourists for the holiday season. Checking in was a painless affair. The was however no bell boy to help us to the room and we managed on our own. The lift is a very tricky part and one could often find themselves waiting for 15 minutes for the lift to arrive. The room itself is SMALL. That is the most striking thing about the room. But look closely and you will realize that though it is small, it is very ergonomic and makes good use of space. Though on this case it would look overly judicious of them especially with the rates they charge per room. The bathroom is similarly small. However the rooms were decently furnished and stocked. It was very clean and spotless. The bed was big and comfortable. The view from the window was very nice and the stay was comfortable and getting adjusted to the small size was painless. Breakfast is usually included with the room and served pool side. The dining area of the hotel was on a side terrace of the building and the view was spectacular. Breakfast was a mix of continental and local specialities. Quality of food was easily 5 star.You also have a decent sized pool and gym on the same floor. The hotel has very good aesthetic taste and the designs are rich in quality if not quantity. This maybe a unique difference from other 4 star properties that people maybe accustomed to. Overall it was a pleasant stay, but not the kind which would attract me for a second stay if I can help it.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel for the Business Person”
Reviews.Author: WillyFernandes
Reviews.Content: This was a very good value for money hotel. It is advisable to book room + breakfast. Location is very convenient since the MRT (railhead) is just below the building. Lots of eatery choices in and around the area. Rooms are very clean (Hotel is quite new - will be good if it is maintained over a period of time). Bathing area in bathroom is very small so a Big Person may find it inconvenient. Room space is utilised exceptionally well. Not too many enetrtainment channels on TV.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: shivani_saraf
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel has never ever heard of the term 'hospitality'. I am so dissapointed with this hotel...and its definately not cheap....feels like such a rip off. I stayed there for 4 nights. We are a family of 5 people so we had two rooms. The triple occupancy room was still ok but my parents room didn't have any view - there was a wall rite outside their room window. The rooms are like matchboxes and the bathrooms are even smaller. The toileteries they provide are really crappy. The staff and service is horrible. The breakfast menu was the same for all the 4 days that we stayed with not even one new item. If you are a veggie don't bother eating the breakfast in the hotel. The juice was watery and they have no options at all for veg breakfast. The restaurant manager got into a fight with one of the guests for one slice of bread during breakfast!!! Yeah you read that correct...for one slice of bread. Never ever will i stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Lizzie
Reviews.Content: Stayed as an overnight trip. Loved, did I say loved? Let me repeat, loved the location. Able to easily access green/red MRT line so no complaints. Even took the bus jsut for the fun of it. Not that diffcult to find and taxi's are always available. Room price was ok (heard that they've jacked up the price by now). Everything was nice and clean in the hotel. Took the deluxe room. Nice view although having a tiled window-sill seating area is not really that useful. Used it to place my luggage instead. Be prepared that the normal sized room would feel a little tight- one person lane only. The bathroom was cleverly tucked away. The shower area was super tight! I knocked my elbows a few times while trying to scrub my body. Wished the management would install ventilation fan in the bathroom. Water pressure was good but the steam had nowhere to escape except to the bedroom. Wireless Internet is SGD10 for 24 hours service. Oh well... I was about to sleep when a cockroach came from behind the bed. Made me wonder why would there be one at 6 floors above ground and in a new hotel to boot? Was too tired and leaving the next day so couldn't be bothered. Never saw the fella again. You don't really need to take breakfast in the hotel as there is a food court- Kopitiam. But items are pricey and I don't find the food very tasty. They charge you for putting less ice in your juice. What-tha? Bakery had some nice stuff, DailyFresh was there too... I would definitely stay again at this place, for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: Merlinwiz2k
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern hotel. Service was excellent, staff checked us in early (9am) with no fuss. Rooms are very compact but with everything you'd expect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Alanm63
Reviews.Content: Positioimed over the MRT Lavender station we rarely needed to use any other transport. The hotel is fairly new and very clean. The rooms and bathroom are a little small but very well designed. We spent 6 nights here and were very happy. Some of the service is not fantastic but not bad either, just simple. You get what you pay for and a little more here. Has gym. Pool, restaurant, not that we ate there. Our travel agents accom package in our trip was $1800 for 4 nights, V Hotel was about $900 for 6 nights, money well saved. Would recommend this hotel if your not the big 5 star buff. Also not so good for families with small children as I don't think they have connecting rooms. Hotel is also very easy to get to and from the airport by MRT. Just remember that the MRT starts at 0530 hours if you have an early flight out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Mike204
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location was great because it was literally on top of Lavender metro station, and from there a couple of stops to the city centre. Near the metro is a bakery and some food outlets which came in useful as the hotel didn't offer breakfast with our room. Our room was small but nice and clean, with aircon, tv and a view of a brick wall from the window. Unfortunately our room was near the lifts and we were woken up several times during the night by people returning to their rooms which meant that we never got a good night sleep. For the money we paid we had expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but good location”
Reviews.Author: aus_isis
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small. Listed over met transport so easy access to trains and buses. Not a resort hotel, just a bed. Staff were helpful. Pool but not heated. Breakfast so_so.

Reviews.Title: “Barely the essentials”
Reviews.Author: Totoro1984
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 6 nights in a premier room. We initially chose the hotel for it's location and affordable cost as Singapore is an expensive city. We had read reviews ( most were negative) and after looking at pictures we decided to take a risk, I wish we hadn't ! The positives: The hotel is in an excellent location, right on top of the lavender mrt and on the line for the air port which is very cheap , safe and simple to navigate. There are many resterants and some are 24 hours or open early and close late and one station away at bugis there are a plethora of food choices. The hotel lobby is clean though there always seemed to be racks of bags in the lobby obviously of people waiting to check in or out. The rooms are clean but this is where the positives end... The negatives: The hotel staff are unhelpful and as the hotel is extremely busy, the staff barely have time to assist with additional enquries. When we arrived our tv remote didn't work and it took a few hours and 2 phone calls to have it replaced. The rooms are very small and the shower is barely big enough for one person. For some reason the hotel provides shampoo, conditioner, body liquid but no soap for hand washing!? There is no iron or hair dryer available and the rooms are very basic. The breakfast is not very appetizing and often it takes the staff some time to replace certain items when they run out. The elevators are very slow and busy , we often found that by the time it arrived there was a group of 15 people waiting to get in. If you are planning to visit Singapore I would suggest spending a little bit extra and go to a better hotel. If you do decide to use v lavender, don't expect too much!

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean.”
Reviews.Author: RhendTsai
Reviews.Content: The room is small but very clean, but you have to request to front desk if you want them to clean your room.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: H P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights for medical checkup. I tried to find hotel rooms in Orchard area but almost all of them had rates approx. S$300 for weekdays until I found this hotel V Lavender from Octopus Travel. Room is pretty small comparable to some Ibis hotel but I could manage since my activity was mostly outside the hotel room.. Plus -The rates is half of most hotel around orchard area for weekdays (for weekend better choose other hotel) - Location is right above Lavender MRT and they have food court around the MRT station Minus - The room is not soundproof, we can hear outside very clearly. - Yes the bathroom is tiny especially the shower box I think this hotel is popular for tourist from mainland China as a tour group.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Aryanie
Reviews.Content: Its very strategic hotel, very close with MRT station lavender.quite easy to find foods but the room is too small fe the superior room even only for 2 person and the breakfast soo standard.

Reviews.Title: “Lavender MRT is the only redeeming feature”
Reviews.Author: ProfGary
Reviews.Content: Barely a 3 star hotel, this has the feel of very cheap lodgings that have been renovated. The rooms are just average. We paid for 'superior with breakfast' and had a room that looked, excitingly, into other rooms (50% of the rooms would be like this). On arrival, even though we booked directly with the hotel on its website, we were required to pay the full cost of the stay in advance - backpacker mentality of the management! The lobby was filled with left luggage most of the time, corridors were not carpeted and very noisy at night, lots of screaming kids and also loud adults from particular countries. Breakfast was less than average, so we ate there only once. Our room had an empty minibar, no soap (a first for us). Didn't try the restaurant, but it had pizza, pasta - like a motorway rest stop. There is indifferent Internet, for a fee in advance. The only good thing? Hotel sits atop Lavender MRT, so escape was quick and easy. If you are a teen and like to shout, or are parents with small children, it may be ok, but for everyone else, steer clear! There are much better, similarly priced hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Proximity to rail station a plus”
Reviews.Author: TONY S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located next to Lavender MRT (rail) station, and is between downtown Singapore and Changi Airport. The convenience this provides gives the V Hotel Lavender a considerable advantage. The hotel opened in mid 2011, so at the time of writing (October 2011) facilities are modern, clean and functioning, the air-conditioner set at a comfortable temperature, the shower / toilet very good, and the bed excellent. There is a large-screen television, with access to BBC and CNN. The so-called 'Superior' room was fairly small, but adequate. Meals are listed as being available, but there was no action in the dining room the evening I stayed. the menu for room service meals is prominently displayed, so food must be available. i chose to eat at a nearby food court. The plastic card issued on arrival in lieu of a conventional key is needed both for the door of your room, and for the elevator; ask how to use it before leaving the reception desk. The price is in the 'Moderate' range for Singapore hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Literally the Worst Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: P S
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, dark, and dirty. The internet, which you have to pay for, is too slow to even load a web page. The service is non existent. When I asked them to send a cup and a fork to my room they refused unless I ordered something, even after I spoke with the manager, Jeremiah. The TV has 10 stations and no dvd or movie options. It is full of tour groups. Avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Top Value for Budget Travelers”
Reviews.Author: barnabusbear
Reviews.Content: The Hotel V Lavender is built over the Lavender Metro Station 2 stops from Raffles on the main city line from Changi airport. The metro ticket from Changi is only $2.90, and $1.00 of this is refunded when the ticket has been used and recycled. Ticket machines are user-friendly, even for senior travellers like us. The metro is clean, safe and fast, avoiding traffic delays, under-cover all the way from airport to hotel, well sign-posted,with travalators, escalators and lifts at every stop. There is one easy change across the platform 2 stops from Changi.(Tip .. you need coins or notes up to $5 denomination). For stopovers and holidays I can thoroughly recommend this hotel. We booked through Venere.com for a total of 184 Euros for 2 nights for a double superior room, inclusive of all local taxes. Cheap for Singapore ! Hotel rooms are clean, modern, compact, no-frills, but there is ample space for luggage on the window-seat, tea and coffee facilities, complimentary bottled water,small fridge, daily servicing and big TV (BBC news). Enormous pool and leisure area on the 4th floor, pleasant welcoming staff with excellent English. Because of the late evening departure of our flight, we were given extended check-out, luggage storage, and use of the pool area until we left. For an excellent budget breakfast option,right beside the Hotel lobby is a fresh fruit stall and a bakery, a "Wendy's" for western food, and a busy local food restaurant as well as a convenience store stocking beer, drinks and snacks. Just 500 metres away is an extensive and lively food court. Minor down-sides were noisy guests in the corridors, and no bedside light controls. Also, very large people may be challenged getting in and out of the small shower-box.

Reviews.Title: “Good...”
Reviews.Author: kalaks
Reviews.Content: As said by other reviews,the rooms were quite small... but v.comfortable. Excellent location-V.close to MRT station. V.clean and tidy. Got room in 6th floor with a big window --so the view was excellent. Room service was good. The staffs were v.helpful and poilte. would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: BirkdaleTourist
Reviews.Content: A good priced Hotel with instant access to Lavender MRT station down stairs. Being Avery new hotel, the rooms are modern with a small fridge, Flatscreen TV, safe in the cupboard. The bathroom is compact but adequate. Rooms are not really well soundproofed. One night we had other people making noises in the hallway and became very rowdy after 11:30pm. Rooms were kept very clean by housekeeping staff. Room is compact but for the length of time spent in the room and price still a good choice. We paid $10 a day for Wifi access that kept logging out every 5 minutes. No Hotel book in our room with information on Hotel. Break as area is just a made up area every morning. $20 for buffet breakfast bu good luck getting a table. Swimming pool on 4th floor. Pool is always in the shade. Counter staff great. We were in our room by 0900. No light switch to turns lights off near the bed was a bit unusual.

Reviews.Title: “Location fine, but...”
Reviews.Author: Richy_L99
Reviews.Content: Compared to all other offerings in busy october, this hotel seemed to have it all. On arrival, no porter to carry luggage. One found eventually. He attended to door and quickly left, not showing room operations (VERY poor for Singapore). Room is shoe-box size, slightly above Hotel 81 size, which flood the lowest end market. Overall, at the price, a great disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad !!”
Reviews.Author: Vineetyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 days on level 13 Room 1329 and on all 4 days our room was cleaned without asking even once,the housekeeping did its job nicely.The check in process took less than 5 mins,also the hotel staff took care of the luggage(4 big cases and 4 small) from the cab to our room(and vice versa when we checked out) without asking for a single cent.We didn't had any troubles sleeping, the beds were comfy and there was no disturbance.Ours was a triple room so the two little kids could sleep separately without disturbing us.The aircon was working efficiently and we could set the temperature.The room size was small but manageble,We actually joined the two beds removing the table in between which created a lot of space on one side enough to hold our 4 big suitcases.There is a wardrobe which has a little safe as well, some of the bags went on top of the warrobe.The TV had a nice collection of channels including australia network(we are from australia so loved it),BBC and a kids cartoon channel as well.The bathroom is very small but functional, the size is just 2.5m X 1.5m out of which the shower occupies 1m x 1m,the rest occupies the basin and a commode,so a bit tight on space there,but overall not too bad experience as we only came back to our hotel to sleep spending the whole day out.The 24 food court downstairs caters mainly to people who like chinese/korean food,there is a wendy's restaurant as well but we found it quite average.So the food options are quite limited.The lavender station is downstairs but if travelling with kids taxi is the best option as it costs the same if you are going to nearby places.Overall my experience was good with this hotel and not disappointing as i thought it would be,after reading so many negative reviews.I would say it was value for money as I couldn't find a similar accomodation anywhere in expensive singapore with 1 Queen bed and 1 small bed for $160 AUD per night.We got our booked through Ratestogo.com.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location not too excellent on the wallet”
Reviews.Author: mayarchy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August 2011 for 2 nights to catch a concert in Singapore. I chose it because of the location (it's right on top of the MRT) plus it's quite new so I figured the rooms would be in good condition. Usually I'd opt for a hostel but I felt like treating myself a little. I arrived before check-in time but they were nice enough to let me into my room at "no extra charge". I got room "666" which to me was fine if not a fun novelty number (maybe that's why the room was available early cause no one wanted to stay in it?) Anyway, when I entered the room it had this really bad sewer smell which was there for pretty much the first night I was there and was definitely the plumbing. Despite the bad smell, I felt really well rested on the beds. They lacked an alarm clock and lights by the bed - but I just used the light from the TV to guide me at night. I paid quite a bit for the room - but the experience with the concert and the peope I met in Singapore made up for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Travaller_c
Reviews.Content: Wont complain much about the room size of this hotel as it is budget hotel. We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. We had terrible experience on the hotel rooms cleanliness. The housekeeping didnt even clean our room for the entire stay. Hotel's phone for the room is useless as nobody answer the call for housekeeping, room services and even front desk. When we made the report, the management tried to argue and denial the argument that their housekeeping did not perform their job.
