Room was not clean for 2 days and towel was not changed for two days and the toilet actually stink after a while as their bathroom is cramped and the sanitary system was not welly construct. The hotel management promise to give us a reply or feedback for the incident but we yet to see any reply from there and it was a month ago. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms quite small but modern”
Reviews.Author: Hong C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located above the Lavender subway station. It has a 24HR food court for late night cravings. We stayed in a triple room (one double bed and one single bed) and it is quite small for three people. The bathroom felt cramped as well. The room was modern and in good shape though. No freebies here. You have to pay for the internet in the lobby and no free wi-fi in the room either. The staff was adequate. Didn't quite receive the Asian hospitality that we got in Vietnam, Malaysia, and Indonesia. I would stay here again only if I'm alone. Otherwise I would find a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Not for families”
Reviews.Author: Littlepsu123
Reviews.Content: Hotel was only ok. We stayed at the hotel during the 2011 Formula 1 in September, and here is our list of the things that we didn't like about the hotel/room. First, our room was very small especially for 2 adults and 1 teenager. The bathroom was very small, shower had a very tiny space to move around and no closet space for luggage(s). Housekeeping was hit or miss when cleaning our room, especially when refilling the toiletries. The bed was not very comfortable; had to asked for extra pillows - housekeeper was not too happy about that special request. Now the good things: hotel was modern, location was good and convenient with the metro being just right outside the the hotel, 24 hour food court also right outside the hotel and there's a few other local restaurants and bakeries as well. Now as far as the hotel staff, for the most part they were friendly but not overly pleased to be there; perhaps they were tired of the Formula 1 visitors. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel for families with children, but probably more suited for a single/double business/transient visitors only.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: ktkonduri
Reviews.Content: The V Hotel is located near Little India. The hotel staff is mainly the Chinese(the mongoloids). They speak English pretty well. The rooms are very well furnished. There was no restaurant when i went in June 2011, so i had to eat at Mustafa centre. Mustafa center is 0.9 km or approx. 0.5 mile from there. Mustafa is good place to do Jewel shopping. You get wi-fi in the hotel on a per day charge. The swimming pool and gymnasium(a very small one) are good. Massage chairs are also available.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: minili
Reviews.Content: After a very pleasant trip to Laos and Thailand , we spent two days in Singapore . We chose V Hotel as it is new and convenient to get around the city. The hotel is ok , the room is so cramped that there is not enough space for two bags and to comfortably move around. As we were only there for 2 nights , that wasn't a problem. But we were horrified with the cold and brusqueness of the front desk staff, when we checked in and checked out. After paying on arrival, we were not given instructions on where to find the lift, our room... and when I realised a receipt wasn't given to me after I paid cash, I went back to the same guy at the front desk and asked if he had forgotten . He replied coldly that I will be given one when we check out. On the day of departure, we handed in the keys and was amazed when I was told "Ok you may go" I couldn't believe it, he had 'forgotten' the receipt again! In fact, this a different guy but the mannerism was exactly the same as the first guy we had on arrival.He did not apologise for not giving me a receipt and on top of that he looked as if I was asking too much. I've never come across this kind of attitude from any of the many hotels I've been to. Such a shame for Singapore, a city which excels in many things!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Petra436
Reviews.Content: Perfect for the budget conscious! Rooms - a bit small but you have all the necessities - small refrigerator, TV (not much english channels), towels, shampoo, complimentary bottled water, hangers, bedroom slippers, blow dryer, desk, phone, mugs for coffee/tea. Beddings and pillows were OK Staff - Friendly front desk. Check in / check out was a breeze. They helped us with our airport shuttle. Our rooms were cleaned everyday Facilities - Hotel has a gym, lounge area and pool, computer stations in the lobby (not free) Location - very practical. Hotel is near a bus stop and above the Lavender MTR station. Some stores near the hotel - Cheers convenience store, Kopi Tiam Food Court, Wendy's, Bee Cheng Hiang, Bread store (forgot the name) and a nice souvenir shop Wifi - no free wifi, you need to pay SGD 10 per day. Signal is good. Overall, I'm pleased with the hotel. I would stay again in this hotel (i just hope they don't increase their price)

Reviews.Title: “Small Room but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Em H
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in Singapore in a twin room in September 2011. We arrived straight off a 7 hour overnight flight and were able to check in straight away at 8am with no extra charge (so happy!) Staff were friendly but because the hotel is so huge they always seemed very busy. The room was tiny but neat and clean. As we only stayed 2 nights it was fine, but I would imagine staying longer would have got a bit cramped. Location was fantastic, the Lavender MRT station is just downstairs and there is a big 24 hour food court. We found a supermarket about 5 mins walk away too. We got a cab once from Marina Bay Sands back to the hotel after midnight and it was less than SGD $10. One thing I will say though is that the walls must be really thin, we heard a lot of people in the hallway and it woke us up early one morning. We didn't check out the pool or other facilities so can't comment on those!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a quick jaunt to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: lolainlondon
Reviews.Content: The V hotel is fairly new and relatively cheap, therefore, it has been discovered by the tourbus companies and they have taken it over! The lobby is quite small, and the locale nondescript, but it is actually a very convenient hotel. Located right at the MRT, it makes it easy to get around Singapore on a budget. Considering that I booked the hotel last minute it was a very good rate (for singapore hotel standards). There are a lot of small stands nearby, good for a quick breakfast or late night snack. The rooms itself were tiny, and I mean tiny by any standards. That said it was very clean and had everything you needed. I only stayed one night, and I think this hotel is perfect if you are on a layover (especially since it's on the MRT line that leads to the airport) or if you have a short business trip to Singapore. All in all I was not unsatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location-That is all!”
Reviews.Author: KelvinPg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is apprx 3 minutes to Lavender MRT station. That is best about this hotel. Kopitiam is right behind this hotel. A few atms outside Kopitiam. I booked a superior double room. The room was small but clean. The washroom is small too. Air-con did not function well. One moment it was cold the next it was not. Bugis is next to Lavender MRT. Next to Bugis is City Hall interchange. From there Orchard is just a few stations away. One word about this hotel: STRATEGIC. Price was not cheap. I would say reasonable. Wifi was not free!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jezsta
Reviews.Content: Well singapore is expensive for hotels/ we paid £70 per night, and from what we could see this was ok value. cant fault at all. lacks character completely and room was small. but extremely clean, good staff, great shower, lovely pool with a fantastic view. the hotel is RIGHT ON TOP of lavender metro station!! 2 stops to down town!! pretty good breakfast included...

Reviews.Title: “Great location but failing otherwise”
Reviews.Author: fleeceylauren
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and they couldn't find our booking. They didn't explain this though, and stood typing tings into the computer for ages without speaking to us. I looked to my friends who were checking in next to us and they were having the same problem. We didn't book on the same day but both booked through Ebookers. No idea what the problem was due to the lack of communication from them but we got a key eventually! The room was, as we expected from the reviews, small. This didn't bother us at all as there was a large ledge running the length of the window where we could put our luggage- what more space did we need?! They provided tea and coffee and two bottles of water. The room was smart looking. We overlooked the other wing and down to the swimming pool. We couldn't work out if people in the rooms opposite could see in, we think they could which meant closing the curtains more than normal which made the room feel smaller. Breakfast wasn't included so we went to the outlets they mentioned on their website. These are in the passage way between the hotel and the station so very close but not really suitable for a western breakfast. We ended up getting some pastries in the 7/11 near the Lavender Food Court one day, and ate in Wendy's in the passageway on the other. Neither memorable breakfasts! We sat out by the pool one night, there was a nice wicker "snug" which was nice for 6 of us to chill out in. Didn't use the pool but it looked nice. Major disappointment was that on the second day we came back to get changed at 4.30pm and the room still hadn't been cleaned. This meant no water or tea re-fills and when we asked they said they would charge!! They did eventually replace these free of charge when they did clean, although I have no idea what time they eventually came! There was also no wifi and they said there would be a charge. I've just checked and there is no mention of a charge on their website. A friend booked the same price room through a different website and their confirmation said the room included wifi, ours didn't mention at all so couldn't argue really. But......the location is amazing, literally above the MRT station and just a few stops to downtown. Is also on the same line as Bugis so we could go to the night market and get home safely and quickly (one stop away). If you are on a short trip I think I would still overlook the problems we had as the location outweighed them.

Reviews.Title: “A huge hotel, a bit impersonal...”
Reviews.Author: pwelch
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent, very easy to find if travelling on the MRT from the airport. The lobby is impressive, when checking in I was informed of the charge for wifi access. I explained that my booking included wifi access, this was rectified. The room was very small, good air-conditioning, a small bathroom and no soap!! Breakfast is not included, which is surprising given the rate. It was completely impossible to get any information from the hotel about city tours. They simply referred me to an unmanned private tour desk, which was offering high end packages. I think you could find slighty better value in Singapore...

Reviews.Title: “Only good for those on tight budget”
Reviews.Author: csg001
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel when it just opened up in June 2011, as it represented fantastic value for a Singapore hotel at the rate it charged. However in hindsight I should have gone for a better hotel and suck up the extra cost, since I was travelling with my partner. The pros of this hotel is no doubt reflected in just about every review on Tripadvisor - its location and its price - but the cons far exceeds any benefits you would otherwise receive if you are travelling for a relaxing holiday. Here's just a short list: - TINY rooms, even smaller bathrooms - Awful unattentive uncaring staff (who are probably overworked and underpaid) - Worst bed I have slept in, and linen is hard and scratchy, very uncomfortable - Work desk is cluttered with junk, such as the oversized kettle base - No sound insulation, can hear other rooms and the corridor as if the door was open - Aircon was too cold, even on low setting and highest temperature - TV is almost all Bahasa and Hindi language channels (guess that's the intended market of the hotel) - Slow internet using buggy login style system that logs you out randomly The thing that annoyed me the most, which put me into a negative mindset regarding the hotel from the first day, I was demanded by the porter to tip for delivering my bags!!! Now don't get me wrong, I'm happy to tip the porter, however it just came as a shock to me as I'm not used to having to give tips for baggage delivery (no, I never been to USA). Not only that, the porter insisted at the lobby to take my bags, when I would've been happy to do it myself. Upon arriving in my room, he just throws my backpack onto the work desk, which promptly rolls off and hits the ground, along with all $3000 worth of camera gear in it, to which he just shrugs off. He then nonchalantly says to me "one, two, three bags, three dollars", and sticks his hand out in front of me. No "please", no "thank you", just stands there with his hand out while I'm in shock at 1. my camera gear, 2. this surprise "fee", and 3. his attitude. I handed him $3 as I didn't want to lose my temper and ruin my holiday, but this really made me feel bitter at the service of the hotel. Of course, at check out, I just took my bags down myself, didn't bother calling for the porter just in case I was slugged with some more surprise "fees". I definitely won't choose this hotel again if I'm taking my partner or going for pleasure. This hotel is strictly a business trip "just need a room to sleep in" standard for me, and even at that I'd only choose it if the rates are far better than other options in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean - but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ange P
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean, new, close to MRT, shops, 24 hour food court. I would recommend an overnight stay, no longer as rooms are so small. Beds are hard, which seems to be the norm in Asia. Bathroom is tiny too! I would stay here again on an overnight stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Ok as a stop over hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaciblue
Reviews.Content: I only stayed overnight in this hotel and it seemed ok. It's right on top of the train station so easy to get to if you need. The staff were helpful although they wont do wake up calls- make sure you have an alarm clock with you if you have an early flight! I thought it was a bit odd that there was no information on the hotel or singapore in general in the room- I was glad I'd picked up a map from the airport! The room was quite cold- bring a jumper. The gym/pool seems to close quite early too. On the upside the views from the gym area balcony are really nice. The room was clean and had a safe.

Reviews.Title: “Lavender that does not smell so sweet... when they don't clean your rooms”
Reviews.Author: RuttersRutters
Reviews.Content: I booked a triple room that cost over SG$1000 and we got a tiny room with just two beds to share, no breakfast, the rooms were not cleaned so no clean towels and no soap in the bathroom etc, and our laundry was lost. Really dissapointing! Great location and nice hotel pool. Although the staff were very freindly, management were simply incompetent when trying to solve the slightest of problems. If they hadn't have charged us upon arrival, I would have left and stayed somewhere else. I've been to campsites with better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Singapore and on top of MRT station”
Reviews.Author: ShaunScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Formula One weekend at a cost of $200 Singa a night. For us that was excellent value as a free shuttle bus took us directly to the front gate. Hotel rooms are small but have everything that you need for a no frills place, as having a small room the AC was excellent and nice and cooling, managed a good sleep even though I was sleeping during until lunch time. The hotel has a lovely long pool for getting in a few laps and a small but well appointed gym with nice new machines. Plus as its on top of the MRT station it was 2 stops and you were delivered into city hall which is beside Raffles hotel for only $1. Hotel for people on a budget and want a quite clean hotel this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: DeanKory
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights in Room 1063. That initially wasn't my room though. I requested for a room changed to one with a view of beautiful singapore. The receptionist, Zila was helpful and changed my room to one facing the city of Singapore. It was a great stay! The room wqs cleaned well and the staff were very, very helpful. Special mention to Zila for the overwhelming welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Greast hotel, nice room, poor food”
Reviews.Author: m1ckyg
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I wasn't expecting alot of this hotel, but travelling alone I had few requirements and room size wasn't high on my agenda. Well I was very pleased with what I found, the room was more than big enough, ok not huge, but this is a budget priced hotel in Singapore, and it was modernly and not cheaply decorated and kitted out, clean and everything in order. The hotel itself is run very proffessionally, and you'd have thought walking in you'd come to a more expensive hotel. I can't say much more about the room except I have no issues, even the safe fits a netbook(one of my regular isssues with hotel safes!). Transport is a doddle, I just used taxis the whole time, they are very cheap in Singapore and regularly pull into the hotel drop off point, its all too easy :) My only down marker for this hotel was the restaurant. Its located on the 4th floor on a terrace open to outside which I really liked to be honest, it was a pleasant place to sit in the morning. However the quality of the food was very poor, especially the cooked food. The orange juice was orange squash and there wasn't even a decent selection of fruit. If I went again I would probably not bother with breakfast and go elsewhere. I'd give the room and hotel a 5 and the restaurant a 2. Still excellent value place to say.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but poor maintenance”
Reviews.Author: silveryz80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights during the F1 race weekend. We booked the room through Agoda back in June which was prior to it's opening in July. The rate was reasonable given that it was the F1 weekend. When looking at google map to find our way from the Lavender MRT station to the hotel, the impression was that we had to walk a little bit. When we finally arrived we were pleasantly surprised as the hotel was literally situated above the MRT station which took us about 2-3 minutes to get to after we got off the train. Getting around is not a problem at all with Singapore's excellent MRT system. We got checked in rather quickly and got to our room in no time. Everything in the room is still rather new since it's only less than 3 months old. The bed and pillows are comfortable!! The sheets are nice luxurious hotel standard ones. However when I inspected our towels, I found a strand of hair stuck on one of the towels and it also had a black stain. The safe was also locked and we couldn't use it. We left for lunch and told the reception on our way out to change the towel and also reset the safe. When we got back, the towel was already replaced and the safe was open. In terms of service, I would say it's not bad at all. The only thing I could fault this hotel really is that cleanliness seems to be an issue and you can kind of foresee that it will only deteriorate further in time. The entire hall walkway are tiled with no carpets at all (which means it can get rather noisy when you have a bunch of people talking and laughing loudly in the hallway). I saw a bunch of hair on the floor right outside our room upon checking in and it was still there when we checked out. The management should really beef up on maintaining the overall cleanliness of the hotel if it wants to maintain it's reputation. I would probably check out the latest reviews of the hotel before I would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Do your research.”
Reviews.Author: craulocsol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Aug 28-Sept 1st. First heard of this hotel back in May in a TA discussion. Booked right away prior to the hotel opening in July mainly because of the price & location. Had second thoughts after several poor reviews but didn't cancel coz the pros were much too attractive. I booked directly on their website which offered free internet & was worried that it was no longer free especially since my booking did not specify it. I e-mailed a week before my trip & got a quick reply confirming it was indeed free. Thanks to previous TA reviews I knew exactly what to ask for upon check-in: A room farthest away from the elevator to avoid the noise, room facing towards the street, higher floors, safe, etc. Reception was more than happy to grant my requests & check-in, check-out was a breeze. Room size didn't matter as I was by myself & plan to be out all day anyway. I already brought my own soap coz I know they didn't provide it. Room gets very cold so I brought warm pajamas. Bathroom size not an issue, I've had smaller bathrooms in some European hotels. Bottom line I knew what to expect so I've come prepared. No glitch in room key either. Location indeed saved me a lot of money. Didn't have to take a taxi from the airport, used MRT to all places I had to go which is very cheap. 24 hr Kopitam sold inexpensive & delicious food. A lot of the locals go there too so I met several who recommended things to do & places to go. Didn't have time to use the pool but the area was a nice place to just relax. Used the gym once but it lacked ventilation so the smell really bothered me. It was very tiny & several people were using it at that time so 30 minutes was all I could take. There is a bit of a wait on elevators but not excessive. Reception area gets crowded but they seem to be able to clear them out at a fast speed. I chose to cancel my Sept 9-11 booking though because I found a better deal at another hotel. Will I stay there again? Absolutely if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and excellent facilities.”
Reviews.Author: DandD2319
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated on the MRT when coming from Changi airport, the hotel was simple to get to. Although very busy when we got there due to some kind of sporting event, there were so many staff in administration we were never waiting for anything. They were very helpful in terms of answering our questions about Singapore touring and the pool was lovely (although would be better if there was somewhere allocated to 'sunbathe' as the pool is covered. Located downstairs is a bevvy of interesting eateries (try the bakery across the street for the most amazing cakes you will eat!) which we tried for cheap, and the quick walk to jump on the MRT to get to Clarke Quay etc was brilliant. The room was very small (not much more than a bed) and very dark decor with no natural light, but for only a few days we didn't plan to spend much time in the rooms. We would definately go back to this hotel on another Singapore stop over.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with deficiencies but OK if you are on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: Paul Drinkwater
Reviews.Content: Positives: The hotel is above Lavender MRT station, one stop from Bugis, and hence also easy to get to/from the airport. It is also adjacent to a cheap food centre The hotel has a nice large outdoor pool and as the hotel is recently built facilities are currently in good condition. The rooms have kettles and fridges Negatives: The rooms are small and many superior rooms look directly into other rooms and hence have little privacy if the curtains are open. The rooms have poor soundproofing and one can hear anyone in the corridors. The shower stall is tiny, no soap was provided and there is no plug in the sink. The pillows are of cheap quality. The staff are young and inexperienced.They will charge you $2 per day per piece to leave luggage for more than a day. This hotel would therefore only be OK for a backpacker or someone on a tight budget that accepts the hotel will have deficiencies.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Maz092
Reviews.Content: This hotel is two prong construction building, by this I mean it is two separated building. When booking this hotel request a room located on the outer side, if you get a room on the inside your view will be other rooms. The hotel is located directly on top of the Lavender MRT station, which on the green line that runs directly from the airport. The rooms are very small in size. I booked a twin room and stayed in the room by myself. If there had been another person in the room it would be very difficult to move around without bumping into each other. The bathroom is also very tiny but practical and clean. Breakfast is good nothing special. There is a gym which is also small. Mixed review with the staff, very professional reception staff , other staff rude. I think it’s a Singapore thing, very efficient without personality. The hallway gives a strange feel as one gets the feeling your on the Matrix set. The cubic design gives the impression the hallway never ends. The overall hotel gives a sterile impression without character

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Eva_Dewi_Ahmad
Reviews.Content: its a nice hotel, nice interior , specially the semi outdoor pool. we love the view from our room face to the singapore flyer . our room is triple room, the room is just nice, not so big but okay we are satisfied with that. the best thing over all is the location. which is just right on the Lavender MRT station where you can go everywhere from there. Good and cheap singaporean food is just one step ahead. 24hour food stall (kopi tiam) also there. all the hotel staff also very nice and friendly. I definitely will be back again to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: lizKualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at the hotel. A triple and a double superior. We arrived at the hotel very early, at 5.30am, and were later allowed to check into the triple room at 7am. The superior room was not available at that time as the hotel was running full. We collected our key cards to the second room later in the evening. The hotel is within walking distance from Golden Mile Complex and is conveniently located above the Lavender MRT station. We chose this hotel primarily because it provides easy access to Sentosa. Food is easily available and at the MRT station, you can find a Guardian Pharmacy and 7-11 Convenience Store. The rooms are big enough,not spacious but fine overall. A safe deposit box is available in the closet along with a hairdryer and slippers. Coffee making facility is available in the room as well. Rooms are clean and I do not have any complaint about the lifts. It is definitely a heavy traffic area, so some delays are expected. Overall, it is a good hotel, worth considering and certainly value for money.

Reviews.Title: “More of a Factory than a Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: nohooksbrooks
Reviews.Content: Let me start with positive: the location (the hotel is situated directly above Lavender MRT Station) is excellent, in walking distance to some great restaurants and the rest of the city via the MRT. The V Hotel is also quite new, so is still clean and has modern fitness equipment (albeit limited) and a good pool for swimming lengths (if you can find a lane). On to the negative: I've never seen a busier hotel. Package tours are pushed through this hotel at an alarming rate transforming the lobby into a circus at all times. Even though the place has 6 lifts as I recall, give yourself an extra 10 minutes to get down in the morning. With this volume of customers it's extremely difficult to get access to the staff to make even the most simple of requests. I tried phoning reception several times but never got through. The breakfast is set in a nice, covered outdoor area, but the selection and quality isn't great. The rooms themselves, while clean, are tiny. With two towers, half of the rooms have absolutely no view, other than peering into the rooms in the opposite tower. I was lucky enough to have one of these rooms, so was relegated to having my curtains shut for the entire stay. It's tough to find an affordable place to stay in Singapore, but there are definitely better options than this....

Reviews.Title: “Benefits Outweight Nuisances”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug60982
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 stayed for 4 nights from Aug 26-29, 2011. The benefits are (1) right on top of MRT station close to tourist areas, (2) hawker center next to property, (3) attractive pricing, and (4) triple room available. The nuisances are (1) the elevators are slow and often crowded, (2) service is somewhat inconsistent [1 of 4 days room was not made but was quicky corrected], (3) room is small [but not much different from European hotel rooms], (4) noise insulation not the greatest, and (5) shower stall is small. Given the high hotel room rates in Singapore and the normal practice of charging 50 to 60% for an extra bed in a double room, this hotel offers great value and the positives outweight the negatives. Some travelers have complained about the breakfast. But if you expect eggs made to order, then you should pay accordingly and stay at 4 or 5 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This makes sense”
Reviews.Author: Satyanu
Reviews.Content: We went as family. Initially sceptical. But rooms were small yet cozy and practical. Great value in the otherwise inflated Singapore prices. Lobby was very crowded every time we went down. Obviously a lot of people are seeing value here. Lifts are very annoying as it takes too much of a wait. So I would advice to take a lower floor if view is not important so you can take the stairs. Paid (S$10per day)Internet on iPad was irritating as every couple of minutes you would be required to log in again. Plenty of shops close by and lots to eat. Metro station right below the hotel is a boon. Be ready for crowds during breakfast. Check in process was swift and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Couple of pros, more cons...”
Reviews.Author: superpopjavaan
Reviews.Content: The good thing about this hotel is that it is very close to a MRT station. And breakfast is very cheap at the nearby Kopitiam. But that's it. Now the downside: The walls and the door of the rooms are paperthin. You can hear everything from the neighbours and everything that is going on in the hallways. The rooms are too small for the price you have to pay for them. Most of the times the elevators are very crowded. The swimming pool is located in the middle of the hotel and surrounded by the two fifteen-story-structures this hotel is made of. So the sun cannot reach the swimming pool. Overall, it's not too bad but certainly not good and what I expected for the price we had to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: GiovanniFirenze
Reviews.Content: Given the steep Singapore hotels prices this was a bargain - we booked it on booking.com for about 70€ per night. It is all about location : it sits right on top of Lavender station (hence the name) and it is surronded by a number of places to have a quick meal. The room (deluxe) was clean, on the small side but I've seen smallers ones. The only downside was the bathroom which was tiny at best. Elevators were always readily available. A big plus is the pool and the little fitness center. I would definetely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Bad value for money! Lousy service!”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter-Schweiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights. The rates are very high compared to the room size and the unfriendly staff...this is not 4 star. Not to be recommended! At check-in the receptionist did not tell us anything, we had to ask for everything (when is breakfast, how long the pool is open, etc.). The rooms are very tiny and we had problems to store our luggage and still be able to walk in our bed... Plus points: Nice pool and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Love it...Nice 3.5 Star Hotel With 2 Star Price”
Reviews.Author: SandyMaswari
Reviews.Content: Easy To Find Hotel just Tell/Find Lavender MRT and you will found that Hotel..Good Staff and easy to made a booking room..The Hotel have a Swimming Pool and Gym..The area beetween Hotel it's OK.With 24 hour " Kopi Tiam" Food Court and 7 Eleven served you..Defenetly go back if I go to Singapore again..Thank's Agoda for promo priced.

Reviews.Title: “A good midscale hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Smile92
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for our 1st nights in Singapore. It is conveniently located in the Lavender area, just above the MRT. The access from Changi airport is really easy (+/- 30 minutes on a direct line). This property is VERY big, therefore one should not expect attentive nor friendly service. The staff has too much work to deal with that. Our check-in and check-out were fast and effective, but the smile was always missing. Our standard room was at the very end of one of their long corridors, therefore as quiet as we asked. There was no noise from the room next door. We could only hear the guests walking on the tiled corridors. The room was tiny (15m²), but modern and well equipped (confortable king size bed, flat tv screen, desk, a closet with safe. We lacked of space for our suitcases, so we had to store them by the bedroom's window (by the way we never found a bellboy?). There was no bed lamp, only an hidden neon in the ceiling, which we disliked. The bathroom was also small with only an italian shower, but it did not bother us so much. Overall we cannot complain about the cleanliness. There is no restaurant on the premises but that was not a problem because as you come out of the lobby, there is a dozen of good hawkers of all kinds, as well as a 24hr kopitiam (food court) waiting for you on the way to the MRT. We enjoyed the swimming pool on the third floor which is big and outdoors, even if there was no heated water (it was so hot outside it felt good!). We could easily find fresh towels. There is a tiny fitness room overlooking the pool with a few machines that we did not use. Honestly, we could have stayed longer but it was packed. Considering the price range, this hotel is not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “New, decent value-for-money hotel in overpriced Singapore”
Reviews.Author: shaliwali
Reviews.Content: Given the riduclous prices quoted by Singapore hotels, this was a relatively good deal. I paid 770 USD for a 5 night stay. The positives were: 1) Fantastic location - Just above the Lavandar MRT station which is on the green line and directly connected to the Airport and just two stops away from City Hall. It has a decent food court also on the ground floor which makes meals very easy and relatively cheap. Well known by taxi drivers. 2) Newish hotel. We got there a few hours early and were allowed to check in by 10 am. Fixtures, furnishing are all new so it's quite decent 3) It's got a nice pool on the 4th floor, but the water is sheltered by the building so never really warms up. 4) Right opposite the immigration, in case you want to lengthen your visa :) 5) Walking distance from the Arab quarter Negatives 1) Tiny room, just enough for 2 adults. We had a baby with us so a little more than ideal luggage and a stroller so it was a tight fit. 2) Tiny bathroom - new and nicely appointed by the smallest shower area ever. But its manageable. 3) Internet costs 10 SGD for 24 hrs which is in poor taste Tips Hotel is shaped like an 'H'. Try and get rooms which face the outer side as the inner side rooms have poor views. Rooms have huge windows so it's not that clusterphobic. If you are travelling in groups of 2 or more, take a taxi which i think is cheaper than MRT and less hassle. All in all it was a decent hotel but a tad overpriced, but then if there was one word to describe Singapore, it would be 'OVERPRICED'.

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing was it was close to Lavender MRT”
Reviews.Author: Luce86
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after travelling through Thailand & Malaysia for 2 months, this has to be the worst hotel we stayed in throughout the travels. It is not worth the money, i would pay a little extra & stay somewhere a lot nicer. The front desk staff are not very helpful and quite rude, reception is always full! For the price you pay you dont even get free wifi, you have to pay an extra 10dollars. On entering the room it was small but looked modern. However once we got it & looked it was dirty!!! The shower cubicle is tiny! So if you dont like small spaces you wont enjoy this shower, Bathroom was dirty and smelt funny, the cups provided were thick with dirt. We were in the room when the cleaner came & all she done was give us fresh towels, which stink of bleach. Luckily we stayed here for only 2 nights. Would not return to this hotel. Like the title says the only good thing about this was it was right above the lavender MRT station so you could easily get around.

Reviews.Title: “Very very poor ventilation”
Reviews.Author: dengilo
Reviews.Content: From the moment u enter the lobby area it smells like a hospital!The rooms are really tiny ,again with the ventilation when i do my business in the restroom the whole room stinks.Unless u really tired just need a place to zonk out or crash it perfectly ok.I dare not smoke just for the fear of it stinking the rooms next door too. Every thing that u ever need in a hotel is there just that its small. ,very good location without a doubt.A good reasonably cheap restaurant on the pool level can be a bonus too.Also there should be an option of a small window/small extraction fan in the rooms for clean air to come in without depending on the A/C unit while in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay :)”
Reviews.Author: PerthChelsea_L
Reviews.Content: The whole appearance of the hotel was really nice especially for the price that we paid for our 5 day stay. Our stay was very enjoyable as it was close to the Lavender MRT and a really nice and cheap food strip! We could buy our own breakfast for $2 from a traditional food court or go to Wendys and pay $4. There is also a hairdressers around there which charged me $25 for a wash and blow dry which we got for our special dinner out! The good things about this hotel is that it was modern, cheap, great location, had a good sized swimming pool, free gym, rooms were always clean and if they weren't clean you could ring housekeeping and they would be there quickly. We also got free wi-fi for 2 days when we thought you got charged for it which was $10 per day. The bad things about this hotel were that the lobby was constantly busy, lifts were pretty slow and the concierge wasn't very helpful as he only dealt with one tour company. Whilst we stayed in the hotel my $1600 bag went missing. So I rang the reception and the person that was in charge came to my room within 2 minutes asking what it looked like, how much it was worth etc. This staff member assured me that if the bag was not found he would replace it for me although thankfully it was found in one of the maids locker! Which worried me about my other possessions but luckily they were all there. When the manager found out about our situation the maid that took my bag was fired that evening. The staff were very helpful throughout this situation and it would not put me off staying there again and please don't let this put you off neither! Overall I really enjoyed the time spent in this hotel and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Vhaire S
Reviews.Content: We stayed hee for two nights (one on our arrival, one on our departure). The hotel is fairly new, clean, modern and situated in a location handy for public transport. The hotel is located just minutes from the Lavender train station (direct link to the airport and easy to reach other areas of Singapore). The first room we booked was a good size, the second was smaller but both were clean and modern. The surrounding area to the hotel is busy and safe. I would definitely stay here again on a trip to Singapore. Very handy location. We booked the first rom through expedia but booked the second room at the last minute, direct with the hotel and we got a better deal. The hotel aso has a free bag leaving service for those that have to check out hours before their flight.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but great location”
Reviews.Author: AdriennaVinnie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this fairly new hotel in Lavender for one major reason - it is directly above the Lavender MRT station which is really convenient when you have a family comprising young kids and senior citizens. We opted for a room with 1 double bed and 1 single bed but boy, was the room small! Hardly any room to move about. The bathroom was also small, just enough room to take a shower and that's it. I wondered why we didn't get any newspapers during our 3 day stay there? Room service and housekeeping was good - they changed our towels daily and replenished the coffee and tea. We got a room on the 8th floor which gave us a beautiful view of the Rochor Canal and ICA Building opposite the hotel. The hotel also allowed us to store our luggage at their lobby after we checked out. Food is easily available too, with a 24-hour coffeeshop just around the corner from the hotel. Also available was a bakery, snack shops, tea shops just in case you get hungry. We heard of the pool and gym on the 4th floor but never had time to check these out.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but worth staying somewhere else and paying a little extra”
Reviews.Author: chrismartinuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated just above Lavender MRT, and is just down the road from the Golden Mile Complex bus terminal. They are the plus sides. The hotel is obviously much nicer than a hostel, and has a good pool, but this doesn't make it value for money. Our room was dirty, and remained dirty even after they supposedly re-cleaned it! The staff weren’t particularly friendly or helpful either. The hotel just didn't have a very nice feel to it. A few weeks later we stayed in Singapore again, and paid £30 extra for a much better hotel. I would advise you do the same.

Reviews.Title: “great price and location for uber expensive singapore”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: Booked via Expedia for 92$. Was concerned with early reviews of the hotel being cheap and dinky, but when I entered my room, was happy to see a nicely appointed if rather smallish room. The furniture is a bit on the tacky side (the bed reminded me of an Ikea bed and kept sliding away from the wall, as I leaned against it to watch TV). The bathroom is small but clean, shower only, and asian derriere cleaner next to toilet bowl. Free internet was provided and the LCD TV provided many good channels. The biggest pro about this place is its located atop Lavender Station and Kopitiam food court (open 24 hour a day). Breakfast seemed decent for 20S$ but i opted for the cheap traditional breakfast for less than 2$ at Kopitiam. The pool is huge and great for laps. There is a little glass enclosed gym in front of it with good equipment. Overall, if your not too fussy, this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Not for every traveller, but a functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: lee27al
Reviews.Content: Pros : Food court, ATM, quick snack joints and Lavender MRT on ground floor of hotel, All relevant ammenities in room, good looking rooms Cons : The smallest shower I've ever come across in my travels, not a good flow of cabs (taxis) as it's not yet a very known hotel. Walls of the rooms quite thin, so you better have quiet neighbours, internet could be dodgy during some hours It's not the hotel for every one. Its probably best suited for those stopping over in Singapore for a day or two, as its relatively cheaper than the better hotels in Bugis and the rooms look appealing. The customer service, well ... lets say average. They are functional but will not go out of their way to assist you. Probably best not to take the breakfast at the hotel, because downstairs there are a plenty of choices in the food court at very cheap prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: egchua
Reviews.Content: GREAT - easy commute, near Lavander station - very comfortable bed GOOD - customer service (check-in at 12midnight was fast even though there were a lot of people) - new rooms, space was big enough for two - good value for money BAD - our room wasn't cleaned even though we put the make up room sign

Reviews.Title: “Ticked the boxes”
Reviews.Author: tinytravellers
Reviews.Content: After 2 nights at V Lavender with my husband on a stopover, I wouldn't hesitate to return for a similar length visit. The location for travelers passing through is unbeatable in that the hotel is directly above the Lavender MRT and a quick, easy train trip from Changi. Smilarly, it make getting around the city very easy. Checking in and out was very quick, straightforward and pleasant and a request gave us a late checkout of 12pm. The 24 hour food court directly above the MRT meant breakfast was an easy task. We stayed in the slightly larger room, which was fine for 2 days and didnt feel cramped. The bathroom and especially the shower was very compact but quite usable. Bed was comfortable and despite packing earplugs as a precaution against the expected noise, they were not needed. The room was spotless and all amenities were new. My only complaint is that the room wasn't serviced at all during our stay. We met a housekeeper in the hall at about 7pm and asked for some fresh towels which were provided, and this was absolutely fine for us (i dont really need the room to be made up if only staying 2 nights). Of course, this may irritate some. And on a longer stay it would concern me. But on this occasion it didn't detract from the otherwise good amenties and service we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: reedjal
Reviews.Content: I pick this hotel because it's located on MRT station. Why I said that way, coz the hotel building was precisely on upper ground the MRT. As a tourist I found many advantages of this hotel, you can find food court next to the hotel and it's cheaper than you could find in orchard area! (eg. Ananas cafe) Bottom line is : best value hotel on the area

Reviews.Title: “Good location, easy accessibilty...”
Reviews.Author: Preet_bijal
Reviews.Content: however bathrooms are too small and if some noisy kids are staying on your floor than the soundscan be easily heard...the biggest plus point is that it is on top of Lavender MRT station and near to the CBD....

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: rocking_pony
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location (food court and MRT station just next door), nice pool, rather clean rooms (but could be cleaner), great city view from upper floors, big windows in rooms, cheaper than other hotels in Singapore. Cons: No breakfast, very small rooms (have seen rooms this size only in Tokyo), only one towel per person and when we asked for another one - we didn't get any, no spoons (!) in rooms (you can BUY one for 2 dollars!!) so my tip is: if you want to make some tea or coffee, then take plastic spoon from the food court downstairs ;) And the worse is that guests urinate in the pool shower cubicles - I know this is not the hotel's fault but... it's still smelly :( Maybe this is because the showers are in a completely different place than toilets? It was a really unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect more than a budget hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: CasaEstrach
Reviews.Content: We, a family with a teenager spent 2 nights (11th and 12th August) at V Lavender. We chose the hotel because it was the only acceptable price for a 4* in the city and we could not read any review because it was open the same week we booked it in internet. We were expecting a very new hotel. The location is excellent when arriving from the airport because it is located on the metro station Lavender. The hotel was really busy all the days we were there, a member of the personnel carried our luggage to our room but he asked us to pay for it ( by piece of luggage! ) It is the first time I see it. The room was really tiny with a double bed that was no more than 135 cm wide and a single bed for our son. There was not much room for us to stand up. The room did not look new at all and the room smelled to dirty feet the two days. The second day and after spending all day out we found our room not done at 6pm! I asked for an iron at the front desk and later on the phone and I am still waiting for it! The hotel does not fulfill what we should expect from a 4* hotel. We did not even try to have breakfast there and had it downstairs at the food area where there was a Wendy's and a large variety of shops: bakery, fruit juices and all the types of noodles you can imagine to eat there or take away. There is a walking distance to the Little India district and to the nice Kampong Glam area were in August they have a Gastronomic fair with stands in the streets close to the Sultan Mosque. Only go there if you are going to spend few days for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “interesting pros + cons”
Reviews.Author: style c
Reviews.Content: Pros : Location ! right on top of MRT/ a new building/ try to be a designer boutique hotel range with mini bar, hot water kettle, etc/ always busy / quiet at nights even with more than hundreds of people Cons: Air-Con - does not have instruction in room to adjust and had to ask a few times for help as the staff didn't know how to work this either / NO even training of the staff to be helpful or solve problems/

Reviews.Title: “Small but convenient for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Geraforce
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new.Rooms are small but rather comfortable.Unsuitable for family Pros : 24h food court and MRT station (EW green) behind the hotel,near City Hall Cons : small room, no free wifi (you will be charged 10 S$ for 24hrs from first log in, no soap for hand washing and no wastebasket in restroom ,simple breakfast

Reviews.Title: “I shd say I don't wish to go back to Singapore, so definitely won't be able to stay at the hotel any more”
Reviews.Author: Crystalwjj
Reviews.Content: Maybe becoz so many down comments I've read, I don't really have any expectations in their service, so there is nothing in particular new comments for that part, nothing worse than other people's comments. But most of the people said it's new and the facility was good, however I found the sound proof of the wall is basically nothing, when we tried to get some sleep after long day sight seeing in the city, there was a naughty boy running in the corridor and we felt it just like no wall in between at all! and the room was very small, bath room very small too, but the bed was comfortable. And Singapore was not attractive to me at all, I wish I don't need to go again, so there is nothing to say about the future staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DISHONEST MANAGEMENT & FILTHY”
Reviews.Author: ellen3011
Reviews.Content: This 4 star(?) hotel had been open only a month and on arrival the toilet and cistern area were still COVERED with fingerprints after MANY people had used and flushed the toilet. The floors and tops were dusty etc. Rang and 2 manager's came and cleaned room. Next day came home at 8pm only to room again not cleaned properly i.e. talc used in the morning still over the floor and the mirror in room not even cleaned - this time the night manager came to clean the room. No ice available in hotel but I was told to nuy some outside near the railway. No Glasses in room only coffee cups and only one bedide table. Hallway carpets stink as the maids have no buckets - they wash the floor of the room with the mop (it is so dirty is is a VERY DARK BROWNISH GREY and the water then drips onto the carpet. Complained to the Executive Assistant Manager who PROMISED me a refund of one night. Since then I have sent numerous emails all to no avail. Pretty dishonest in my opinion as he once wrote that Agoda still had the money not the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very unclean and unhygienic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kamran B
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we have stayed in during our Asian holiday. - Unclean room, food crumbles on bed sheets - Very slow internet (they charge $10 per day) - Bathroom shower drain was full of hair and was never cleaned - Dirty fridge Just too small - no iron or ironing board. Just very basic. Only good thing is that it is above the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toyia
Reviews.Content: I had a few days solo in Singapore enroute to Malaysia for work. Chose this hotel for price and location. It is rather new, very clean, first class with great service. It is located in Little India, which doesn't have a lot in walking distance, but the subway is right there and 2 stops ($1.50) each way, you are downtown, close to all the huge malls and the Singapore river. I was delighted with the price, service and beauty of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel at a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: fcgsandoval
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a night last 23 July 2011. We had booked the room about a month before and was quite apprehensive due to the several bad feedback regarding this hotel. Fortunately, we were pleasantly surprised that most of the bad feedback were not true in our case. We arrived at the hotel at around 10:45 a.m. The lobby was not big and we noticed that the lobby area was always busy with the comings and goings of hotel guests and staff. We didn't mind this, however, since we didn't plan on staying at the lobby too much. At the front desk, we were greeted by the front desk officer, who happened to be a fellow Filipino. After verifying our reservation, he checked their system and found an available room for us. We were hoping to get a city view room but given that an early check-in was more important for us than a good view, we agreed to an inner view room instead. An inner view room (I'm not sure what they call it exactly) doesn't have much a view as all you would see would be the other half of the hotel (with the swimming pool between the two halves several floors below). Since we didn't have much luggage, we took care of bringing our stuff up to the room ourselves. The room itself was very small - there was just enough space to fit the queen-sized bed, a small working table with the LCD-TV beside it. The bathroom was very tight, with the shower cubicle just big enough to accomplish its purpose. Despite these shortcomings, the room was very clean, the airconditioner was extremely quiet, and the overall design of the room was space-efficient for its size. The hotel did not provide free wifi internet access. Instead, they charge 10 Singapore dollars per day. Alternatively, to if you just plan to shoot out an email and not stay connected for long, there are three or four desktops in the small business center at the lobby where you get charged 4 Singapore dollars for every 30 minutes of use. We just got a room-only accommodation so we didn't get the chance to sample the food in the hotel. Besides, we wanted to try our luck at the local hawker centre that we read about here in Trip Advisor. Right beside the hotel was a Kopi Tiam, or a foodcourt, where we found a great variety of dishes to try. We ate lunch and dinner here that day. There is also a Wendy's beside the Kopi Tiam for those with burger cravings. Also right next to the hotel is the Lavender MRT Station, which can take you virtually anywhere in Singapore - very convenient! One other item that might be beneficial to future travellers to Singapore - we wanted to call home from the hotel (since the roaming functions of our cellphones didn't work for the first day) and upon advice from the front desk, we purchased an international call card for 10 Singapore dollars. With this card, we could call any international number from any phone and based on my computation, the card had about 60 minutes worth of call time. Not bad at all! We checked out early the next day because we expected to be out all day and wouldn't be able to go back at lunchtime to check-out. We also had a previous reservation for our next two nights in Singapore at the Mandarin Oriental. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for people in search of a nice, clean hotel at a very reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: We were a little skeptical about this hotel before we reached there,after a quick check in by the receptionist we went straight to the room.The room was small around 18-20 sm however the design and the colour of the furniture was rightly chosen.The long window added to its glory.The hotel has a small gym and a great pool.This would be ideal for tourists or business people who would spend less time in the room and more outdoor .Overall GooD.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Affordable....”
Reviews.Author: ShanghaiGoofy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights @ the V and enjoyed our Singapore stopover. The rooms are a little noisy with many loud guests from china. However comfortable and seems to have good room cleaning. In addition has a reasonable pool that is on the 4th floor. In my opinion what they are missing is that they should provide free wifi ! A nearby hawker centre provides a good local option.

Reviews.Title: “DON;T WASTE YOUR MONEY - PAY EXTRA AND STAY ELSE WHERE”
Reviews.Author: Ginging
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days. Upon arrival we were greeted with unfriendly and very sullen reception. The rooms although new were no bigger than my bathroom. The shower recess was built for stick insects. The breakfast was appauling - truely! The only positive comment I can make is that the MRT from Changi Airport takes you virtually to the front of the hotel. May I strongly suggest that you pay a few extra dollars and make your trip to Singapore whether it be for business or pleasure a much nicer experience. For those who have children - don't even consider staying here. Overall, not a very nice stay - take the reviews seriously and then think twice and then think again before even considering this place! Very poor value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and new but unclean and cramped”
Reviews.Author: Dishmoptop
Reviews.Content: This hotel might be new but it wasn't very clean in our room (bathroom) with soap scum on the shower, spotty mirror and unwashed floor. We stayed 3 nights in a 'superior room' but after the first night they again didn't clean the room. When we spoke to the chap on reception he told us that they were too busy to clean all of the rooms. He compensated us with a wifi voucher and sent someone with toilet rolls etc as we had run out. Also, there is no electric plug in the bathroom for shavers and blow dryers etc. Where there is a plug (just one in the room), there is no mirror. The room is very small but OK for short term. We had two single beds and it was very tight for space.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best.......”
Reviews.Author: beafybum
Reviews.Content: V Hotel Lavender is situated in the Lavender district of Singapore and is a average hotle. The hotel room space is not tat great but under the hotel is a bustling shopping parade and very handy MRT station next to the hotloe. There is a great resturant across the road (it is not cheap) where presentation and high standard food is very little of what they can offer- families welcome. Going on room size, there isnt much room around the bed and the cuboard and you need to be careful not to let the doors slam. The service isnt great and the cleaners only change the bed, empty the bin and change the towels so there is only a slap dash clean up. The window sill is more like a park bench as it is very big. There is a safe in the room and internet access has to be paid for, other than that, the corridors can be noisy and you can hear the lifts.Tthere is flat screen TV's with channels on them, but the rooms are basic. Also be aware of the taxi rank right outside the hotel doors and the trolleys where the hotel staff can transport your luggage. There is very nice greetings as you enter as the staff are friendly and hold the door open for you. Other than that, enjoy your stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money..will recommend except for those looking for luxury”
Reviews.Author: Santhosh023
Reviews.Content: Was there for four nights in last week of June2011. The location was fantastic,just above the Lavender Metro station and to the bus stand on Kallang road. 24hrs Kopitiam is there and other shops too.Rooms and restroom were relatively small but only those looking for luxury wud complaint.on the whole value for money. PS: those looking to travel to Little India( go the bus stand at Kallang Road), a free shuttle service bus between City Square Mall(Eco mall) and Kallang Road operates every 30mins from morning to night and the mall is just adjacent to Mustafa Shopping Centre in Litlle India

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for short stay”
Reviews.Author: PawelWu
Reviews.Content: We decided on V hotel Lavender because of promo rates and are very happy with the choice. Stayed for 1 night only. We haven't encountered any problems. Check in and check out were very quick, wait for lifts - bearable, there was no crowd in the lobby nor in the pool area. The best thing about the hotel is its location - directly at MRT Lavender station. Quick access to Changi and to Singapore downtown. The room (we had a triple) is small, but well designed - with huge mirror and huge window creating the impression of it being much bigger. The bed was comfortable, and the view quite nice. The hotel also has a good, big pool. What more does one need for a short stay? Maybe free wifi - here it costs 10 sgd.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Toddl68
Reviews.Content: We were on a stopover in Singapore for 4 nights. For this the hotel was perfect. We are 2 adults and 1 9 yo boy and had a family room in the 13th floor - room 1330 - with view towards the Singapore flyer. Sure the room was small but new, beds were comfortably hard. Location above Lavender MRT is good. Pool area is nice. And yes you can shower in the cubicle. Im 197 cm and 95 kg and was able to shower inside there. Missing towels and too few toilet paper rolls could be solved easily by talking friendly to the house keeping lady on the floor. Most annyoing were the Chinese teenagers obviously Not knowing how to behave in a hotel and chatting on the hotel aisle in the middle of the night but this was solved by resolutely addressing them. All other stuff mentioned here in earlier posts is IMHO nitpickicking when seeing the price of 720 SGD for a family room for 4 nights wo breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: netteTasmania
Reviews.Content: My husband & myself flew in for a 3 night stopover on our way home from 7 weeks in Thailand. We stayed in hotels from 3 star through to 5 star. We were not sure what to expect after reading the previous reviews but thought being so new and for 3 nights it should be fine. Check-in was quick, luggage at our room before we were. No problems getting the lift with-in a few minutes during our whole stay. First impression of the room was good, we knew it would be small but the bathroom is smaller than small. Ok for us as we were both able to fit through the tiny shower doorway, but if you are a larger person you wouldn't have a hope. Good blockout on the curtains. Good quality linens, and there was all the normal bathroom toiletries right down to a toothbrush. But that's where the good ended. We were not told where the breakfast room was, and there was no compendium to tell you anything about the hotel. Apparently, according to their website, there is a restaurant and room service.???? We found the restauant, only from the writting next to button 4 in the lift, but it was never open when ever we tried to go to it. Our room was serviced at 4.30pm on the first day, on the second day they came to do it at 7pm, we opted to just take the two new waters and two new teabags & fresh towels and left it at that. BUT he very worst thing is there is absolutlely NO sound-proofing at all. There is a doorbell on everey door which I have never encountered before. The hotel has 880 rooms, when we were there (last week July), we think 800 of them were full of children & teenagers. The noise was incredible, running up and down the halls, yelling out to each other, ringing of doorbells & the noise from the rooms either side of you. We had no sleep at all on the first night dispite resorting to sleeping tablets. We returned to the hotel for our second night in the late afternoon and by 9pm we could not stand the noise any longer and went to reception to see if we could request a room change. The young gentleman at reception was lovely, and did not even hesitate to change us to a hopefully quieter floor. We were moved to the eighth floor where there was carpeting in the hallways which did help to muffle some of the noise. Our safe didn't work and emitted a continual beep, the staff came promptly to see if they could fix it, but they were not able to, so the batteries had to be removed so we didn't have to listen to it beep all night. Not having the safe wasn't a huge drama as we don't travel with many valuables and reception looked after these while we were out of a day. It was quieter & we got some sleep on the second night though again had to resort to sleeping tablets. The third night was just a repeat of the first. There are bus load after bus load of groups being dropped off, nearly every time we went through reception another lot were arriving or leaving. We found the staff at the reception desk to be helpfull and they were handling a lot of complaints, which they did very well. The porter did try and charge us for bringing our luggage down, but we were not advised there was a charge nor as I said is it written anywhere. We were given a slightly extended checkout till 2pm as we had a late night flight. We left our luggage and went out for a while as our flight wasn't until 9pm. When we returned we asked where we could change clothing for our return to our cold home and were told we could use the facilities on the fourth floor at the gym & pool. These "facilities" were a disabled toilet which was locked. 6 toilets, 4 of which were locked and the one that was vacant was small and not clean. We opted to take turns to, use one of the two shower stalls that was not being used to change in. Fortunatley it was dry and sllightly bigger than the toilets. The chef was chaning in the toilets too, so they obviously don't have rooms for staff to use either. The gym is tiny with no change rooms at all. The hotel is very convieniently located as has been said before, and yes there is a food court underneath, but it is exactly that, not a restaurant, food was tastey, but not hot unless you got one of the soups that were constantly boiling, and it is very noisey in side. There is no restaurant nearby that we could find, nor could the staff tell us of any. So to sum it up we won't be back. If they had sound proofed to some degree it may have been a good place, so it's a pity really. Sorry but I can only say if you've booked & want to chance it, go armed with plenty of sleeping pills & earplugs! We would have been really upset if we had paid their full price, but we had booked in there opening specials, but it still wasn't worth that.

Reviews.Title: “Just book it now!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gomed
Reviews.Content: I prefer this hotel than Parc Sovereign. It was a brand new hotel with very convenience location. It's located above Lavender subway Exit B. Nice surrounding with 24 hours Kopitiam and many more eateris. Nice pool and breakfast was adequate. For SGD150, i would defenitely recommend this hotel. It was 10 am and there was a swamp of tourists at the lobby when we checked in, but the recepcionist let us check in earlier without extra charge. Room was small but adequate for not more than 2 pax. Look nowhere else, this the one!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: RACR52
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I flew into Singapore in the evening to stay overnight. Got MRT direct to Lavender station and hotel just above the MRT. Foodcourt also very close by. Hotel clean and advantage of easy access from MRT and getting to and from airport without having to walk far. Downside was light switch was for room and bathroom so could be tricky if one has to get up during the night. Overall good value for money and convenience for an overnight stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: ehack
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Agoda and weren't exactly sure what to expect, since the hotel was brand new at the time (built in May/June 2011) and there were few existing reviews online. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel, as it was directly above the Lavender MRT station (on the EW line) and looked very nice from the lobby. The room was beautiful and had TV included with the rate (given the newness of the hotel we lucked out and got a promotional rate, which was much cheaper than the other options around; other similar hotels in this area offered similar rooms for ~ $150 SG and above). The hotel also had a really nice outdoor pool and fitness center (two things other comparable hotels in the area did not seem to often offer). Internet access was not included in the rate, and was $10 SG per night. The hotel's location was probably one of its best features. It was very easy to get downtown and also to the airport (which is at the end of the EW line). There are also a variety of food options at the Lavender station, and the stadium is located quite close to this station.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Borreman
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 night only. The hotel is very well located, right by the Lanvender subway station, and only a couple stops from the marina. There is also a nice local food court / food gallery right next door. Excellent for late dinner or to get breakfast. The hotel is well appointed, with a very nice pool area and a small gym facing it. The rooms are super tiny but clean. I dont remember seeing rooms that tiny beside in Japan. If you are a solo traveler, it is not so much of a problem. 2 persons is the max you can fit in. I definitely would not recommend this hotel for families! The bathroom is as small as the room (per ratio), but clean and efficient. The shower area is very small too. Everything looked new in this hotel and that was a plus. There is wifi and internet available in the rooms at an extra charge. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for short stays of 1 or 2 nights. Definitely not the kind of hotel you want to be in for the long haul, especially if you are claustrophobic lol

Reviews.Title: “Functional with great central location”
Reviews.Author: JPWatt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of June beginning on July. Very very convenient location - Lavender MRT is on the East-West Green Line, same as the line to and from the airport so you dont have to change lines. Lavender station is also just under the hotel. Busy food court and food stalls outside hotel. Location is definitely the best part of this hotel, would stay here again just because of the location. So convenient whether you are using the MRT or taxiing as all taxi drivers know where hotel is. Location is also close to Clark Quay, Orchard Road, Bugis etc so taxi fare is usually around $5 - $8SG. Hotel room is modern and new, everything was cleaned daily for us and amenities replaced. Hotel gives body wash, moisturiser, shampoo, toothbrushes and sanitary stuff but no SOAP which is weird because you can't even wash your hands. Bathroom is very small but functional. Shower is good but small also. House keeping took one of our key cards because we left it in the slot to keep the air con going. We only found this out when we went to reception to ask about our lost key. Apparently this is standard so dont leave your spare key card in the slot. House keeping also took our tv remote away for some reason and we had to go to reception and get a new " universal " remote which didnt work. we had to turn tv on/off manually. We stayed in rm 1201. Would not recommend you stay in any rooms ending with 01 because these rooms have a window facing a concrete wall which seems literally about 50cms away. So there was no view, nothing. Bascially a window facing a cement wall. may as well as not had a window at all. Not good. Lifts - omg. there are 6 lifts at the hotel and during the morning, you have to wait a long time for the lifts beacuse so many people going up and down. as well as this, lifts stop on each level if button is pushed regardless of whether lift is jam packed or not. So catching the lift takes ages. Internet - our deal came with free wifi for the duration of our stay. when we checked in the lady gave us a voucher and said it was only valid for 24hrs from first use which we thought was a bit misleading. after complaining a few days later we were informed this was not the case and that vouchers were issued daily (ie: we had to go and collect a new voucher each day) because staff were concerned that people would sell off vouchers(??). Pool - we used once, quite cold I thought but it was fine. gym is bascially a tiny room with about 6 pieces of equipment so didn't both with that. Everyday there are bus loads of people who arrive so the morning is the busiest time. the lobby is always full of new people and peoples bags are always stacked around the lobby. Overall, location makes this hotel worth it because it is just so convenient. you can get anywhere around singapore from this hotel because the location is central and because the mrt is right underneath. despite all the negatives, if you want a functional, clean, modern convenient, basic hotel, stay here. I would stay here again just because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “There are better choices”
Reviews.Author: Fort-sg
Reviews.Content: Horrible service! Can hear people walking ard,can hear the lifts. Budget hotel in disguise. Stay elsewhere please

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: chryaven
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July 2011...a few months after it was open - I think they opened in May. The hotel is located 2 minutes walk from the MRT and they have a food court downstairs. Very convenient. Rooms are small, although new and simply furnished. No bedside lamp...which is annoying if you want to read in bed. Bathrooms minimal style, and new...however they don't have any face towels. Service is not great...but may be because they are newly opened. Overall, a nice new hotel, small rooms but great location especially for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: judith_76045
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new and, of course so clean. The guest room and bathroom are relative small, but the bed is comfortable. The most interesting of this room is a big glass window so we can see the view of buildings and panorama nearby this hotel. We arrived at 10 o'clock in ther morning and the front office staff allowed us to check in and our room was ready at that time. But, the next day, Housekeeper did not clean our room until we call them to clean. Maybe, this hotel is so full booked and a little bit crowded with so many guests. Hotel location is directly above the Lavender station of MRT, it's mean that so easy to reach the hotel from Changi airport and convenience to go everywhere you want to go, by MRT. There are number of foods outside this hotel. The most recomended of this hotel are : the cleanliness and good location.

Reviews.Title: “what a waste of an opportunity”
Reviews.Author: Seasoned_travelers_6
Reviews.Content: We had read mixed reviews of this hotel but decided to take a chance since we were only stopping in Singapore for 2 days. Our first impression was actually quite good. The location of the hotel is excellent as mentioned by many people - the MRT and buses are very convenient, the food court is good, the view from our room on the 12th floor is great, and there is even a free shuttle bus to the City Mall every half hour (whether you would want to go there or not is a different story though). The room itself is not that bad a size for a short stay (we were in a superior room) and everything was still relatively new. The fridge was empty which we really appreciated as we like being able to stock our own drinks and food for the late night snack. Then the bad parts started to emerge: 1. Electrical wiring was extremely poorly done! The light switches for the bed were next to the cupboard rather than the bed, the switch for the bathroom is outside of the room and is on the opposite side of the door handle, and there is no power point in the bathroom at all (you can forget about using your electric shaver or hairdryer there). The lights also flashed occasionally during the night as if there were short-circuit issues. 2. The elevator was very slow and random floor numbers light up by themselves, again as if due to short-circuit issues. Elevator that signalled going down ended up going up instead. It is usually very full and struggled to cope with the number of guests in the hotel. 3. There was only one toilet roll in the holder and no spare at all. This is the first hotel that we have ever stayed at with this issue. They did provide toothbrushes and tooth paste, but it would have been better to provide soap (there was none at all) and spare toilet rolls in our opinion. 4. On our final night, the fire alarm went off 3 times at around 2 am. A short announcement was made, but we were unable to hear it from within the room!!! By the time we got up and opened the door to try to listen, the announcement had stopped. We called the front desk and were advised that it was a false alarm, but it was enough to convince us that this is not the place to stay if you want to survive a fire or get a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Alison93
Reviews.Content: Booked online and were very pleased with the whole overall aspect of the hotel. Convenient to transportation but not to shops except by using their very efficient trains. Very helpful staff. eateries very close and own restaurant. Would recommend to families as I noticed rooms with mutiple beds.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing but ok value for money”
Reviews.Author: carla_NZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July 2011. After coming from Malaysia, Singapore accomodation prices were a big jump. So we found this place for around $S120 per night. Our first impressions were great - it is almost brand new and looks like a 5-star hotel. It is also locately very convientley above the Lavender MRT station, which is on the airport line.
