The check in staff were also friendly, and the room has lovely new decor. However, when we got to the room (around 6pm) it hadn't been made up property and was missing things like towels, toilet paper etc. Also the shower head was broken. These were probably just one-off things, so we weren't too worried. The major issue we had was noise. Despite being right at the end of the hall, away from the lifts, we always got woken up at night or early morning by other guests (or their children) in the corridor. The airconditioning was also freezing (although that is a general Singapore thing). We didn't use the pool at all but it had one. I am not sure if we would stay there again. The biggest advantage was its location above the MRT (it is also above a great coffee shop - Kopitam) and it was a reasonable price compared to similar hotels. My advice would be to ask for a quiet room on a floor away from 'package travel groups'.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not quite there yet with service/amenities”
Reviews.Author: skipitgood
Reviews.Content: I think this must be a very new hotel, which would explain why the rates were fairly low for the area and time of year. The hotel itself is very nice--they clearly thought about interior decoration and took pains to make nice-looking rooms. Overall, the hotel is fine and a decent value for the money, with average-size rooms, clean facilities, nice pool. However, it is clear that they are still learning the things that every hotel needs. It was the small things--only one bar of soap instead of 2 (one for the shower, one for the sink); one towel rack that fits one towel in a double room; no place to hang a hand towel; no bedside lamps; average service not fitting a hotel that looks this nice. I would recommend this hotel and certainly stay here again, but we found the small things missing to be an annoyance that, if the prices go up, would make it not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “I will never come back”
Reviews.Author: tiffbone
Reviews.Content: Pros: Right next to MRT station, clean Cons: Too small, bathroom shower leaks, extra towel/shampoo & stuff requires extra money, does not provide adding extra bed service, bad service, staff has bad attitudes, no necessary amentities like face towel, soap etc., toilet paper is crappy Understand that you pay for what you get, but this is just way beyond my expectation. Called front desk for extra bed, towels and other stuff, all I got was attitude. I was shocked to know extra towel and shampoo/conditioner/shower gel requires extra money! I tried to argue with them saying that you did not state that in your website or anything but they just kept on insisting that we have to pay for extra. I bugged them long enough for them to give them to me for free. The bathroom shower leaks water onto the floor all the time, so we are basically using a flooded bathroom. No face towel. Not even soap! There is only one trash can in the entire room. Everything about this place is just plain disappointment. I highly discourage anyone who tries to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: antlee313
Reviews.Content: I will never go to his hotel ever, the service is really bad, People there seems don't understand what is call hotel service. The room is small, we paid 3 people price, and end up stuck in one 2 people bedroom. People in reception has bad attitude, room service is the worse. We ask for more towel, and they offer to charge us $5 per towel. We asked for recommendation for food, they show us the food court. Overall, out of my life, this is the worse hotel i have ever lived in.

Reviews.Title: “Just so so”
Reviews.Author: worsnop
Reviews.Content: Breakfast bad, pool in shade all day, not inspiring. Fire alarm went off during our stay, no staff knew what to do, phoned downstairs was told false alarm. Speakers not in hotel rooms, only in corridor so not being able to hear clear enough for an emergency. Checkin in and out prompt however not friendly welcome, just hurried and looked stressed. Loads of tour buses unloading customers, clogging up entrance... Rooms small, reasonably cleaned, no face washers. Only positive close to mrt

Reviews.Title: “Modern room and probably the best value in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: alsch1111
Reviews.Content: I booked the premier room through asiatravel.com for about 150 Singapore dollars. The room is modern and spacious enough, although the bathroom and shower is a bit small. The bed is wonderful. The hotel has a pool, exercise room, and restaurant on the 4th floor. Everything seems pretty new and modern. Try to get a room on a high floor looking out to the water. The area is good. The hotel is right above the Lavender MRT station on the east west line. That means that you have a direct connection to Changi airport. There are food shops all around the hotel (including a Wendy's) selling good food cheap. Evidence that this is one of the best values in Singapore is the hordes of Asian tour groups mobbing the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service!!”
Reviews.Author: AdeNgan
Reviews.Content: Omg! The room service doesn't do her job. The coffee cup & dustbin was not clean after our 2nd day. Many things like not organize well...Small room, No hotel parking, no hand & face towel, no hand soap, no sanitary bag??? Everything just 'NO'. It doesn't worth the price! But it's convenience coz the MRT & Food court is juz right down the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for its price!”
Reviews.Author: g5llchen
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. The 24/7 food court is conveniently located right next to the hotel. Room was tiny but clean. Doors are loud. You can hear people shutting their doors in the middle of the night. In-room WiFi not working great. I have no complain about the hotel since its price tag is not too high.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice but customer service was bad”
Reviews.Author: yomitham
Reviews.Content: It was just last weekend when I was staying in this hotel. I did not have a problem with the room space or the room per say. But I do have a big problem with the customer service. The staff are very much not trained. On our first night, the fire alarm went off at midnight. No one knew what to do. The announcement over the PA system did not state what we should do. Everyone on our floor panic and started walking down the stairs in their pajamas. What seemed like 300 people standing aimlessly outside the hotel grounds, we just had no idea what was going on. There were no staff at the emergency stairs exit to direct us and for sure no one came out to let any of us know what was going on. All the reception staff was still around at the Reception Counter. Buses with tourists was still arriving. We waited for an hour watching police cars come by, fire engine come by with firemen walking around but that was it. No one came to announce to us if we should be worried or what really is happening. Finally, as most hotel guests went into the lobby demanding to know what was going on. We were all just told to walk back up the emergency exit stairs. Mind you, I walked all the way up 12 floors to get to my room at 1.30am. Throughout the night, the fire alarm was still ringing. After complains, all they said was, "You can get a refund if you wish to leave." In the wee hours, telling people to leave? If you want service, do not expect any from V Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough for the price”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterIL
Reviews.Content: Singapore hotels seem to come in two flavors: Economy (i.e. non-rated by the tourism board) and Super-expensive (think corporate accounts). We were happy to find a hotel that did not break the vacation budget. The V Lavender is nice enough if you are looking for a place to sleep and shower, and it is a very convenient location, but it is certainly not anywhere I want to spend any time lounging around. The rooms, as described by others, is ridiculously small. I'd say overall it's smaller than a cruise ship stateroom, with two small beds, a closet/desk console, an LCD TV and not much more. The huge windows faced the rooms in the opposite wing (AWKWARD) and no shade curtains. The bathroom is tiny, with a poorly designed shower stall, two total towels and no trash bin. The beds were very comfortable, though, and with a room near the wing's end we didn't hear too much hallway noise. The elevators are a nightmare: 5 for the entire complex. Going up to our room on the 15th floor entailed 6, 7, 8 stops. Overall it just felt the place was not designed for the number of guestrooms. During the day there are bags piled on carts lining the entire lobby and people are standing about because there is no place to sit. Tried calling the front desk and room service a couple of times: no answer. Now the good, the location above the MRT is fantastic, making everything in SIN easily accessible and convenient. The food just outside the hotel is wonderful and cheap, so I can't imagine wasting a cent in the hotel's restaurant. There's a Cheers convenience store on the ground floor as well. Overall, I agree with the other poster who said that as long as this hotel is new it will be a nice play to stay. Once its age starts to show, I see it catering to nothing but tour groups with minimal expectations. It served its purpose well for us and on the surface, the room itself is very nice; just look for any extra touches to make your stay more comfortable than the bare necessities.

Reviews.Title: “Some pros....more cons”
Reviews.Author: jadeblevens
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 3 reasons: Its one of the only hotels I could find in Singapore with 2 beds in the rooms that weren't 2 singles, the price was good compared to most hotels in Singapore and that it is right above an MRT station. Check in was fast, not super friendly staff but ok. Wifi is not included and it costs $10 a day. You are given small piece of paper for each day of your stay (i'll get to this later). I requested a high floor when I reserved and was given floor 6 out of 15. We checked into a triple room (as we were traveling with our 3 year old son). The room is WAY WAY WAY smaller than the photos on the website make it look but this is typical for Singapore. The bathroom is very small but adequate with good shower pressure. The first problem we encountered was a disgusting stain on one of the throw pillows on the bed, it looked like someone had been sick on it!! It was a massive stain! The next issue was there was a small pipe coming out of the wall beside the toilet that started flowing water onto our bathroom floor then draining into the shower??? Where the heck was this water coming from??!!! On our way out for the night I told the desk about the water, they offered to send someone right away but we were going out and I didn't want anyone in my room when we were gone. By the time we got back I had forgotten and it wasn't doing it anymore. I logged onto the internet using the code they gave me and kept on getting kicked off every few min. I went to the desk and told them the problem and it turns out that as my husband and I each had out own laptop only 1 person could use the code at one time. So we had to each get our own codes. Every time your computer "goes to sleep" or my iphone self locks after a few min the internet cuts off and you have to log in again. VERY annoying when you have to use your laptop for business and are on and off it all day!!! For a brand new hotel one would think wifi would be included and not have a daily/per person code system that logs you off all the time. There were only 2 pillows on the double bed so I called down and asked for 2 more (my husband and I like 2 each), about 30min later they brought 1 up. The bed was one of the most uncomfortable beds I have ever slept on! Not to mention the sheets were so scratchy and itchy. Im not sure if its because they are new but I found the bed and sheets horrible! The hallway is tile and so noise travels very easily. You can hear EVERYTHING from the hallway, people walking up and down, people opening and closing their doors, waiting for the elevator!! It was awful. All night long I could hear people talking in the hallway. When we left the room the next morning I left the disgusting stained pillow (stain facing up) on the floor by the door and when we came home it was back on the bed!!!! Also, the water started pouring out of the bathroom wall again!! This time way worse and it didnt stop, it looked like clean water but it wasn't ok! It was wetting half the bathroom floor. We had had enough!!! My husband went to the front desk and told them all of our issues and asked for a new room and with no issues at all they gave us a new one. This time we were one floor up and the hallway had carpet!!! Well that solved the noise problem instantly!! There was the same drain coming out of the wall in the bathroom but it didnt leak or pour water once. I did use the in room coffee and tea maker once and housekeeping did not clean the cup or sppon when they serviced the room. The fire alarm went off in the middle of the night for about 40min on and off but it was a false alarm. Other things to note: - Not many tv channels and only a few in english - no face wash cloths given in the bathroom - no pens or note pads in the room - 2 bottles of water provided each day PROS - Great price for Singapore - Located right above MRT station - Food court directly downstairs (mainly local food but a Wendy's) - New hotel - Triple room available CONS - Wifi is not free and you have to log on with a code each time and a new code every 24 hours, also each person with a laptop needs their own code - Uncomfortable beds and sheets - Very noisy

Reviews.Title: “Brand new Hotel in Singapore and Location is accessible to MRT”
Reviews.Author: Flipzter
Reviews.Content: Brand new Hotel in Singapore and Location is accessible to everything Booked a room here last 10-13 June, 2011 with a Premium Room and we booked another stay here last 25-27 June, 2011 for a Superior Room. During our second stay, I was the one who booked the room via www.hotelclub.com. It is an urgent trip so the booking on the Hotel was made a day before the check-in. I had a terrible experience here with the Hotel Receptionist and I even talk to the Manager. They made me to wait for almost 1 hour plus just to locate for my booking confirmation from the Hotel Club. They even wanted me to pay for another S$150 but I refused to pay because the room is already paid by Hotel Club. I was so angry and after 1 hour of waiting they already let me have the keycard. I am glad that the Hotel Receptionist is very apologetic as they really cannot see my booking confirmation. So, for me it is already good enough. The Hotel's location is very accessible to MRT and Bus Stops in Singapore. There are also a lot of Food Stalls like Kopitiam, Wendy's, Old Chang Kee and others outside the Hotel. Overall, it was a pleasant stay. And if we needed to get a room urgently again I will do try to book as early as possible to avoid this incident again. Nevertheless, I am still happy with V Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New and Affordable for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: lezwas
Reviews.Content: It is very new and doesn't have a restaurant as yet, but there is food shops all around the building. The gym and pool are lovely. And it is right above the MRT, which is so easy to get around. I would stay there again.We booked on the Air Asia site..

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: fmc208
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with two daughters who wanted to just shop in Orchard Road/Ion Centre. We had two nights in Singapore which is really only one full day so we were not planning on being in the hotel for any lenght of time. We caught a taxi from Changi Airport for about $26SING . The check in was very quick and efficient . Our room was a triple it was $160 Sing thru Agoda .... clean, small and new. Shower small about 900mm x 800 mm but pressure good and tiled. No soap ... so perhaps bring your own!!! Water bottles supplied each day Very easy/quick MRT ride (two/3 stops to Orchard or Somerset) $1.90 each If it is raining so much quicker on MRT than trying to get a taxi We did not have any food/breakfast at V Hotel so cannot comment Check Out very efficient and fast. MRT to Airport very easy .... $1.90 each but also quicker and gets you into Terminal 2. No traffic worries You have to change lines but it is very easy as just get off MRT and go to the other side of platform. Downside: The rooms are not practically soundproof .....the shower glass doors need to be cleaned more. Overall ...if you are wanting a reasonable hotel in Singapore so you can access Orchard Road and not intending in spending time in your room ... this is a really good option. I hope they encourage their staff to maintain the hotel as this will be difficult for a new hotel with such large Group Bookings. (The foyer was very crowded with Groups wanting to leave or check in.) This hotel is good value for Singapore and I am glad that the tourist has this option in accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location but there are far better”
Reviews.Author: BaileyJack
Reviews.Content: Fairly new hotel so at the moment looks good but cheap furnishings so it won't last- Pros- New Hotel Convenient location right on top of Lavender MRT Price is fairly cheap for singapore Good food right underneath Breakfast was pretty good Cons- Poor Service- rooms often weren't done till after 8pm! then floors not cleaned rubbish not removed- Sheets were not changed the entire trip 7 days!!! Rooms extremely small & bathroom even smaller- small things like bin in bathroom- handtowels non existent Beds are fairly comfortable but don't ask for another pillow as they cant be bothered Had to ask numerous times for toilet paper- (our other travelling companions were bitten by bed bugs) Rooms are very noisy- doorbell next door sounds like its ringing in your room- hallway noise not filtered out Lifts- atrocious 5 lifts only for 800 rooms & when 2 go out of order you wait over 5 mins for the lift Service desk far to small for a hotel with that many rooms- checkout time horrendous-

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but for a reason”
Reviews.Author: Blondeanddangerous
Reviews.Content: I am just about to check out after staying at this hotel for 2 nights. Pros: - great location, it can't be denied. - plenty of food choices right outside - a short walk to Little India. Cons: - the noise is terrible. The walls and doors do nothing to keep out the slightest noise. This continues into the night as the hotel seems very busy. - the rooms are very small. I booked a triple but on arrival was told there were only queen rooms available. As a family with a small child the was not enough room. The hotel does not do extra beds as the rooms are so small. We had to book a second room. - every extra comes at a cost, which seems to be a standard 10 SGD for everything (Internet, phone calls, etc). To request anything extra you have to go down to the front desk. - service is either abrupt or overwhelming. Our porter wouldn't leave us alone on check in. I wouldn't come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “brand new hotel, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: nickthetraveller1
Reviews.Content: PROS: - great location - it is just next to the Lavender MRT station; - brand new hotel (we could have smelled fresh paint around the hotel); - great value for money; - food court which is open 24/7 just next to the etrance of the hotel; - nice long pool (hidden between two hotel wings, so there's actually no sunlight at all) CONS: - busy reception and slow check-in process; - twin room is so small, good for one guest. do not book it if you travel with your partner; - bathroom is a huge downside - it is very small, no bathtub, just a tiny shower, only two towels in total. no waste bin, usual toiletries and such a bad smell of sewage!! - we had to keep our curtains closed all the time. if we had them opened we wouldn't have had any privacy, because the opposite hotel wing is just a couple of meters away. Pitty, cause windows are huge and would be so great having some daylight in that tiny room. My recommendation: ask for the room that is not facing the pool! - empty mini bar All in all, I would stay here again, but only if I am travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK room”
Reviews.Author: Zara'sMama
Reviews.Content: We booked this place because of it's reasonable price for a room with 1 queen + 1 single. The hotel is right in the housing estate of Lavender, with Lavender MRT station just downstairs, making it extremely convenient to move about. There's lots of small eateries just outside of the hotel : Chang Kee, a bakery, Kopitian chain, Wendy's, Herbal tea stall, soy bean stall etc. If that's not enough, walk about 200m, and you'll find a couple of small local food courts. So food is not a problem. The room is small but functional, with toilet too crammed if more than 1 person is in it. I have 2 young children with me, and bathing them is a bit of a problem in the small shower cubicle. We were there a couple of days after the hotel is opened, there's still dust every where, but the room is clean (and I hope they'll maintain this). Sound proofing of the room is good, aircon strong, matress firm and comfy, towels are thick and fresh smelling. The swimming pool is a plus point. My children wanted to spend their whole holiday at the pool. House keeping was making lots of mistakes, one day forgetting the towel, another forgetting to replenish the tea bags, etc. However, when we called to inform front desk, they were quick to address the problem. Stay here if you want conevenience, easily accessable to local food and MRT, it's likely that we'll come here again if they don't hike up the price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much, you get what you pay for... maybe even less”
Reviews.Author: tez0003
Reviews.Content: We chose the V hotel because we thought it was cheap for Singapore and it would tie us over for our 24 hour transit. It was cheap but didn't expect it to be so nasty. Don't expect a good night sleep. Rooms are extremely noisy and not soundproof at all. You can hear everything from the baby crying 5 doors down to kids running up and down the corridor "for fun" it would seem. Don't expect service. The staff we dealt with on numerous occasions were uninformed and outright rude. Extracting information from them was like drawing blood. For example, upon check in they didn't tell us anything about breakfast. When we found our own way there the next morning we were told we had to go and get a breakfast voucher from front desk (why weren't we given this when we checked in?) but that breakfast would only be open for another 12 minutes so maybe don't even bother. We got there in the end, and breakfast was fairly ordinary anyway. We also inquired about the taxi fare to the airport because we wanted to make sure we had enough cash to pay. The front desk told us it would cost over SGD35 which seemed like a lot considering it only cost us SGD21 on the way in from the airport at the same time of day. When we questioned the guy at front desk, the night manager in fact, he responded with "sir - SGD21 wouldn't even get to my house let alone the airport". Completely useless and disrespectful remark. The taxi ended up costing SGD20. Don't expect a "new" hotel - Upon arrival, it all looks quite promising, the lobby looks nice and clean, it ends there. Despite being a new hotel, the rooms already smelt stale, the washbasin leaked big puddles onto the floor, towels weren't clean (think hairs in the towels). Being above an MRT station on the airport line is probably the best thing going for this place. Otherwise, the location itself is not that convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever!!”
Reviews.Author: dtai010
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great location, right above a MRT station, food court etc, and i'ts only few stops from city centre. Very convenient location, but forget about taxi, the traffic around the hotel is terrible, you are much better off with MRT. Now the hotel room is tiny (smallest I've ever seen), but given it's price, I think that is acceptable. The room is not properly cleaned (under the bed, mirror, signs of leaking sinks etc) which I think is still ok if I lowered my standard to a budget hotel. The worst part is that they do not do house cleaning 3 days in a row. What happened was, after I returned to hotel on the second day at around 9pm, the room was not cleaned. I complained to the reception and asked for clean towers (it's too late and I just wanted to rest). The next day, after I came back at 8pm, guess what, it was still not cleaned after the reception assured that it will be cleaned. Then I had to go out for 30 min so that they can clean it. Now, next day, I came back at 7pm, and the room was not cleaned again. I complained to the manager again, all he did was telling me "this has not happened before", and I was like "how is that helping me?". Anyway, my verdict is, this is the worst service I had encountered ever, and I am surprised that it is in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel & Value for Money & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SnapperChennai
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1night on 16 June, 2011. Good location, just above LAVENDER MRT & 3 minutes walk to hotel lobby. Check-in & Check-out was quick and smooth. Rooms are comfortable, toilets clean. Shower cubicles can be slightly bigger, however no great issue. Hotel is new, clean and bustling with activities. 711 is near by and plenty of food stalls in KOPITIAM which is 1 minute walk when you walk out of lobby. Taxi available 24 hrs. Good value for money, paid S$150 nett per night. Also don't bother where you stay in Singapore as you travel the entire length & breadth in 20 minutes, also MRT is just below this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy”
Reviews.Author: Rasputin_HK
Reviews.Content: Aint staying here ever . Lousy service. Housekeeping came in at at 7 PM ( when complained at the reception, they replied by saying they have some issues with shifts and people - as if i give a damn !!! ) Saving grace the bathrooms were clean !!!

Reviews.Title: “New & clean and basic hotel. Great Location. Poor sound proofing.”
Reviews.Author: totoro888
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for one night. Superior room on the 14th floor. Superior room has no view. You will be facing other superior rooms (quite near). So I kept the curtain drawn. As good as not having windows. Felt that the hotel room is clean, since it is new. Sound proofing is quite poor. Not good for light sleeper as you can hear noise from next door and along the walkway. I had a lousy neighbour, lots of banging sound caused by opening of door and cabinet disturbed my sleep past midnight. So inconsiderate. Location is great (EXCELLENT) as it is above Lavender MRT station which is just 2 stops from Cityhall MRT (heart of the city). Do not have to worry about getting wet even if it rains as the entire journey to the MRT station is sheltered. The location is convenient to get to any part of the city. Part of the hotel are shops that serve very affordable local food. The hotel seems to be popular with tour groups from countries like India. Can expect the lobby to get quite crowded at time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But...”
Reviews.Author: StillPhone
Reviews.Content: There is no disputing that the location of this new hotel is great as it literally sits on top of Lavender MRT. The local area is very 'local' which is great as you can eat in numerous Hawker Centres for basically nothing and the food is great. You're need to get an MRT to Western Shopping malls if that's your thing. The rooms are small but fine. The TV, Aircon, etc all work although the room only has one plug so an adapter could be handy. This is a new hotel and there are definately teething problems. During my stay of ten nights they forgot to service the room six times. The remote control for the TV disappeared during a room service session as did all the toilet paper. The hotel appears to be a favorite for mainland Chinese so can be very crowded and noisy. Brace yourself for the lifts stopping at every floor as people seem to always press both buttons to call a lift. Overall the hotel is fine and better than many budget hotels I've used in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: worsnop
Reviews.Content: Goodness the photos on the website look far better than they are...for a new hotel, not very clean...also breakfast should in be in the room rate, then it might be value for money...rooms so so tiny and bathroom...staff need to take smiling lessons, we are the customers and keeping them in a job, however you always seem to be disturbing them when you ask for any details or directions...Not a friendly hotel. For a new hotel they should be jumping out to help you....We are the paying guests, that will recommend the hotel in future....don'think so!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “CONVENIENTLY LOCATED, STEPS FROM METRO STATION”
Reviews.Author: Braziliantraveler_10
Reviews.Content: Everything in the hotel is brand new and clean. The hotel is located in a very quiet place, so one has no problem to sleep. Also is very ease to go around using the MRT(Metro), since Lavender Station is just a few meters from the hotel. The swimming pool on the 4th floor is also very refreshing, especially after a long day of tour. On the other hand,the Wi-Fi internet system they use does not work properly. In addition, every day you have to get a new user name and password. Sometimes it falls when you are browsing, so you have to go downstairs to get the new password. It happened to me in the night time, when I was already in bed. I had to dress up and go downstairs to get the new password. They do not bring it to your room. As the hotel was recently open, the restaurant was still out of service.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings...”
Reviews.Author: huow
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in June at V Hotel. I choosed this hotel because it is a brand new hotel next a mrt station and with interesting rates. The hotel is right above Lavender station on the MRT line that links Changi airport to the city centre. About 20 mins ride to the airport and less than 10 mins to the city center. On the way from the station entrance to the hotel entrance there are a few food outlets including a 24h kopitiam for cheap local foods. My first night there was terrible: got a room on the 5th floor, the room had no in-room safe and fridge. As the aircon was not working well the temperature was hot in the room. Also there were very noisy groups of guests on the same floor shouting in the corridor all night long. The next day I asked for another room on another floor and was given a room on the 10th floor. This time it was better: the room had a in-room safe, a fridge, a working A/C and the floor was quieter. Had a good stayed for the 2 next days. The rooms are clean. They are also small but as I spent most of the time outside it was not an issue. The rooms are not well soundproof and noise from the corridor can be easily heard. The bathroom has no bathtub only a shower cabin. The water floods slightly from under the door of the cabin shower making the floor a bit slippery. Shampoo, shower gel, hair dryer are provided. A kettle, some tea and coffee are available. In-room wireless internet is chargeable. Internet stations are available at the lobby and are also chargeable. There is a long outdoor swimming pool. But the sun is hidden by the 2 tall wings of the hotel prevent to enjoy the sun. The lobby can be very busy and noisy at check-in and check-out time. Guests can leave their luggage after check-out free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: RajeshMajji
Reviews.Content: If you are on a vacation, this is not the best place to stay, the rooms are terribly small, in face to the extent you can't even strech yourself fully. The upkeep of the room is not good and there is no room service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and Dangerous Hotel!!!!!! Don't Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ch_Den
Reviews.Content: My mum stay there from 9th June-11th June. (she stay with my cousine.) I book this hotel , the only reason is good location, and clean, because it's new. 10th June night is my Wedding day, but after the party my mum can't get in to the room! The reception said mightbe the card got problem, and open another room for her on the same floor. BUT!!!! when my mum went out from the new room, she found there is another lady stay in her x-room! my cousin try to talk to the lady,becuase we just want to collect the luggages and clothes for sleep!!!!!!!!!!!! but the lady dont allow them go in. then, they go reception again. n now they said, "all your things is gone,please ask for reparation." And there is the same problem with my cousin's parents's room, but lucky, they r in the room. The lift, sometime we need to scan the doorcard n only can go the room floor. BUT SOMETIME IS NOT! That is so DANGEROUS!!! THIS IS The WORST HOTEL IN THE WORLD!!!! AND I have a BAD memory on my Big Day...... T_T

Reviews.Title: “Brand new and well located”
Reviews.Author: pony66
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel thru surfing as I need a hotel that is on the MRT line between Changi airport and city center for short stay. As a brand new hotel, there were some minor complaints regards to the housekeeping by some hotel guests. The common ones were the rooms not ready for check in. I believe it was due to very high occupancy rates in view of the low opening promotion rates and many tour groups. The hotel is located right above the Lavender MRT station. Reasonable priced food outlets are plentiful. There is a 24hours foodcourt. Lavender is only minutes away from all the downtown shopping / business venues. I wish they cut down on the tour groups business so that the lobby will not be too crowded and noisy. The room is well appointed for hotel of its category. I will not hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends and will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “its too convenient”
Reviews.Author: traveller_cnd
Reviews.Content: stay there 3 nights with my baby, the location is perfect as it is just above the mrt with foodstall just beside the hotel... u can get fruits, breadstall, local delicacies, fast food (Wendy's), n a 24 hr kopitiam (coffee shop or food court) so easily. the room is small and no extra bed can b provided... anyway... but we are able to sleep well... the room is clean everyday with fresh towels, with the price paid dun expect slippers and bathrobe so byo. but the provide toothbrush (change daily), shower gel, n hair dryer just under the drawer, have coffee tea facilities, fridge n safety box in the closet. my room is on 12th floor with window view facing the HDB flats so nothing interesting but at least can check out the weather... so its quiet enough for us to rest through the nite... LCD TV attach to the wall n u can watch till u sleep... with variety of channel k... the outdoor pool is nice but the only restaurant only serves breakfast but they got so many seats available for u to have ur lunch or even supper in their sky garden just next to the pool... great for family and friends. it only takes abt 2-3mins to reach mrt n 1 stop to bugis shopping mall... its perfect for us. if they are not going to increase the hotel rate in future, i surely stay there again n again...

Reviews.Title: “Location is better, my room is nice but staff are impolite”
Reviews.Author: ChelseyTS
Reviews.Content: the title says it all! i stayed in this hotel for 3 nights & bcoz i like the location i try to extend for another night by booking online trough the hotel's website. Yes my booking is confirmed & they send me an email w/the hotel voucher but when i goto the reception to pay they called the manager & to my surprise he told me in an instant that i dont have any bookings at all so i try to explained to him & he just said that my booking was cancelled & so i ask the reason they cant give any reason...poor management!

Reviews.Title: “nice place to live”
Reviews.Author: unyeuin
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at this hotel and was absolutely happy with it. Although the room is small, the service is good. The hotel has a great position which is near to airport, bugis... and has RMT right under the building. the staffs are also friendly and provide great help

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: dsim
Reviews.Content: Smack right above Lavender MRT station, superb location. There are shops and eating places (24hr Kopitiam, Wendy's, etc) on your way from the MRT exit to the hotel entrance. Internet PC available at lobby (i think with a charge). Hotel provides only 2 towels and a floor towel (no hand/face towel), request for additional towels is turned down. Bath room has shower only and the water can splash out through the bottom of the shower closet door even if it is closed properly. Floor in bedroom is tile and clean. Housekeeping is slow due to high occupancy during our stay (was told the hotel is full) and did not get our rooms clean up till late evening. The hotel charge for service to help with luggage on check out ($1 per bag). There is a taxi queue but you have to wait for taxi to come in to drop off passengers and was told by reception staff that there is no taxi-call service. In the end, we stopped a taxi at the road side outside hotel and requested it to drive to the hotel. Overall, we had a good stay, especially the location and access to eating places near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok...”
Reviews.Author: chopeta
Reviews.Content: Had stayed with V hotel last 14th May & it was ok except for some hiccups. I booked a superior room & checked in smoothly but upon reaching our room we realized that there was no mini-fridge. I checked again the website www.vhotel.sg & confirmed that it said that all rooms are equipped with mini fridge. I called front desk a few times as no one can give me a good answer. One staff said there’s really none for the room I booked, another one said will check & put me on hold for 5mins & the last one said will send someone up to ‘check’. All these made me upset. Until I called again & requested to speak to a manager, the guy who picked up said ok, when I told him not to put me on hold, he said he will get the manager & hang up on me! After a few minutes, the manager called me & I had to tell him the whole story, he was apologetic & upgraded us to premier room at a high floor with a nice view. The hotel itself is nice (perhaps because its very new, opened for a few days only). The neighbourhood is quite, for me what matters is the convenience of transport (lavender mrt is just next to it) & there’s a 24-hour kopitiam (food court) just below as well. There’s also Wendy’s, cheers etc. The lift is still having some problems as sometimes it cannot read the card once you tap. The room is clean & I believe it’s worth the price 110 SGD for superior & 140 SGD for premiere (considering there’s a pool & a gym). Attached are some photos, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Strategic location, but...”
Reviews.Author: m0nkii
Reviews.Content: The first day we arrived, there's no one to help us with our luggage, not even to help us open the door even when they saw us walking in with a bit of trouble. Then they assign us to a room with broken phone and leaking toilet. After a complain, they quickly give us a new room. We booked for a double premier room, the most largest type, but even the premier room feels a bit small comparing to regular room type of other hotels. My biggest complain is the AC and the housekeeping. At day, the AC is cool and nice, but I don't know why it seems to lost it's cool after midnight. For 4 nights staying there, I sweat a bit every night, and feels sticky in the morning. The housekeeping is terrible. 4 nights, and they didn't change our bed sheet at all. They didn't even give us coffee/tea bags and cups and spoon, we have to ask for it. They also never wipe the table. Once we saw a guest wearing a hotel room slipper, which we didn't get, so we ask for 2 slippers, then the guy who brought it ask for $2 and to pay him right then and there, I ask him whether it's the hotel's policy, and I told him to wait, after I got the money he was already gone, I think he thought I went to call his superior and got scared. I don't mind giving tips, but don't extort. The location of the hotel though, is very good. It's near Kopitiam, which is full of local delicacies, and the MRT is just next to it. Very strategic. I just hope they'll improve the housekeeping and fix the AC problem. Oh, and be careful of lift number PL2, it stopped in the middle for around 2 minutes, but luckily it works again.

Reviews.Title: “If only they cleaned the hotel very well, I would rate it a 5."”
Reviews.Author: ManFromTheEast
Reviews.Content: The good: location (right next to the mrt); new hotel (tastefully done interior); pool; gym (small but decent to get things done); check-in (in minutes); check-out (in seconds); price The bad: no internet connection in room (lobby is good to go and free); tiny shower cubicle and bit poorly designed (gets flooded) The ugly: dusty (room gets fixed up but not cleaned): from door handle to tea pot to bed headboard to floor... practically everywhere including the lobby, but the room is worse; not that they do not have the personnel to do it, it is more of the cleanliness standards that need to be checked

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back.....if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: frostini
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights last May a week after the hotel opened. I was a little worried because no review was written yet. We took a cab going to the hotel, since the hotel is new, the cab driver doesn't know where is it, so the best way to tell them is Lavender MRT across ICA (that's their immigration office). After arrival, a door man helped us carry our luggage in, but when i asked him some questions, he told me "no english" (found out that he only speaks chinese). Hmm...i wonder if i am in the right country ;) Lobby/Receptionist - the lobby was a little small and was crowded that time, was even more surprised that the counter was also crowded, counted 8 receptionist, no one checking in but they seems all busy. When i checked in, the receptionist was very business like, give him ur confirmation slip, he'll ask for ur credit card (they only accept visa or mastercard), sign it, give you ur key and that's it. NO hello, hi, thank u. no greetings at all. Same as when we checked out. Tell them ur checking out, give them ur keys and then that's it. It didnt infom me that they are done doing the check out, until i ask. Noticed that more groups were checking in as the days goes by. They also have a free internet at the lobby. Around 3 computers. Sometimes you have to queue to use it. Lift - they have a security card for every level. just need to tap ur card key and press your floors. Rooms - very basic, Flat screen tv, 2 complimentary bottle water, pot, coffee and tea sachet. no safetey deposit box, no fridge. We booked the superior room, the rooms is small (i think our cruise cabin in royal caribbean is bigger) there's no space for extra bed at all. So there's the queen size bed, 1 side table, a ledge besides the window where u can put ur luggage there or a sitting area. The room is clean (not carpeted). Toilet is very basic too. Shower room is very small. Location - no complains. Exactly above the Lavender MRT station. Beside the hotel there's Wendy's and 24 hours Kopitiam (food court) and a lot of small snacks shop. Across the hotel, there are some neighbor hood shops. The hotel is a very basic, if your purpose is to sleep and as long as it's clean attitude, then this hotel is for you. But if you want extra likes hospitality and after the amenities then i'm sorry to say, look for other hotel. Overall, if i happen to go back to singapore and they still have this promo rate. I will definitely book with them again.
